English: In 15th century, Albanian national hero Skanderbeg fought back the Turkish invaders. However after his death and the fall of Krujas and Shkodra the country came under four centuries of foreign rule. Large numbers of the population converted to Islam in the 16th and 17th century, allowing them to rise into the highest offices - eleven Grand Veziers came from Albania and Mohammed Ali founded a dynasty in Egypt in 1805. The Islamization brought support for the resistance against Serbs and Greek as well as against the Ottoman rule itself. Only at the end of the 19th century the national renaissance began with the founding of the League of Prizren. During the First Balkans War in 1912 the Albanian national congress in Vlore declared the country's independence which was accepted by the major powers in 1913 upon the condition that Wilhelms of Wied would be accepted as Prince. The outbreak of the Weltkrieg presented more problems for the country as Austria-Hungary demanded Albanian soldiers to fight alongside them. When Prince Wilhelm refused, citing the neutrality of Albania in the Treaty of London, the remuneration that he had been receiving was cut off. His regime collapsed and Prince Wilhelm left the country on September 3 1914 and joined the Imperial German Army, even if formally he still was the Albanian Head Of State. On 1921, the Peace with Honour officially determined the status of Albania: a restored principality under the authority of the Prince Wilhelm, not under Austrian influence anymore, but as a formal vassal of the Ottoman caliph. Even if revolts started to break out, Prince Wilhelm was able to regain control of the country thanks to the Ottoman support. However, the price he had to pay was the Ottoman control over the country's inner politics, such as forcing the Prince to appoint the very ambitious Ahmed Zogu as his Prime Minister.

Situated in the heart of Asia, Afghanistan had always been a pain in the back of the British. Situated between the Russian and British empires, the small nation of Afghanistan played an important part in 'the Great Game' between Petrograd and London. After a series of wars, Afghanistan was finally made to bend the knee and accept British suzerainty over its foreign policy in 1880. However, the triumph of the Central Powers and the shocking defeat of Britain's French ally on the European continent meant that the current Emir, Amanullah Khan, braved the might of the British Raj and launched a series of attacks across the Durand Line. The Third Anglo-Afghan War resulted in the complete independence of Afghanistan and the banishment of British influence over Kabul, granting Amanullah considerable leeway with the ultra-conservative Islamic clerics - thus allowing the Khan the chance to direct his country towards reform and modernity.  Whilst the process of modernization began to pick up pace and central authority became more profound so did conservative resentment rise sharply. As the country was about to descend into civil war over the course of reform, the British Raj collapsed. As Maharajas, politicians, saboteurs and Syndicalists fought each other and military governors became warlords, Amanullah rallied the nation around a continuation of the long history of warfare against British India. Pouring Afghan troops and tribesmen over the Durand Line, general Mohammed Nadir captured Peshawar and forced the provisional government in Delhi to secede the Frontier Provinces and the cities of Quetta and Peshawar, returning to Kabul as a hero and granting the beleaguered Khan a political respite as well as renewed support for modernization. Now, a decade later, Afghanistan is in a delicate position. Reform continues, but to the south Indian revanchism is growing and domestic resentment against Amanullah is still quite potent.
French: Les Britanniques ont toujours éprouvé des difficultés à maintenir l’équilibre en Afghanistan. Le “grand jeu” opposant l’Empire britannique et les Tsars russes au cours du 19e siècle se manifeste surtout par des tentatives successives de colonisation et de prise du pouvoir auxquelles les Afghans s’opposent avec force. L’émir afghan finit toutefois par céder, à l’issue de la deuxième guerre anglo-afghane en 1880, permettant de ce fait aux Britanniques de prendre le contrôle des affaires étrangères du pays. L’assassinat de l’émir afghan après la Grande Guerre pousse son fils à déclarer une nouvelle fois la guerre à la Grande-Bretagne qui finira par se retirer totalement du pays. Un cessez-le-feu reconnaissant l’indépendance de l’Afghanistan est signé en 1921. Une nouvelle constitution est mise en place dès 1923, suivie de près d’un long processus de modernisation... peut-être un peu trop rapide. Le nouveau roi est destitué au cours d’une révolte des tribus afghanes mécontentes de ses tentatives d’éradication des traditions ancestrales du pays. Forcé à l’exil vers la fin des années 1920, il cède la place au roi Nadir Chah qui poursuit en douceur les réformes de son prédécesseur. En 1936, le fils de Nadir Chah succède à son père après que celui ait été assassiné. Malgré le ressentiment persistant des chefs de tribu, rien ne semble troubler la prospérité du pays.
Italian: Per gli inglesi, l'Afghanistan ha sempre rappresentato una regione difficile da controllare. Pedina importante nella 'grande partita' fra l'impero britannico e gli zar russi durante il diciannovesimo secolo, ogni tentativo di sottomettere completamente il paese incontrò una fiera resistenza. Nel 1880, tuttavia, dopo la seconda guerra anglo-afgana, l'emiro dell'Afghanistan acconsentì agli inglesi di controllare gli affari esteri del paese. Dopo la Grande Guerra però, l'emiro venne assassinato e suo figlio intraprese presto un nuovo conflitto contro gli inglesi, fino a quando questi ultimi, ormai stanchi, si ritirarono completamente dal paese. Nel 1921, venne finalmente siglato il cessate il fuoco che garantiva all'Afghanistan una completa indipendenza. Nel 1923, con l'entrata in vigore della costituzione, ebbe inizio il lungo processo di modernizzazione... forse anche troppo velocemente. Alla fine degli anni '20, il neo eletto re, accusato di voler cancellare tradizioni secolari, venne deposto e costretto all'esilio da una rivolta guidata da un capotribù afgano. Il suo posto fu preso dal re Nadir Shah, che condusse le sue continue riforme a un ritmo più accettabile. Nel 1936, Nadir Shah venne assassinato e il suo posto fu preso dal figlio, ma nonostante le prolungate lotte fra i leader tribali, non c'erano segni di tumulti nell'immediato futuro del paese.
Spanish: Afganistán siempre fue una región demasiado turbulenta como para que los británicos pudiesen controlarla. Parte importante de la 'Gran Partida' entre el Imperio Británico y los zares de Rusia durante el siglo XIX, todos los intentos de sojuzgar el país se toparon con una encarnizada resistencia. Sin embargo, en 1880, tras la segunda guerra anglo-afgana, el emir de Afganistán accedió por fin a permitir que los británicos controlasen la política exterior del país. Pero el emir afgano fue asesinado tras la Gran Guerra y su hijo inició otra guerra más contra Inglaterra, hasta que los británicos, hastiados, aceptaron una retirada total del territorio. Por fin, en 1921 se firmó un alto el fuego que concedía a Afganistán la independencia absoluta. En 1923 se elaboró una constitución y dio comienzo el largo proceso de modernización... tal vez de manera demasiado apresurada. El recién coronado rey fue derrocado por una rebelión de las tribus, furiosas por los intentos de abolir tradiciones centenarias, y forzado a exiliarse a finales de los años 20. Fue sustituido por el rey Nadir Sha, que continuó con las reformas a un ritmo más moderado. Para 1936, Nadir Sha ha sido asesinado, y su hijo ha heredado el trono, pero, pese a persistentes rencillas entre líderes tribales, no hay indicios de que vaya a haber agitación en el país en un futuro inmediato.
German: Afghanistan war für die Briten schon immer eine schwer zu kontrollierende Problemzone gewesen. Als wichtiger Bestandteil des 'Great Game' zwischen Großbritannien und den russischen Zaren während des 19. Jahrhunderts war jeder Versuch, das Land völlig unter Kontrolle zu bekommen, auf schärfsten Widerstand getroffen. Nach dem zweiten anglo-afghanischen Krieg stimmte der Emir von Afghanistan schließlich im Jahre 1880 zu, den Briten die Kontrolle über die Außenbeziehungen des Landes zu überlassen. Nach dem ersten Weltkrieg wurde der Emir allerdings ermordet. Dessen Sohn begann einen neuen Krieg gegen Britannien, bis die kriegsmüden Briten endlich das Land komplett verließen. 1921 wurde endlich ein Waffenstillstand unterzeichnet, der Afghanistan völlige Unabhängigkeit gewährte. 1923 wurde eine Konstitution entworfen und ein langer Modernisierungsprozess begann... vielleicht etwas zu schnell. Der frisch gekrönte König wurde in einer Revolte afghanischer Stämme entthront, die über seine Versuche, jahrhundertealte Traditionen aufzulösen, aufgebaracht waren und ihn Ende der zwanziger Jahre ins Exil jagten. Er wurde von König King Nadir Shah ersetzt, der weitere Reformen maßvoller regelte. Im Jahr 1936 wurde Nadir Shahhas ermordet und sein Sohn bestieg den Thron. Trotz anhaltendem Unmuts unter den Stammesführern gibt es momentan keine Anzeichen für einen Aufstand im Land.

English: The Tuaregs are a semi-nomadic Berber people of the Sahara desert. Following the Tamanghasset Crisis, several clans have united and formed the Tuareg Federation in an attempt to resist the oppressive rule of National France. Will this tenue association of tribes last long enough, or will the French play one group against the other in order to subdue this rebellion ?

From 1880 Argentina enjoyed a period of economic boom and great prosperity based on the export of wheat and cattle, allowing the nation to achieve a moderate industrialisation, however, this period was ended abruptly with onset of the Great Depression in 1933. With unemployment rising rapidly and many export traders going bust Argentina fell into turmoil from which emerged a strong military cabinet, who seized control of the government in a coup with a pledge to end Argentina’s economic hardships and establish the nation firmly on the international stage.Argentina went to war with Bolivia in 1933, ostensibly over the attempted Bolivian annexation of Paraguay, which marked the beginning of the ‘Great South American War’. In 1934 Argentinean troops won a series of victories against the Bolivian forces and easily evicted them from occupied Paraguay, but in response Brazil declared war on Argentina, and her armed forces a rapid advance to the La Plata river, overrunning the tiny nation of Uruguay in the process.However, the Brazilian advance was halted at the La Plata as the war got bogged down in trench systems. In late 1934, Argentinean forces inflicted a further another series of devastating defeats on the Bolivians, and Bolivia was forced to sue for peace before the close of the year. This victory meant that Argentina was free to focus on Brazil, and they began a counter-attack in 1935, which succeeded in routing the Brazilian troops and ejecting them into Curitiba. With her home lands threatened and her forces in disarray Brazil sued for peace.Shortly after this great success the governments of Paraguay and Uruguay were ‘federated with Argentina, creating the Union of La Plata. In 1936, La Plata is still facing problems, not least that the people of Paraguay and Uruguay don’t feel any connection to the Union and nationalism is ripe. Also an already resurgent Bolivia has begun to rearm, and Brazil’s currently weak government looks set to give way to a landslide victory by Getulio Vargas’ progressives. Can La Plata stay intact in the face of her so quickly resurgent foes?
French: En 1880, l’Argentine profite de ses grandes étendues de terre pour développer ses deux produits agricoles : le bétail et le blé. Le pays a besoin d’une main d’oeuvre plus importante, ce qui augmente de manière significative l’immigration du pays. Mais l’économie du pays reste dominée par les Britanniques qui développent l’infrastructure, contrôlent la majorité des banques et font des affaires dans le pays. Le capital britannique fait rapidement de l’Argentine le plus grand exportateur mondial de bovins et de blé. Le développement économique du pays modifie son schéma social avec l’émergence d’une classe moyenne en zone urbaine et d’une classe d’ouvriers industriels. Les deux forces sociales réclament la réforme du système électoral afin qu’elles puissent être représentées en politique. Le mouvement radical de l’UCR (Unión Civica Radical), fondé en 1889, se bat également dans ce but et voit son pouvoir croître après la modification du système électoral. La réforme est introduite en 1912 par le président conservateur Roque Sáenz Pena. Les premières élections universelles de 1916 donnent le pouvoir à Hipólito Irigoyen. Les classes moyennes accèdent pour la première fois au pouvoir. L’Argentine adopte la neutralité en matière de politique étrangère et tente parallèlement de réparer quelques-uns des effets négatifs causés par la vague d’industrialisation.  La période de croissance économique concomitante au second mandat présidentiel d’Irigoyen est brutalement interrompue par la Grande Dépression de 1929-1930. Les politiciens et généraux conservateurs réclament le pouvoir présidentiel à l’issue d’un coup d’Etat militaire, mais aucun d’entre eux ne parvient à apaiser les tensions sociales.
Italian: Nel 1880, l'Argentina disponeva di vaste zone adatte ai suoi principali prodotti agricoli: grano e allevamenti di bestiame. C'era bisogno di più manodopera e ciò fece aumentare l'immigrazione. Il capitale finanziario tuttavia, era in buona parte controllato dagli inglesi che avevano investito in infrastrutture, controllavano la maggior parte delle banche e i commerci d'affari e quel capitale rese in poco tempo l'Argentina il leader degli esportatori di carne bovina e grano nel mondo. Come conseguenza di questo sviluppo, si formarono una classe media urbana e una operaia industriale. Entrambe chiesero una maggiore rappresentanza in politica attraverso modifiche al sistema elettorale. La radicale UCR (Unión Civica Radical), fondata nel 1889, si batté per questi obiettivi e uscì rafforzata dalla riforma del sistema elettorale, avviata dal presidente conservatore Roque Sáenz Pena nel 1912. Nel 1916, si tennero le prime elezioni con suffragio universale che videro vincitore Hipólito Irigoyen dell'UCR. Per la prima volta, le classi medie avevano un'influenza politica. In politica estera, l'Argentina seguì un percorso di neutralità, mentre la legislatura sociale stava allontanando alcuni effetti negativi dell'ondata di industrializzazione nel paese. Il periodo di crescita economica e la seconda presidenza di Irigoyen, terminarono bruscamente con la grande depressione del 1929/30. I politici conservatori e i generali reclamarono la presidenza dopo un colpo militare, ma nessuno di loro riuscì a superare le tensioni sociali.
Spanish: En 1880, Argentina disponía de grandes extensiones para sus principales productos agrarios: ganado vacuno y trigo. Se necesitaba más mano de obra, lo que hizo aumentar el número de inmigrantes. Sin embargo, el capital financiero se encontraba controlado principalmente por los británicos, que realizaron inversiones en infraestructuras y controlaban la mayoría de los bancos y negocios de intercambio, y ese capital pronto convirtió a Argentina en el principal exportador de carne y trigo del mundo. Este desarrollo trajo la formación de una clase media urbana y una clase trabajadora industrial. Ambas pedían mayor representación política, factible mediante cambios en el sistema electoral. Los radicales de la UCR (Unión Cívica Radical), fundada en 1889, lucharon por estos objetivos y salieron fortalecidos por la reforma del sistema electoral que el presidente conservador Roque Sáenz Pena hizo aprobar en 1912. En 1916 tuvieron lugar las primeras elecciones universales, en las que resultó ganador Hipólito Irigoyen, de la UCR. Por primera vez, las clases medias tenían influencia política. En lo que se refiere a la política exterior, Argentina adoptó una actitud de neutralidad, mientras que una legislación social eliminaría algunos de los efectos negativos de la industrialización del país. El periodo de prosperidad económica y la presidencia de Irigoyen acabaron abruptamente con la Gran Depresión de 1929-30. Políticos conservadores y generales se hicieron con la presidencia tras un golpe militar, pero ninguno de ellos pudo con las tensiones sociales.
German: Im Jahre 1880 besaß Argentinien große Ländereien, die sich für erstklassige Agrarprodukte eigneten: Vieh und Weizen. Mehr Arbeitskräfte wurden benötigt, wodurch die Zahl der Einwanderer anstieg. Das Finanzkapital wurde allerdings hauptsächlich von den Briten kontrolliert, welche in die Infrastruktur investierten und die meisten Banken und Handelshäuser kontrollierten. Dieses Kapital machte Argentinien schon bald zur weltführenden Exportnation für Rindfleisch und Weizen. Durch diese Entwicklung formte sich ein städtischer Mittelstand sowie eine industrielle Arbeiterklasse. Beide verlangten nach mehr politischer Repräsentation, was durch Änderungen im Wahlsystem erzielt werden sollte. Die 1889 gegründete radikale UCR (Unión Civica Radical) kämpfte für diese Ziele und setzte sich stark für die Reform des Wahlsystems ein, welches der konservative Präsident Roque Sáenz Pena 1912 durchdrückte. 1916 wurden die ersten allgemeinen Wahlen abgehalten, die Hipólito Irigoyen von der UCR gewann. Zum ersten Mal hatte der Mittelstand nun politischen Einfluss. In der Außenpolitik ging Argentinien den Weg der Neutralität, während soziale Gesetzgebung einige der negativen Auswirkungen der Industrialisierungswelle lindern sollte. Die Periode wirtschaftlichen Aufstiegs und die zweite Präsidentschaft Irigoyens wurde abrupt von der Großen Depression 1929/30 beendet. Nach einem Militärputsch übernahmen diverse konservative Politiker und Generäle die Präsidentschaft, aber keiner von ihnen konnte die sozialen Spannungen bewältigen.

English: With the dissolution of the Transcaucasian Federation, the new-born Republic of Armenia was forced to stand alone against the Turkish might. Eventually the Republic of Armenia was able to secure peace through the Treaty of Batumi, but only after making some painful territorial concessions to the Ottoman Empire. This short-lived peace only lasted for 8 years when the Turkish Army invaded and occupied whole of Armenia in 1926. The Ottomans' original intention of the war was to erase the First Republic of Armenia from the map completely, but after occupying the country for two years, with mounting internal tensions within the Empire, the Sublime Porte decided to accept the existence of the Armenian State, albeit as a puppet of the Empire. In June 1928, the Second Armenian Republic, headed by General Drastamat Kanayan, signed a formal peace treaty with the Ottoman Empire. By 1936, the Second Republic achieved economic and political stability, but under the surface the country remains something of a 'powder-keg' for it’s Ottoman masters. Armenia still has various territorial disputes with her neighbours, and some people are demanding a return to the stability of Russian rule, whilst other movements call for complete independence. Only time will tell what path Armenia will follow - that of a free agent, a re-integrated region of Russia, or colony of the Turks.

When Britain declared war on Germany in 1914 the British colonies of Australia and New Zealand (often referred to collectively as the Antipode Dominions) became automatically involved in the conflict, along with all the other members of the British Empire. The Prime Minister of Australia at the outbreak of the war, James Cook, stated on the 5th August “When the Empire is at war, so also is Australia.” Given the predominantly British heritage of most Australians and New Zealanders, there was considerable support and large numbers of young men reported to recruiting centres to enlist in the following months. However, the Antipodes would go on to see a mixed performance in the Great War.  Initial success occurred in 1914 with the capture of German New Guinea but this was followed up by the Gallipoli Campaign of 1915 which became a humiliating defeat where 11,000 Australian and New Zealand Army Corps soldiers were consumed in the ensuing fiasco. Following Gallipoli, the Australasians saw success in the Sinai and Palestine campaign where Harry Chauvel, commander of the ANZAC Mounted Corp, won victories at Beersheba and Jerusalem, resulting in the loss of a dozen Turkish divisions – an irreplaceable loss for the Ottoman Empire. But Chauvel’s gains were reversed in 1919 with the arrival of Ludendorff’s veterans from the Spring Offensive and Entente forces had to withdraw to entrenched positions in the Sinai. The war continued inconclusively until, in 1921 a Peace with Honour was signed between the remaining Entente powers and Germany. The recognition of the Antipodes as separate entities from the United Kingdom (the first international treaty signed by Australia or New Zealand) did little to assuage public opinion and the signing of the treaty by then Prime Ministers Billy Hughes and William Massey was viewed as a national embarrassment and the resulting return of German New Guinea was met with outrage in the press. Over the next few years, public discontent simmered, never far from the surface. The situation in Australia boiled over finally when the Victoria Police Strike of 1923 developed into a socialist revolt and the proclamation of the Melbourne Commune. George V, fearful of growing dissent in the Home Nations, enacted the Emergency Protocols. Thomas Blamey, one of Australia’s heroes of Gallipoli as well as veteran of the Western Front, was appointed Australian Minister of Security and given control of the military which he used alongside demobilised paramilitaries often referred to as ‘The Old Guard’ to violently put an end to the short lived revolt. 1924 saw the merger of the Antipode Dominions under the ‘Consolidation of Resources Act’ which both the Australian and New Zealand Parliaments passed under duress. The new state, which was called the Australasian Confederation, (which also included the territories of British New Guinea and Fiji) had George V appoint the British general William Birdwood as its first Governor-General. Birdwood’s initial actions were to suspend elections indefinitely and dissolve the autonomy of the New Zealand Parliament. All these actions were to mitigate the occurrence of another revolt. However when that revolt came it was not in Victoria, Queensland or New South Wales, but rather at home, in Britain, amongst the coal fields of old south Wales. The British Revolution of 1925 shook the Empire to its foundations and lead to disruption in communications and a colonial seizure by Germany. The commander of the China Station, David Murray Anderson, assumed control of the British Overseas Fleet and enacted what would come to be known as the 'Anderson Protocol' – mutinies were suppressed, the Australasian  and British Overseas fleets were merged into a single Australasian station and colonial staff were evacuated to Australasia. Charles Vyner Brooke, the exiled White Rajah of Sarawak, is one notable evacuated colonial who has since resided in Sydney and is considered to be a popular socialite and humanitarian.  Birdwood’s heavy-handed rule, the expansion of both the police forces and militia military districts in addition to the restrictions of citizens’ rights nearly led to a General Strike in 1929. The Governor-General agreed to recall Hughes to quell public anger while also preventing any meaningful reforms. This situation continued until 1935 when Stanley Bruce, veteran of the Great War and rising star of the Nationalist Party challenged Hughes for the leadership and won. When Bruce turned down the position of Prime Minister, demanding free elections be held, he and his supporters were expelled from the Nationalist Party. Unperturbed, Bruce succeeded in gaining the concession from Birdwood and looks forward to the 1936 election, forming his own new party - United Australasia (a centre right coalition of conservatives, liberals and moderate nationalists) .  Bruce is not the only one calling for change though, the trade unionists of the Labour Party remain active underground and will likely run in the coming election, as will the reformed Commonwealth Liberal Party. Then there is the influential Australasian Guard, formed in 1925, which is increasingly becoming dissatisfied with Birdwood and is calling for radical measures to tackle the depression and bring Revanchism to all who threaten the Antipodes. The course Australasia will take in the coming years, remains uncertain.

Thomas Blamey, one of Australia’s heroes of Gallipoli as well as veteran of the Western Front, was appointed Australian Minister of Security and given control of the military which he used alongside demobilised paramilitaries often referred to as ‘The Old Guard’ to violently put an end to the short lived revolt. 1924 saw the merger of the Antipode Dominions under the ‘Consolidation of Resources Act’ which both the Australian and New Zealand Parliaments passed under duress. The new state, which was called the Australasian Confederation, (which also included the territories of British New Guinea and Fiji) had George V appoint the British general William Birdwood as its first Governor-General. Birdwood’s initial actions were to suspend elections indefinitely and dissolve the autonomy of the New Zealand Parliament. All these actions were to mitigate the occurrence of another revolt. However when that revolt came it was not in Victoria, Queensland or New South Wales, but rather at home, in Britain, amongst the coal fields of old south Wales. The British Revolution of 1925 shook the Empire to its foundations and lead to disruption in communications and a colonial seizure by Germany. The commander of the China Station, David Murray Anderson, assumed control of the British Overseas Fleet and enacted what would come to be known as the 'Anderson Protocol' – mutinies were suppressed, the Australasian  and British Overseas fleets were merged into a single Australasian station and colonial staff were evacuated to Australasia. Charles Vyner Brooke, the exiled White Rajah of Sarawak, is one notable evacuated colonial who has since resided in Sydney and is considered to be a popular socialite and humanitarian.  Birdwood’s heavy-handed rule, the expansion of both the police forces and militia military districts in addition to the restrictions of citizens’ rights nearly led to a General Strike in 1929. The Governor-General agreed to recall Hughes to quell public anger while also preventing any meaningful reforms. This situation continued until 1935 when Stanley Bruce, veteran of the Great War and rising star of the Nationalist Party challenged Hughes for the leadership and won. When Bruce turned down the position of Prime Minister, demanding free elections be held, he and his supporters were expelled from the Nationalist Party. Unperturbed, Bruce succeeded in gaining the concession from Birdwood and looks forward to the 1936 election, forming his own new party - United Australasia (a centre right coalition of conservatives, liberals and moderate nationalists) .  Bruce is not the only one calling for change though, the trade unionists of the Labour Party remain active underground and will likely run in the coming election, as will the reformed Commonwealth Liberal Party. Then there is the influential Australasian Guard, formed in 1925, which is increasingly becoming dissatisfied with Birdwood and is calling for radical measures to tackle the depression and bring Revanchism to all who threaten the Antipodes. The course Australasia will take in the coming years, remains uncertain.

The Prime Minister of Australia at the outbreak of the war, James Cook, stated on the 5th August “When the Empire is at war, so also is Australia.” Given the predominantly British heritage of most Australians and New Zealanders, there was considerable support and large numbers of young men reported to recruiting centres to enlist in the following months. However, the Antipodes would go on to see a mixed performance in the Great War.  Initial success occurred in 1914 with the capture of German New Guinea but this was followed up by the Gallipoli Campaign of 1915 which became a humiliating defeat where 11,000 Australian and New Zealand Army Corps soldiers were consumed in the ensuing fiasco. Following Gallipoli, the Australasians saw success in the Sinai and Palestine campaign where Harry Chauvel, commander of the ANZAC Mounted Corp, won victories at Beersheba and Jerusalem, resulting in the loss of a dozen Turkish divisions – an irreplaceable loss for the Ottoman Empire. But Chauvel’s gains were reversed in 1919 with the arrival of Ludendorff’s veterans from the Spring Offensive and Entente forces had to withdraw to entrenched positions in the Sinai. English: Although Austria was on the winning side of the Weltkrieg, the war’s main impact was to reveal the Empire’s significant weaknesses and utter dependence upon Germany. Over the course of the 1920s one disaster followed another: the Emperor Karl died in 1922 causing the throne to pass to his 10 year old son Otto. Austrian industry collapsed in face of competition from German manufactures, while the quarrels of the Czechs and ethnic Germans in Bohemia nearly pushed the Empire into civil war. Finally, the humiliation of having to call in German mediation to resolve the deadlock of the Ausgleich negotitions in 1927, which resulted in the concession of autonomy statutes given to Bohemia and Galicia, seemed to signal the end of Austria as a Great Power. However, many feel that there is new hope for the Osterreich - now that the Emperor Otto has come of age and the terms of the ‘Great Compromise’ are to be renegotiated at the 1937 Ausgleich next year. Could this be the time for Austria to throw off her shackles of dependence on Germany and reassert the power of the Habsburg dynasty over her Empire?
French: Après la Première Guerre mondiale, l’Autriche est réduite à son noyau germanique. La Républicaine autrichienne est proclamée le 12 novembre 1918. Une constitution préliminaire est créée par l’assemblée nationale provisoire qui nomme également un gouvernement de coalition dirigé par le démocrate Karl Renner (1919-1920). L’ancien système de vote majoritaire est remplacé par un système de représentation proportionnelle incluant le droit de vote pour les femmes. Le but poursuivi par l’assemblée et le gouvernement est l’unification avec l’Allemagne mais cet objectif est rendu impossible par le traité de paix. Une constitution faisant de l’Autriche un Etat fédéral est adoptée en 1920. Au cours des élections suivantes, les socio-démocrates cèdent la place au parti chrétien social (conservateur) qui conservera le pouvoir dans les années à venir. Leurs gouvernements ne parviendront toutefois pas à stabiliser la jeune République. La crise économique dans laquelle se trouve le pays fait dériver la société vers la gauche radicale (la fédération de protection de la République) et vers la droite (Heimwehr). L’Autriche se trouve à plusieurs reprises sur le point d’entrer en guerre. Une modification de la constitution renforce, en 1929, le rôle du président afin de stabiliser le pays. Les Nazis obtiennent le soutien des Autrichiens au début des années 1930. Le chancelier conservateur Engelbert Dollfus profite des victoires nazies pour abolir la constitution et fonder un régime autoritaire. Après les troubles sociaux de 1934, Dollfus interdit tous les partis sauf le sien, le Vaterländische Front, et adopte une constitution inspirée du modèle fasciste.  Il est assassiné au cours de la tentative de coup d’Etat du 25 juillet 1934. Son successeur, Karl Schussnigg, poursuit la même politique et tente d’apaiser les tensions qui l’opposent à l’Allemagne afin de conserver la souveraineté de l’Autriche.
Italian: Dopo la Prima Guerra Mondiale, l'Austria era stata ridotta al suo nucleo tedesco. Il 12 novembre 1918, venne proclamata la repubblica. L'assemblea nazionale provvisoria, creò una costituzione preliminare, nominando una coalizione di governo sotto il socialdemocratico Karl Renner (1919/20) e sostituendo il precedente sistema di voto maggioritario con uno di tipo proporzionale, con il suffragio esteso anche alle donne. L'obiettivo dell'assemblea e del governo nazionale era l'unificazione con la Germania, resa tuttavia impossibile dalle decisioni delle potenze uscite vincitrici dalla guerra. La costituzione promulgata nel 1920, proclamò l'Austria uno stato federale. Nelle elezioni tenutesi subito dopo, i socialdemocratici furono battuti dai conservatori cristiano-sociali che divennero la prima forza politica austriaca negli anni seguenti. I loro governi, tuttavia, non riuscirono a dare stabilità alla giovane repubblica. Vessata da grossi problemi economici, la società si alternava fra la sinistra (Republican Protection League) e la destra radicale (Heimwehr). In più occasioni, l'Austria fu sull'orlo di una guerra civile. Nel 1929, venne approvato un cambio della costituzione, per rafforzare il ruolo del presidente e dare maggiore stabilità al paese. All'inizio degli anni '30, i nazisti ottennero anche l'appoggio dell'Austria. Il cancelliere conservatore, Engelbert Dollfuß, vide i successi dei nazisti come un'opportunità per abolire la costituzione e stabilire un regime dittatoriale. Dopo i disordini del 1934, Dollfuß vietò tutti i partiti tranne il suo Vaterländische Front e promulgò una costituzione sui modelli fascisti, prima di essere ucciso durante un colpo di stato il 25 luglio 1934. Il suo successore, Karl Schuschnigg, continuò la sua politica, cercando di sistemare le tensioni con la Germania e di proteggere la sovranità dell'Austria.
Spanish: Tras la Primera Guerra Mundial, Austria se vio reducida a su núcleo territorial alemán, proclamándose la república el 12 de noviembre de 1918. La asamblea nacional provisional creó una constitución preliminar y nombró a un gobierno de coalición al mando del socialdemócrata Karl Renner (1919-20), sustituyendo el anterior sistema de votación mayoritaria por un sistema de representación proporcional que incluía el sufragio femenino. EL objetivo de la asamblea nacional y el gobierno era la unificación con Alemania, que había sido declarada imposible por los vencedores de la guerra. En 1920 se promulgó una constitución que declaraba a Austria como un estado federal. En la elección celebrada a continuación, los socialdemócratas fueron derrotados por los conservadores socialcristianos, que se convertirían en el poder dominante de la política austríaca en los años siguientes. Sin embargo, sus gobiernos no consiguieron estabilizar a la joven república. Con el trasfondo de sus grandes problemas económicos, la sociedad se fue inclinando hacia el radicalismo, tanto de izquierdas (Liga de Protección Republicana), como de derechas (Heinwehr). Austria se encontró varias veces al borde de una guerra civil. Se llevó a cabo un cambio de la Constitución de 1929 para fortalecer el papel del presidente, con el propósito de estabilizar más al país. A principios de los años 30, los nazis también comenzaron a ganar apoyos en Austria. El canciller conservador Engelbert Dollfuss se aprovechó de los éxitos nazis para abolir la constitución e instaurar un régimen autoritario. Tras los disturbios de 1934, Dollfuss ilegalizó a todos los partidos salvo al suyo propio, el Vaterländische Front (Frente Patriótico), y promulgó una constitución que seguía los parámetros fascistas. Sin embargo, fue asesinado el 25 de julio de 1934, durante un intento de golpe de estado. Su sucesor, Kurt von Schuschnigg, continuó con su política, buscando reducir las tensiones con Alemania y proteger la soberanía austríaca.
German: Nach dem Ersten Weltkrieg war Österreich auf sein deutsches Herzland reduziert. Am 12. November 1918 wurde die Republik ausgerufen. Die provisorische Nationalversammlung verabschiedete eine vorläufige Verfassung, ernannte eine Koalitionsregierung unter dem Sozialdemokraten Karl Renner (1919/20) und ersetzte das vorherige Mehrheitswahlsystem mit einem System proportionaler Repräsentation, welches auch das Stimmrecht für Frauen umfasste. Das Ziel von Nationalversammlung und Regierung war die Vereinigung mit Deutschland, die jedoch durch die Entscheidungen der Siegermächte unmöglich gemacht wurde. 1920 wurde eine Verfassung verabschiedet, die Österreich zum Bundesstaat erklärte. In der darauffolgenden Wahl verloren die Sozialdemokraten gegen die Christsozialen, die über die folgenden Jahre hinweg die alles beherrschende Macht in der österreichischen Politik werden sollten. Deren Regierungen zeigten sich allerdings wenig erfolgreich bei der Stabilisierung der jungen Republik: Vor dem Hintergrund großer wirtschaftlicher Probleme trieb die Gesellschaft zu den radikalen Linken (Republikanischer Schutzbund) und Rechten (Heimwehr) ab. Mehrere Male stand Österreich am Rande des Bürgerkrieges. Eine Änderung der Verfassung 1929 zur Stärkung des Präsidenten sollte das Land weiter stabilisieren. In den frühen dreißiger Jahren erhielten auch die Nazis weiteren Zulauf in Österreich: Der konservative Kanzler Engelbert Dollfuß nahm die Erfolge der Nazis zur Gelegenheit, die Verfassung abzuschaffen und ein autoritäres Regime zu errichten. Nach Unruhen im Jahre 1934 verbot Dollfuß alle Parteien außer seiner eigenen, der Vaterländischen Front, und installierte eine Verfassung nach faschistischen Vorbildern. Er wurde bei einem Putschversuch am 25. Juli 1934 getötet. Sein Nachfolger Karl Schuschnigg führte dessen Politik jedoch weiter und versuchte, die Spannungen mit Deutschland beizulegen und Österreichs Souveränität zu schützen.

English: Azerbaijan is generally regarded as 'just another' of the small Caucasian states to rise out of the ruins of the Russian Empire. Since then the small nation has only managed to maintain her independence by carefully balancing its political and economic links with both Russia and the Ottomans - ensuring that neither can gain hegemony over them. With neither Great Power able to secure dominance Azerbaijan has seen a stable, but precarious, regime in the form of a secular and technocratic dictatorship (which by regional standards, is fairly 'mild' and tolerant), and as a result, economic prosperity has followed. Thanks to foreign investment in the exploitation of the vast Baku oilfields, Azerbaijan has become the largest oil producer in the region - and rival even to Ploesti. However, this very prosperity may in fact be the country's undoing. In an age in which the consumption of oil is becoming the dominant need of both industrial society and modern warfare, Azerbaijan is increasingly finding herself the battleground of both foreign corporate, and national interests. Will she be able to maintain her precarious status quo? Or will she, and her precious oil, fall into the hands of the Ottomans, the Russians, or even Georgia?

Belgian army, commanded by king Albert himself, was the first who fought the German armies during the Great War and among the others vanquished armies during the defeat of France. With his motherland under German occupation, Belgium was forced to comply to every single term : Belgian Congo becoming another German holding in Africa, Belgian Luxemburg a province of German Reich, and even the country ceased her existence under her name. Inspired by the speeches of Jules Destrée, German experts concluded that a federal state was the only chance to avoid riots between Flemish and Walloons. Thus, the kingdom of Flandern-Wallonien - Flanders-Wallonia in German – was created, headed by the Kaiser’s third son, Adalbert von Hohenzollern, and the former head of German occupation authorities, August Borms, still de facto head of the government. In 1936, the buffer state of Flandern-Wallonien is coming to a boiling point, between the Flemish population, wanting ot join the neutral Netherlands, the Walloon population, whose nationalism turned to French-fashioned syndicalist views, and the whole population, tired of German domination...

English: In 17th century the Lama Ngawang Namgyal who had fled Tibet managed to unify the country and to secure his further conquests through the building of monastery fortresses (Dzongs). The first spiritual and secular ruler of Bhuatan, called Shabdung, helped the Drupka Sect to win and transferred the Tibetan governmental system of Dalai Lamas to Bhutan. The Drukpas (Druk = Dragon) gave the country its name - Dragon Land (Druk Yul). The succession of the ruler based on reincarnation. Shabdung Namgyal supposedly separated the country into three regions which were ruled by princes (Penlop). In 19th century only two of the three houses still were of importance - the Tsonga-Penlops east of the Black Mountains under the Wangchuk family and the Paro-Penlops who governed almost all of western Bhutan. With the election of the Penlop of Tsonga, Ugyen Wangchuk, on December 17th, 1907, as the first Druk Gyalpo (Dragon king) the Shabdung system was replaced by a hereditary monarchy.Externally, Bhutan came into conflict with the expanding British East India Company who drove the Bhutanese out of the Indian regions of Cooch Behar between 1772 and 1774. 1864/65 Bhutan lost claims to parts of the the Bhartiya Commune and Siamese Plains during the Second British-Bhutanese War. In the Treaty of Punakha 1910 Bhutan formally became a British Protectorate but retained its internal autonomy. With the British revolution ending the Empires influence in east India, Bhutan reachieved it's full independence.
French: Au cours du 17e siècle, le dalaï-lama, Ngawang Namgyal, s’enfuit du Tibet et parvient à unifier le pays et à sécuriser les territoires nouvellement conquis en construisant des monastères fortifiés (Dzongs). Shabdung, le premier chef spirituel et politique de Bhoutan, favorise la secte Drukpa et transfère le système gouvernemental du dalaï-lama à Bhoutan. Les Drukpas (druk=dragon) donnent leur nom au pays, Druk Yul (le royaume du dragon). La succession du dirigeant est assurée par réincarnation. Shabdung Namgyal divise le pays en trois régions gouvernées par des princes (penlop). Pendant le 19e siècle, seules deux des trois maisons princières sont encore influentes : les Tsonga-Penlops à l’est des Montagnes Noires dirigés par la famille Wangchuk et les Paro-Penlops qui gouvernent toute la partie occidentale du Bhoutan. Ugyen Wangchuk est élu premier Druk Gyalpo (roi dragon) le 17 décembre 1907 et remplace alors l’ancien système shabdung par une monarchie héréditaire. Entre 1772 et 1774, le Bhoutan entre en conflit avec la Compagnie des Indes britannique qui finit par chasser les troupes du Bhoutan hors des régions indiennes de Cooch Behar. En 1864 et 1865, durant la seconde guerre opposant la Grande-Bretagne au Bhoutan, ce dernier perd ses droits sur le Bengale et les plaines du Siam. En 1910, le traité de Punakha officialise le statut de protectorat britannique du Bhoutan tout en maintenant son autonomie interne.
Italian: Nel diciassettesimo secolo, il Lama Ngawang Namgyal che era fuggito dal Tibet, riuscì a riunire il paese e a mettere al sicuro le sue ulteriori conquiste con la costruzione di fortezze monastero (Dzong). Il primo governatore spirituale e secolare del Bhuatan, chiamato Shabdung, aiutò Drupka Sect a vincere e trasferì il sistema governativo tibetano dei Dalai Lama in Bhutan. I Drukpas (Druk = Drago) chiamarono il paese con il loro nome - Terra del drago (Druk Yul). La successione del governatore era basata sulla reincarnazione. Presumibilmente, Shabdung Namgyal separò il paese in tre regioni, che vennero governate da principi (Penlop). Nel diciannovesimo secolo, solo due delle tre case godevano ancora di una certa importanza: gli Tsonga, i Penlop a est delle Montagne nere sotto la famiglia Wangchuk e i Paro-Penlop, che governavano su quasi tutto il Bhutan occidentale. Con l'elezione del Penlop di Tsonga, Ugyen Wangchuk, il 17 dicembre 1907, come primo Druk Gyalpo (Re dei draghi), il sistema Shabdung venne sostituito da una monarchia ereditaria. Il Buthan si trovò in perenne conflitto con la compagnia delle indie orientale inglese che aveva cacciato i bhutanesi fuori dalle regioni indiane di Cooch Behar tra il 1772 e il 1774. Nel 1864/65 il Bhutan perse i diritti su parti del Bengala e della pianura siamese durante il secondo conflitto anglo-bhutanese. Con il trattato di Punakha del 1910, il Bhutan divenne formalmente un protettorato inglese pur conservando la propria autonomia interna.
Spanish: En el siglo XVII, el lama Ngawang Namgyal, que había huido del Tíbet, consiguió unificar el país y asegurar sus futuras conquistas mediante la construcción de monasterios fortificados (Dzongs). El primer líder espiritual y secular de Bután, llamado Shabdung, ayudó a ganar a la secta drukpa y copió en su país el sistema de gobierno tibetano de los Dalái- lamas. Los drukpas (Druk = dragón) le dieron al país su nombre: Tierra de los Dragones (Druk Yul). La sucesión del gobernante del país está basada en la reencarnación. Shabdung Namgyal dividió supuestamente el país en tres regiones gobernadas por príncipes (Penlop). En el siglo XIX, sólo dos de las tres dinastías conservaban algo de importancia: la de Tsonga-Penlop, al este de las Montañas Negras, controlada por la familia Wangchuck, y la de Paro-Penlop, que gobernaba casi todo el este de Bután. Con la elección del Penlop de Tsonga, Ugyen Wangchuk, el 17 de diciembre de 1907 como primer Druk Gyalpo (Rey Dragón), el sistema de Shabdung fue reemplazado por una monarquía hereditaria. En el plano exterior, Bután entró en conflicto con la Compañía Británica de las Indias Orientales, que expulsó a los butaneses de las regiones indias de Cooch Behar entre 1772 y 1774. Entre 1864 y 1865, Bután perdió todos sus derechos sobre partes de Bengala y las Llanuras Siamesas en el transcurso de la Segunda Guerra Anglo-butanesa. En el Tratado de Punakha de 1910, Bután se convirtió oficialmente en un protectorado británico, pero conservó su autonomía interna.
German: Im 17. Jahrhundert vereinigte der aus Tibet geflohene Lama Ngawang Namgyal das Land und sicherte seine weiteren Eroberungen durch die Errichtung von Klosterfestungen (Dzongs). Als erster spiritueller und weltlicher Herrscher Bhutans, 'Shabdung' genannt, verhalf er der Drupka-Sekte zum Sieg und übertrug das tibetische Regierungssystem der Dalai Lamas auf Bhutan. Die Drukpas (Druk = Drache) gaben dem Land seinen Namen - Land der Drachen (Druk Yul). Die Erbfolge des Herrschers basierte auf Reinkarnation. Shabdung Namgyal trennte das Land angeblich in drei von Prinzen (Penlop) regierte Regionen. Im 19. Jahrhundert waren nur noch zwei der drei Häuser von Wichtigkeit – die Tsonga-Penlops östlich der Schwarzen Berge unter der Wangchuk-Familie, und die Paro-Penlops, die fast ganz West-Bhutan regierten. Am 17. Dezember 1907, mit der Wahl des Penlop von Tsonga, Ugyen Wangchuk, zum ersten Druk Gyalpo (Drachenkönig) wurde das Shabdung-System durch eine Erbmonarchie ersetzt. Außenpolitisch kam Bhutan in Konflikt mit der expandierenden British East India Company, welche die Bhutaner 1772 und 1774 aus den indischen Regionen des Cooch Behar trieben. 1864/65 verlor Bhutan während des Zweiten Britisch-Bhutanischen Krieges seine Ansprüche auf Teile der bengalischen und siamesischen Ebenen. Im Vertrag von Punakha wurde Bhutan 1910 formell zu einem britischen Protektorat, behielt aber seine interne Autonomie bei.

English: The lack of an historic Byelorussian state did not prevent the Germans establishing the Kingdom of 'White Ruthenia' along ethnographic lines following the successful conclusion of the Weltkrieg and the collapse of Russian power. Despite the lack of an historic identity the legitimacy of the new state was secured during the reign of Kaiser Wilhelm II’s brother Heinrich, who used the strong constitutional Royal prerogatives to promote land reform, education programs, and balance the interests of the various factions within his Kingdom. Unfortunately upon Heinrich’s death in 1929 the throne passed to his son Waldemar, who has not been able to live up to the standards set by his father. In 1936 Weissruthenian is an increasingly divided society and the young Kingdom appears to be approaching a crisis as power slips away from the legitimate monarch to his younger brother Sigismund, who has managed built up a formidable power base through the ‘National Security Services’ and various Byelorussian extremist groups unhappy with the current situation.

Since her formation Bolivia has not fared well in terms of her foreign policy, suffering hurtful losses. A border conflict with Chile led to the ‘Saltpetre War’ (1879 – 1883) which Bolivia lost despite an alliance with Peru, which ended with the nation having to cede the coastal province of Antofagasta, losing its access to the sea. In 1903 Brazil and Bolivia signed the Treaty of P?troplis, ceding the important rubber producing province Acre to Brazil. In 1932, tensions with Paraguay over the Gran Chaco region touched off what would later come to be known as the ‘Great South American War’. Initially, Bolivia was successful against the Paraguayans had quickly overran the country, unfortunately though, the Bolivian occupation of Paraguay prompted Argentinean intervention in 1933, and a in a quick campaign Argentinean troops quickly liberated Paraguay and settled in for the winter.In 1934, Argentina renewed their offensive and scored several great victories against the Bolivian forces, and Bolivia seemed totally defeated. However, in another twist of the war, their hope was rekindled, as Brazil chose this time to intervene on their side. Unfortunately however the Brazilians focused the thrust of their offensives towards the La Plata River, leaving the Bolivians to look to their own defences, and this error of judgement lead to a humiliating final defeat of Bolivia at the hands of Argentina in late 1934. In the resulting peace, Bolivia was forced to accept the independence of Paraguay and relinquish their claims on the Gran Chaco region. After another short campaign by Argentinean forces Brazil was defeated in 1935, and in the resulting peace Uruguay and Paraguay were ‘federated’ with Argentina to create the Union of La Plata.In 1936 Bolivia stands at a crossroads, on one hand she is burning with a passion for revenge against ‘La Plata’, but on the other hand, she is wary of becoming too closely aligned with Brazil. However, with the government in La Plata beginning to assert claims over parts of Bolivia relations are becoming even further strained and closer ties with Brazil may well be unavoidable. Whatever the situation, Bolivia will have to play her cards wisely, for the moment of final decision will come soon…
French: La Bolivie souffre de très grandes pertes en matière de politique extérieure. Les rivalités frontalières qui l’opposent au Chili donnent naissance à la guerre du Pacifique (1879-1883) au cours de laquelle la Bolivie est vaincue malgré le soutien du Pérou. Le traité de Valparaíso dépossède le pays de la région d’Antofagasta qui constitue son seul accès à la mer. En 1903, le Brésil et la Bolivie signent le traité de Petrópolis qui attribue au Brésil la région d’Acre, très riche en caoutchouc. Les 2 millions de livres sterling payées en retour ne suffisent pas à compenser une si grande perte. La tentative de sécurisation de l’accès aux ports nationaux pendant la guerre du Chaco contre le Paraguay (1932-1935) se solde par de nouvelles pertes territoriales dans la région de Chaco. Le pays est néanmoins parvenu à sécuriser le fleuve Paraguay donnant accès à l’océan Atlantique (le traité de Buenos Aires officialise ce statut en 1938). La croissance économique que connaît le pays depuis 1895, date à laquelle l’étain est son principal produit d’exportation, prend fin avec la guerre du Chaco et la Grande Dépression. La révolte des classes moyennes et des mineurs permet aux gouvernements militaires socialistes de prendre le pouvoir.
Italian: In politica estera la Bolivia subì dolorose perdite. Un conflitto al confine contro il Cile, portò alla guerra del salnitro (1879-1883), che vide la sconfitta della Bolivia, nonostante un'alleanza con il Perù. Dopo aver ceduto la provincia costiera di Antofagasta col trattato di pace di Valparaiso (1884), il paese non aveva più alcuno sbocco sul mare. Nel 1903, Brasile e Bolivia siglarono il trattato di Pétroplis, che garantiva al Brasile l'importante provincia della gomma di Acre. La somma di 2 milioni di sterline non bastò alla Bolivia per compensare la perdita. Il tentativo di ottenere uno sbocco sul mare nella guerra del Chaco con il Paraguay (1932-1935), causò la perdita della parte più vasta della regione del Chaco del nord, ma almeno assicurò lo sbocco sul fiume Paraguay fino all'Oceano Atlantico (trattato di Buenos Aires del 1938). La guerra del Chaco e la grande depressione misero fine al positivo sviluppo economico iniziato nel 1895, quando lo stagno divenne la principale materia di esportazione. Di fronte ai movimenti di protesta della classe media e dei minatori, presero il potere governi militari con tendenze socialiste.
Spanish: Bolivia ha sufrido dolorosas derrotas en política exterior. Un conflicto fronterizo con Chile llevó a la Guerra del Nitrato de 1879-83, que Bolivia perdió pese a aliarse con Perú. Al verse forzado a ceder la provincia costera de Antofagasta por el tratado de paz de Valparaíso de 1884, el país perdió su acceso al mar. En 1903, Brasil y Bolivia firmaron el Tratado de Petrópolis, en el que se cedía a Brasil la importante provincia productora de caucho de Acre. Una suma de 2 millones de libras esterlinas no sirvió para compensar esta pérdida. El intento de obtener un acceso al mar en la Guerra del Chaco contra Paraguay (1932-1935) trajo como consecuencia la pérdida de la mayor parte de la región del Chaco Boreal, pero al menos se consiguió el acceso al río Paraguay, que desemboca en el Atlántico (confirmado en el Tratado de Buenos Aires de 1938). La Guerra del Chaco y la Gran Depresión pusieron fin al positivo desarrollo económico desde 1895, cuando el estaño pasó a ser el principal bien exportable. Los movimientos de protesta de la clase media y los trabajadores de las minas llevaron al poder a gobiernos militares con tendencias socialistas de estado.
German: In der Außenpolitik musste Bolivien schmerzhafte Niederlagen einstecken: Ein Grenzkonflikt mit Chile führte zum Salpeterkrieg 1879 -1883, den Bolivien trotz einer Allianz mit Peru verlor. Das Land musste die Küstenprovinz Antofagasta im Friedensvertrag von Valparaiso 1884 abgeben und verlor so seinen Seezugang. 1903 unterzeichneten Brasilien und Bolivien den Vertrag von Pétroplis, der Brasilien die wichtige Gummiprovinz Acre zusprach. 2 Millionen Pfund Sterling konnten den Verlust nicht kompensieren. Der Versuch, sich im Chaco-Krieg mit Paraguay (1932 - 1935) einen Hafen zu sichern, führte zum Verlust des Großteils der Region des Chaco Boreal, sicherte aber wenigstens den Zugang auf den Paraguay-Fluss, der in den Atlantischen Ozean mündete (im Vertrag von Buenos Aires 1938 besiegelt). Der Chaco-Krieg und die Große Depression beendeten die positive wirtschaftliche Entwicklung seit 1895, bei der Zinn zum Hauptexportprodukt wurde. Angesichts von Protestbewegungen des Mittelstandes und der Minenarbeiter übernahmen Militärregierungen mit staatssozialistischen Tendenzen die Macht.

English: The Treaty of Berlin in 1878 forced the Ottomans to cede administration of Bosnia to Austria-Hungary. A state of relative stability was reached soon enough and Austro-Hungarian authorities were able to embark on a number of social and administrative reforms. With the aim of establishing the province as a stable political model that would help dissipate rising South Slav nationalism, Habsburg rule did much to codify laws, to introduce new political practices and generally to provide for modernization. The Austro-Hungarian policy, which advocated the ideal of a pluralist and multi-confessional Bosnian nation, was largely favored by the Muslims and its economical success also helped soothing the rising tides of nationalism. Austria-Hungary decided to annex Bosnia in October 1908 as a common holding under the control of the Finance ministry, rather than attaching it to either territorial government. This decision once again rised the soothed nationalism and worsened the relations between Austria-Hungary and Russia. The political tensions culminated on June 28 1914, when the heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne, Archduke Franz Ferdinand, was assassinated in Sarajevo, an event that proved to be the spark that set off the Weltkrieg. Although some Bosnians died serving in the armies of the various warring states, Bosnia itself managed to escape the conflict relatively unscathed. The German mediation in the renegotiations of the Ausgleich in 1927 put Bosnia under the direct control of the Austrian Crown. The status of Bosnia will probably change again in the Ausgleich of 1937 when Austria might try enforce its authority or maybe even cede its control to Hungary or Croatia.

After the abolition of slavery in 1888, the ideals of Republicanism gained much support from across all regions in the Brazilian Empire. This, combined with decreasing support for the House of Orléans-Braganza, culminated in the military-supported declaration of the Republic of Brazil, in 1889. A series of relatively stable and strongly conservative governments ensued across the following decades. As the Weitkrieg erupted in Europe, Brazil declared its neutrality, despite close relationships with the Entente powers. After the war, the flourishing of Brazil's trading with the Old Continent contributed greatly to the wealth of the nation, decreasing the chances of any major economical crisis across the late-1910s and 1920s. Growing industries and a high influx of immigrants led to a strong industrial proletariat. For the last three years, however, trade with Europe and North America started to decline and many fear that a global economic crisis could be approaching. A blow to the Brazilian economy already came in 1934, when the country decided to intervene on Bolivia's side in the Great South American War. Despite a successful initial advance towards the La Plata river, Brazil was unable to withstand the pressure when Argentinean forces counterattacked in 1935, and the Brazilian troops were forced on a great retreat. With Argentinean forces poised to take Curitiba and her own armed forces in disarray, Brazil sued for peace. Since this humiliating defeat, Brazil's First Republic has been on the brink of its end. The apparent stability represented by the 'Café com Leite' doctrine - the dominance of Brazilian politics by the landed oligarchies of S?o Paulo and Minas Gerais - is revealing itself a farse, as general dissent against the federal government becomes more and more apparent. Old rivalries between different sectors of society are awaken. Unsatisfaction by the local elites of the South and Northeast against the government in Rio, and also by the industrialists in S?o Paulo, is growing. The 'cangaço' bandits, led by figures like Lampi?o and Corisco, are running rampant and harassing farmers in Ceará, Bahia and Pernambuco. The Brazilian Workers Confederation, an umbrella organization for the syndicalist movement, is sponsoring heavy labor strikes in the South-Southeast. Meanwhile, populist and nationalist thoughts are growing amongst the army and the middle class. Not even the armed forces can be trusted anymore: the 'Tenentes', nonpartisan reformists officers, can - and will - be mobilized by any side of the political spectrum. Emergency elections have been called for August, and some say that only a miracle can save democracy in Brazil.
French: Après l’abolition de l’esclavage en 1888, les républicains brésiliens bénéficient d’un large soutien populaire dans toutes les régions de l’empire. La rébellion débute en 1889 par une révolte de la garnison militaire et prend fin avec la création de la République du Brésil. La constitution adoptée en 1891 s’inspire du modèle américain et laisse donc une grande part d’autonomie aux différentes provinces. La situation intérieure se stabilise sous les gouvernements des premiers présidents élus mais le Brésil sombre soudainement dans une crise économique qui va durement affecter l’industrie du pays. Cela commence par la crise du sucre, en 1890, puis la crise du café, en 1896, et finalement la chute du cour du caoutchouc, en 1913. A la même période, le ministre des affaires étrangères brésilien, le Baron do Rio Branco, agrandit le territoire de près de 650000 km2 en signant des traités avec la Guyane anglaise, la Colombie, la Bolivie, le Pérou et l’Uruguay. Le développement industriel et l’afflux d’immigrants accroissent l’importance de la classe prolétarienne et modifient profondément la société brésilienne. La Grande Dépression de 1929-1930 fait littéralement dégringoler les prix du café et du caoutchouc mettant ainsi fin aux exportations florissantes qu’avait connues le Brésil après la Première Guerre mondiale. Un mouvement d’officiers réformistes connu sous le nom de “Tenentismo” profite de la crise pour soutenir la révolution dirigée par Getúlio Dornelles Vargas, qui modifie la constitution dès son accession au pouvoir. Il établit peu à peu un régime dictatorial fondé sur l’autorité présidentielle et une autonomie très restreinte des Etats fédéraux.
Italian: Con l'abolizione della schiavitù, avvenuta nel 1888, i repubblicani ottennero molto sostegno da tutte le parti dell'impero brasiliano. Nel 1889, la rivolta iniziò con una sommossa della guarnigione militare e terminò con la proclamazione della Repubblica del Brasile. Nel 1891, venne stilata e promulgata una costituzione sul modello di quella americana, che garantiva notevoli autonomie alle rispettive province. Sotto il primo presidente eletto, la situazione interna si stabilizzò, ma il Brasile dovette affrontare una serie di crisi economiche - la crisi dello zucchero nel 1890, quella del caffè nel 1896 e la fine del boom della gomma nel 1913. Nel frattempo, il ministro degli esteri brasiliano, Baron Do Rio Branco aveva esteso il territorio brasiliano di oltre 250.000 metri quadrati attraverso una serie di trattati con la Guyana britannica, la Colombia, la Bolivia, il Perù e l'Uruguay. Le crescenti industrie, unite a un elevato flusso di immigrati, avevano portato alla nascita di un forte proletariato industriale, cambiando la società del Brasile. Le fiorenti esportazioni dopo la Prima Guerra Mondiale finirono con la grande depressione del 1929/30, soprattutto a causa del crollo dei prezzi di caffè e gomma. Un movimento di ufficiali riformisti sociali, chiamato 'Tenentismo', si avvantaggiò della situazione, sostenendo la rivoluzione di Getúlio Dornelles Vargas che stabilì una legge dittatoriale che assegnava forti poteri al presidente, limitando di molto le autonomie degli stati federali, trasformando in breve il Brasile in una dittatura.
Spanish: Tras la abolición de la esclavitud en 1888, los republicanos ganaron muchos apoyos en todo el Imperio de Brasil. En 1889, la revuelta comenzó con un alzamiento militar y acabó con la proclamación de la República de Brasil. La constitución de 1891 se basó en la de los Estados Unidos y concedió una autonomía considerable a las distintas provincias. Bajo los primeros presidentes electos, la situación interna se estabilizó, pero Brasil cayó en un ciclo de crisis económicas: la crisis del azúcar de 1890, la crisis del café de 1896, el final del boom del caucho de 1913. Mientras tanto, el barón Do Rio Branco, ministro de exteriores, extendió el territorio brasileño mediante una serie de tratados con la Guyana Británica, Colombia, Bolivia, Perú y Uruguay, ampliando la superficie del país en 400.000 kilómetros cuadrados. El crecimiento industrial y la gran afluencia de inmigrantes crearon un poderoso proletariado industrial que cambió la sociedad brasileña. El aumento de las exportaciones tras la Primera Guerra Mundial acabó con la Gran Depresión de 1929-1930, especialmente cuando los precios del café y el caucho cayeron en picado. Un movimiento de oficiales social-reformistas llamado 'Tenentismo' se aprovechó de la situación, apoyando la revolución de Getúlio Dornelles Vargas, que estableció un gobierno autoritario con grandes poderes presidenciales y una drástica reducción de las autonomías de los estados federales, convirtiendo al poco tiempo a Brasil en una dictadura.
German: Nach der Abschaffung der Sklaverei im Jahre 1888 erhielten die Republikaner viel Zulauf aus allen Teilen des brasilianischen Reiches. 1889 begann die Revolte mit einem Aufstand der Militärgarnison und endete mit der Proklamation der Republik Brasilien. Die Verfassung von 1891 war nach dem Muster der US-Konstitution gestrickt und gewährte den jeweiligen Provinzen beträchtliche Autonomie. Unter den ersten gewählten Präsidenten stabilisierte sich die innenpolitische Lage, aber Brasilien geriet unter die Räder verschiedener Wirtschaftskrisen - die Zuckerkrise von 1890, die Kaffeekrise von 1896, das Ende des Gummibooms 1913. Währenddessen erweiterte Brasiliens Außenminister Baron Do Rio Branco das Gebiet Brasiliens mittels einer Reihe von Abkommen mit Britisch Guyana, Kolumbien, Bolivien, Peru und Uruguay auf über 402.335 Quadratkilometer. Wachsende Industrien und ein stetiger Einwandererstrom führten zu einem starken Industrieproletariat und einem Wandel der brasilianischen Gesellschaft. Die blühenden Exporte nach dem Ersten Weltkrieg endeten mit der Großen Depression von 1929/30, besonders als die Preise für Kaffee und Gummi ins Bodenlose stürzten. Der 'Tenentismo', eine Sozialreformbewegung von Offizieren, nutzte die Situation durch Unterstützung der Revolution von Getúlio Dornelles Vargas aus, der eine autoritäre Regierung mit enormer präsidentialer Macht und stark reduzierten Autonomien der Bundesstaaten erstellte und Brasilien allmählich in eine Diktatur verwandelte.

Rozwijaj¹ca siê gospodarka i spory nap³yw imigrantów skutkowa³ wytworzeniem siê silnego proletariatu, który zmieni³  spo³eczeñstwo Brazylii. Rozkwit gospodarczy, spowodowany prê¿nym eksportem po pierwszej wojnie œwiatowej, zakoñczy³ siê w czasie wielkiego kryzysu ekonomicznego w latach 1929/30, szczególnie gdy znacznie spad³y ceny kawy i kauczuku. English: After the preliminary peace of San Stefano in the 8th Russian-Turkish War 1877/78, the newly formed nation state of Bulgaria included Macedonia to the Ochrid Lake, and a coastal strip on the Aegean Sea (so-called ‘Greater’ Bulgaria). The Berlin Congress of 1878 however limited the country's territory to the region between the Danube and Balkans, whilst Macedonia and Eastern Rumelia remained with the Ottoman Empire. Russia watched the successes of Prince Alexander I (such as the annexation of Eastern Rumelia in 1885 and victory over Serbia in 1885/86) with distrust.Interested in controlling Bulgaria the Russians forced Alexander I to abdicate after orchestrating a coup led by pro-Russian officers. His successor was Ferdinand of Saxony-Coburg-Gotha, and it was he who achieved the formal independence from the Ottomans and crowned Tsar in 1908. With the idea of a Greater Bulgaria as a kind of ‘manifest destiny’ the country became the driving force in the Balkans League and carried the much of the burden in the First Balkan War (1912/13). Defeat at the hands of the other Balkan states soon after this war cost Bulgaria much of her hard won land, but its participation on the victorious side in the Great War reversed these losses and Ferdinand's vision seemed finally to be reality.However unrest in the recaptured regions, subversive nationalist propaganda campaigns by the other Balkan states and the general economic difficulties of the 1920's meant Bulgaria was unable to make full use of its newly found power, despite German industrial assistance and by 1936 the Bulgarian empire is beginning to descend into chaos. Its neighbours are once more eyeing up the lands on their borders, and rumours are emerging of a potential Pan-Balkan alliance to achieve these aims. A strong leader will be needed to guide Bulgaria out of her troubles and become the only real power in the Balkans.
French: A l’issue de la huitième guerre russo-turque (1877-1878), le traité de San Stefano reconnaît l’indépendance de la Bulgarie qui comprend alors la Macédoine jusqu’au lac Ohrid ainsi qu’une bande côtière le long de la mer Egée. En 1878, la révision du traité au congrès de Berlin limite le territoire bulgare à la région qui s’étend entre le Danube et les Balkans. La Macédoine et la Roumélie orientale sont attribuées à l’Empire ottoman. Souhaitant prendre le contrôle de la Bulgarie, la Russie assiste avec regrets aux succès politiques et militaires du prince Alexandre Ier (annexion de la Roumélie orientale en 1885 et victoire sur la Serbie en 1885-86). Elle force finalement le prince à abdiquer grâce à un coup d’Etat mené par des sympathisants russes. Le nouveau prince s’appelle Ferdinand de Saxe-Cobourg-Gotha. Il fait officiellement reconnaître l’indépendance de la Bulgarie par rapport à l’Empire ottoman et se fait couronner tsar en 1908. Il s'engage ensuite aux côtés de la Serbie, de la Grèce et du Monténégro dans la première guerre balkanique (1912-1913). Les espoirs tsaristes de conquête des Balkans (libérés de l’emprise turque) prennent fin en 1913 lorsque la Bulgarie est vaincue au cours de la deuxième guerre balkanique par la coalition formée par la Grèce, la Serbie, le Monténégro et l’Empire ottoman. Le traité de Bucarest prive les Bulgares d’une grande partie des territoires conquis au cours de la première guerre balkanique : la Dobroudja revient à la Roumanie et Andrinople est attribuée aux Ottomans. Bien que la Bulgarie ait réclamé l'intégralité de la Macédoine, elle n’en reçoit qu’une petite bande territoriale le long du massif Pirin, le reste de la région bénéficiant à la Serbie et à la Grèce. En 1915, la Bulgarie se joint aux puissances moyennes et occupe les territoires dont elle souhaite s’emparer. Après la victoire de l’Entente qui se solde par l’élaboration du traité de Neuilly en 1919, le pays perd les territoires nouvellement conquis ainsi que l’accès à la mer Egée puisque la Thrace méridionale est attribuée à la Grèce. Ferdinand Ier abdique en faveur de son fils, Boris III, en 1918. Le premier ministre et chef du parti radical des fermiers, Alexandre Stambolijski (1919-1923), ordonne une réforme du système terrien et soutient la fédération des Balkans jusqu’à ce qu’il soit assassiné lors d’un coup d’Etat perpétré en 1923. Le parti communiste est banni après l'une de ses insurrections et son dirigeant Georgi Dimitrov est contraint de s’exiler en Union Soviétique.
Italian: Dopo la pace preliminare di Santo Stefano nell'ottava guerra russo-turca (1877/78), il nuovo stato di Bulgaria includeva i territori dalla Macedonia al lago Ochrid e una striscia costiera sul mare Egeo. Il congresso di Berlino del 1878, limitò invece il territorio del paese alla regione compresa fra il Danubio e i Balcani. La Macedonia e la Rumelia orientale rimasero all'impero ottomano. La Russia, interessata al controllo della Bulgaria, osservava con diffidenza i successi del principe Alessandro I (l'annessione della Rumelia orientale nel 1885 e la vittoria sulla Serbia nel 1885/86). Un colpo di stato da parte di ufficiali pro-russi, costrinse Alessandro I ad abdicare. Il suo successore, Ferdinando di Sassonia-Coburg-Gotha, riuscì a ottenere l'indipendenza formale dagli ottomani e venne incoronato zar nel 1908. Con la prospettiva di creare una grande Bulgaria, il paese divenne la forza trainante nella lega dei Balcani e portò il peso maggiore nella prima guerra dei Balcani (1912/13). Durante la seconda guerra dei Balcani (1913), nella quale la Bulgaria mirava ad annettere parti dei Balcani ora libere dai turchi, il paese andò incontro a una sconfitta a opera di una coalizione composta da Grecia, Serbia, Montenegro, Romania e dall'impero ottomano. Nella pace di Bucarest, la Bulgaria perse gran parte delle conquiste ottenute nel corso della prima guerra dei Balcani, la Dobrudja meridionale finì alla Romania mentre Adrianopoli andò agli Ottomani. Della Macedonia, che la Bulgaria aveva chiesto per intero, riuscì a conservare solo una piccola striscia nei monti Pirin, mentre il resto venne spartito fra Serbia e Grecia. Nel 1915, la Bulgaria si unì alle potenze medie occupando i territori che aveva cercato di conquistare in passato. Dopo la vittoria dell'intesa, il paese perse le sue conquiste nella pace di Neuilly (1919), più l'accesso al mare Egeo in favore della Grecia alla quale fu assegnata la Tracia meridionale. Ferdinando I abdicò nel 1918 in favore di suo figlio Boris III. Il primo ministro, Alexander Stambuliski (1919-1923), leader del Partito agricolo radicale, mise in atto una riforma della terra e aiutò la federazione dei Balcani fino alla sua morte durante un colpo militare nel 1923. Dopo la rivolta comunista quel partito venne bandito e Georgi Dimitrov venne esiliato in Unione Sovietica.
Spanish: Tras la paz preliminar de San Stefano en la Octava Guerra Ruso-turca de 1877-78, el recién fundado estado nacional de Bulgaria incluyó Macedonia hasta el lago Ochrid y una franja costera en el Mar Egeo. Sin embargo, el Congreso de Berlín de 1878 limitó su territorio a la región entre el Danubio y los Balcanes. Macedonia y la Rumelia Oriental siguieron perteneciendo al Imperio Otomano. Rusia, interesada en controlar Bulgaria, observó con desconfianza los éxitos del príncipe Alejandro I (anexión de la Rumelia Oriental en 1885 y victoria sobre Serbia en 1885-86). Los rusos obligaron a abdicar a Alejandro I tras un golpe de estado de militares partidarios de Rusia. Le sucedió Fernando de Sajonia-Coburgo-Gotha. Éste consiguió la independencia oficial de los otomanos y fue coronado zar en 1908. Con la idea de una Gran Bulgaria como visión, el país se convirtió en la fuerza impulsora de la Liga de los Balcanes y llevó la mayor carga de la Primera Guerra de los Balcanes (1912-13). Durante la Segunda Guerra de los Balcanes, en la que había planeado absorber las partes de los Balcanes libres del yugo otomano, Bulgaria fue derrotada por una coalición formada por Grecia, Serbia, Montenegro, Rumania y el Imperio Otomano. En la Paz de Bucarest, perdieron gran parte de lo ganado en la Primera Guerra de los Balcanes: la Dobrudja occidental pasó a manos de Rumania, y Adrianópolis a los otomanos. De Macedonia, que Bulgaria había exigido en su totalidad, sólo consiguieron quedarse con una franja en los Montes Ródope y el resto fue dividido entre Serbia y Grecia. En 1915, Bulgaria se unió a las potencias intermedias y ocupó los territorios que pretendía para sí. Tras la victoria de la Entente, el país fue despojado de sus conquistas en la Paz de Neuilly de 1919, además de su acceso al mar Egeo, ya que la Tracia occidental pasó a formar parte de Grecia. En 1918, Fernando I abdicó en favor de su hijo, Boris III. El Primer Ministro Alejandro Stamboliski (1919-1923), líder del radical Partido Agrario, promulgó una reforma agraria y apoyó a la Federación de los Balcanes hasta que fue asesinado en un golpe militar en 1923. Tras la revuelta comunista, el partido fue ilegalizado y Georgi Dimitrov se exilió a la Unión Soviética.
German: Nach dem Vorfrieden von San Stefano im achten Russisch-Türkischen Krieg von 1877/78 bestand der neuformierte Nationalstaat Bulgarien aus Mazedonien bis zum Ochridsee und einem Küstenstreifen am Ägäischen Meer. Im Berliner Kongress von 1878 wurde die Fläche Bulgariens jedoch auf die Region zwischen der Donau und dem Balkan begrenzt. Mazedonien und Ostrumelien blieben beim Osmanischen Reich. Da sich Russland für die Kontrolle Bulgariens interessierte, beobachtete es die Erfolge von Prinz Alexander I. (Annektierung Ostrumeliens 1885 und Sieg über Serbien 1885/86) mit Misstrauen. Ein Putsch pro-russischer Offiziere zwang Alexander I. zur Abdankung. Zu seinem Nachfolger wurde Ferdinand von Sachsen-Coburg-Gotha ernannt. Dieser erreichte die formelle Unabhängigkeit von den Osmanen und wurde 1908 vom Zar gekrönt. Die Vorstellung eines Großbulgariens wurde im Balkanbund zur treibenden Kraft und trug die Hauptschuld am ersten Balkankrieg von 1912/13. Im zweiten Balkankrieg von 1913, in dem Bulgarien sich Teile des Balkans, aus dem sich die Türken zurückgezogen hatten, einverleiben wollte, unterlag es einem Bündnis von Griechenland, Serbien, Montenegro, Rumänien und dem Osmanischen Reich. Im Frieden von Bukarest verlor es große Teile der Gebietsgewinne des ersten Balkankriegs – die Süddobrudja ging an Rumänien und Adrianopel an die Osmanen. Von Mazedonien, welches Bulgarien als Ganzes gefordert hatte, konnte es nur einen schmalen Streifen am Pirin-Gebirge halten – der Rest wurde zwischen Serbien und Griechenland aufgeteilt. 1915 trat Bulgarien den Mittelmächten bei und besetzte die von ihm begehrten Gebiete. Nach dem Sieg der Entente wurden Bulgarien seine Eroberungen 1919 im Vertrag von Neuilly wieder aberkannt. Außerdem verlor es seinen Zugang zur Ägäis, da Südthrakien Griechenland zugesprochen wurde. Ferdinand I. dankte im Jahr 1918 zugunsten seines Sohnes Boris III.ab. Der Premierminister Alexander Stambuliski (1919 - 1923), Führer der radikalen Bauernpartei, verfügte eine Landreform und unterstützte die Balkanföderation bis zu seiner Ermordung 1923 während eines Militärputsches. Als die kommunistische Partei nach einem Aufstand verboten wurde, ging Georgi Dimitrow ins sowjetische Exil.
