English: The 1925 British Revolution unavoidably caused the downfall of its once mighty colonial empire. While India proper soon cemented into three separate nation states, the status of Burma was long unclear - with Bhartiyan, Siamese, Chinese, Native Burmese and British loyalist forces all operating in the country, the region was a chaotic patchwork of territories resembling near-warlordism. Although the British loyalists (operating mainly from Mandalay and Rangoon) were soon crushed and the Chinese were soon distracted by their own civil war, the Bhartiyans and Siamese kept troops within the country until 1929 - when, fed up with the unstable situation, German mediation brought an end to the hostilities. The resulting treaty awarded parts of eastern and northern Burma to Siam, and left the rest of the country under a restored Konbaung dynasty. In the years since, Queen Myat Pya Lat has struggled to cement her rule against an increasingly radical and politically demanding populace. All the while, Bhartiya waits for an opportunity to spread the revolution east. When the day comes, will Burma be ready?

Despite the economic turmoil that hit the United States during the 1920's and 30's the western states were able to maintain a level of relative prosperity through a combination of valuable trade links with Japan and Russia, as well as the political influence of many of the larger landowners and industrialists (many of whom were Senators or Congressmen). As a result, the inhabitants were not as prepared to look to radical alternative movements to democracy that grew up during the 1930's as the people in less well off areas- not least because they feared that to do so would destroy their own prosperity. When the events of September-October 1936 resulted in the dislocation of power in the US, the influential businessmen of the Pacific coast chose to break away from the newly established government to form an independent 'nation within a nation'. Only time will tell whether the Federal government will come to a compromise with the West, or whether a new civil war would occur, pitting west against east.

Canada saw a quick economic rise through the combined impacts of the transcontinental railroad (completed in 1885), shipping, industries and settling in the West. The dominion supported Great Britain during the Boer War and the Weltkrieg, but due to her remote location she was able to avoid serious penalties in the resulting peace, and Canada seemed set to continue as she always had. However, when the collapse of royal and parliamentary authority in Britain in 1925 resulted in the royal family and central government of Britain fleeing to the country, Canada has been set down a different path.Slow industrialisation funded by the old families of Britain and the maintenance of trade links to the US have allowing it to avoid some of the economic decline seen in other nations outside German influence. There is some dissent growing amongst the Canadian population about the presence of the British exiles increasing political dominance and the fixation of Canada bending towards being the means towards their aim of ‘liberating’ Britain. The spread of such sentiment has however been slowed by propaganda against the left and encouraging a strong and restored Commonwealth, seen as a means of returning to the economic and political securities of the 19th century.The political situation with regards to the newly created Union of Britain remained tense over the next decade but neither side was prepared or able to escalate matters into open warfare. By 1936, however Canada's navy continues to grow rapidly in strength, and some amongst the Royalist faction are beginning to suggest that the time has come for direct measures to retake the Home Islands. With the possibility of this being a feasible goal growing with each day, war seems inevitable.
French: La mise en place définitive du chemin de fer transcontinental en 1890, le commerce maritime, le développement industriel et l’installation de nouveaux habitants à l’Ouest donnent un grand coup de pouce à l’économie canadienne qui entre dès lors dans une période de croissance prospère. Le Canada soutient les actions britanniques pendant la guerre des Boers et la Première Guerre mondiale mais marque son statut semi-indépendant en signant, dès 1919, le traité de Versailles en son propre nom et en acceptant par la suite un siège au sein de la Société des Nations. Lors de la conférence impériale de 1923, le premier ministre libéral, William Lyon Mackenzie King (1921-1930, 1935-1948) demande à ce que le Canada puisse mener une politique étrangère indépendante. Le statut de Westminster confirme en 1931 l’indépendance de l’Etat canadien. La Grande Dépression met fin à la prospérité canadienne à la fin des années 1920. Les conservateurs accèdent alors au pouvoir (1930-1935) et appliquent la politique du New Deal instaurée par Roosevelt aux Etats-Unis. La Banque nationale du Canada est fondée en 1934.
Italian: Il Canada andò incontro a una rapida crescita economica, grazie alla ferrovia trans-continentale terminata nel 1890, al commercio, alle industrie e alla colonizzazione dell'ovest. La sovranità sostenne la Gran Bretagna durante la guerra boera e la Prima Guerra Mondiale, sottolineando il suo stato di semi-indipendenza con la firma personale del trattato di Versailles (1919) e ottenendo un posto nella lega delle nazioni. Il primo ministro liberale, William Lyon Mackenzie King (1921-1930, 1935-1948), nella conferenza dell'impero nel 1923 chiese per il Canada la possibilità di condurre una politica estera indipendente. Con la dichiarazione di Balfour alla conferenza dell'impero del 1926, il Canada ottenne l'indipendenza e l'emancipazione all'interno del Commonwealth. Lo statuto di Westminster (1931), sancì l'indipendenza del Canada. Dopo il periodo di prosperità degli anni '20, il paese fu investito dalla grande depressione. I conservatori saliti al potere (1930-1935), seguirono la politica del New Deal di Roosevelt. Nel 1934 veniva fondata la banca del Canada.
Spanish: Canadá conoció un rápido ascenso económico gracias a la compleción en 1885 del ferrocarril intercontinental, la industria naviera, la industria y la colonización del oeste del país. El dominio apoyó a Gran Bretaña durante la Guerra de los Bóers y la Primera Guerra Mundial, subrayando su condición de estado semiindependiente al firmar el tratado de Versalles en su beneficio y recibir su propia plaza en la Sociedad de Naciones. En la conferencia del imperio de 1923, el primer ministro liberal William Lyon Mackenzie King (1921-1930, 1935-1948) exigió que Canadá llevase a cabo una política exterior independiente. Con la Declaración Balfour en la Conferencia del Imperio de 1926 se concedió a Canadá la independencia y emancipación dentro de la Commonwealth británica. El Estatuto de Westminster de 1931 declaró a Canadá como estado independiente. La Gran Depresión golpeó con dureza a Canadá tras un periodo de prosperidad en los años 20. Los conservadores que ostentaron el poder entre 1930 y 1935 siguieron la política del New Deal de Roosevelt. En 1934 se fundó el Banco de Canadá.
German: Kanada erlebte dank der Fertigstellung der transkontinentalen Eisenbahn im Jahre 1890 sowie aufgrund von Frachthandel, Industrien und der Besiedelung des Westens ein schnelles wirtschaftliches Wachstum. Die Dominion unterstützte Großbritannien während des Burenkriegs und des Ersten Weltkriegs und unterstrich ihren semi-unabhängigen Status durch die Unterzeichnung des Vertrags von Versailles 1919 und den Erhalt eines eigenen Sitzes im Völkerbund. Der liberale Premierminister William Lyon Mackenzie King (1921 - 1930, 1935 - 1948) verlangte auf der Reichskonferenz 1923 für Kanada die Verabschiedung einer unabhängigen Außenpolitik. Mit der Balfour-Erklärung auf der Reichskonferenz im Jahre 1926 erlangte Kanada Unabhängigkeit und Emanzipation innerhalb des 'Commonwealth of Nations'. Das Westminster-Statut machte Kanada 1931 zu einem unabhängigen Staat. Die Große Depression traf Kanada nach einer Periode des Wohlstandes in den Zwanziger Jahren hart. Die Konservativen gelangten an die Macht (1930 - 1935) und folgten Roosevelts Politik des New Deal. 1934 wurde die 'Bank of Canada' gegründet.

Liberalny premier William Lyon Mackenzie King (1921-1930, 1935-1948) za¿¹da³ przyznania Kanadzie prawa do samostanowienia w sprawach miêdzynarodowych w czasie konferencji Krajów Imperium Brytyjskiego w roku 1923. English: The 1926 German Intervention in China led to the restoration of the Qing Empire on November 1926, following the Treaty of Nanjing that delimited continental China: the south was left to the economic exploitation of German firms, while the north was under the restored Empire's control. German interests in China clubbed together into the state-backed Allgemeine Ostasiatische Gesellschaft (or AlgOstAsien GmbH) consortium to guarantee security and maximum benefit for German industry and penetration of the region. Through the skillful use of Chinese middlemen and control of trade with Europe, the AlgOstAsien GmbH was able to gradually assert economic control over South China, leading to the creation and consolidation of an administrative and military apparatus. In the last ten years, the functionaries in AlgOstAsien GmbH brought in a lot of European money and used China as a testing ground for radical production and administration techniques, creating a large industrial base. However, dissent and nationalism is rising and the Qing Empire or the warlords in Yunnan might try to assert their authority over this lands.

In 1911 the Xinhai Revolution overthrew the Qing Empire ending centuries of imperial rule and the Republic of China was born it's founder Dr. Sun Yat-Sen however would not lead as president instead the job was given to former imperial official Yuan Shikai who's corrupt inefficient leadership lead to civil war and chaos nearly destroying the republic, when Yuan declared himself Emperor the nation revolted against him bringing all of China into civil war. Zhang Zouloin the warlord of Manchuria even turned to the Japanese for protection. When Yuan died in 1916 his empire fell apart but the civil war continued Sun Yat-Sen finally stepped up to save his nation but the damage done was to great the republic was falling to pieces and even the Great Father of the Republic could not save it from destruction.The chaos and the infighting got so bad that in 1926 the 15th year of the Republic the German Empire invaded China to restore order and end the chaos.The German Army restored the Qing Empire under the Xuantong Emperor in the northern china and founded a colonial company the AOG in the south, it seemed the Republic of China was dead and gone forever. However in 1936 the incompetence of the AOG lead to Guangzhou Revolution and the restoration of the republic. Now the revolution must be won and imperialist pushed out only then will the republic finally be on it's way to freeing China and putting forth the Sun Min Doctrine and finally achieving the goals of Dr Sun Yat-Sen.
French: La Chine nationaliste vit une période à la fois prospère et difficile au début des années 1930. Le régime de Guomindang est au sommet de sa puissance sous le régime de Chiang Kai-Shek après avoir envoyé les communistes de Mao Zedong dans la marche exténuante de 9500 km vers Shaanxi. Ils s’affirment ensuite comme la force la plus importante du paysage politique chinois. Il semble alors que la Chine est enfin gouvernée par un régime stable et moderniste prêt à faire entrer le pays dans le 20e siècle après des décennies d’humiliation et de domination étrangère. Pourtant le pays doit faire face à une nouvelle menace émanant des ambitions expansionnistes du Japon dont la belligérance et l’impérialisme sont en croissance constante. La Chine qui a déjà cédé la Mandchourie à son rival nippon en 1931 est apparemment forcée à affronter de nouveau la nation insulaire. Pourtant Chiang Kai-Shek ne semble toujours pas décidé à en finir avec la guerre civile qui oppose ses forces aux militants communistes. La Chine doit désormais répondre à une question cruciale, si le Japon poursuit son expansion territoriale, les nationalistes seront-ils prêts à défendre leur pays ou la Chine souffrira-t-elle une seconde humiliation ?
Italian: I primi anni '30 si rivelarono sia positivi che negativi per la Cina nazionalista. Da una parte, il regime Guomindang sotto Chiang Kai-Shek era al culmine del potere, avendo guidato i comunisti di Mao Tse-Tung nella loro massacrante marcia di 6.000 chilometri fino a Shaanxi, facendone la forza più potente della politica cinese. Sembrava che la Cina fosse per lo meno unita sotto un regime stabile e moderno, pronto a portare il paese nel ventesimo secolo dopo anni di umiliazioni a opera dei paesi più forti. Tuttavia, dovette fronteggiare una dura sfida: il Giappone sempre più belligerante e imperialista, desideroso di espandere la propria base di risorse a spese della Cina. Dopo aver concesso il controllo della Manciuria ai giapponesi nel 1931, la Cina sembrava destinata a un nuovo scontro, anche se, all'inizio del 1936, Chiang non mostrava segni di arresa nella sua guerra civile contro i comunisti. Il problema Cina doveva essere affrontato seriamente: in caso di continua espansione giapponese, chi sarebbe stato umiliato di nuovo, la lotta nazionalista o tutto il paese?
Spanish: Los primeros años de la década de los 30 fueron buenos y malos para la China Nacionalista. Por un lado, el régimen del Kuomintang bajo el liderato de Jiang Jieshi se encontraba en la cima de su poder, tras haber obligado a huir a las fuerzas comunistas de Mao Zedong a una agotadora marcha de 12.000 kilómetros hasta Shaanxi y haberse consolidado como el poder preeminente en la política China. Parecía que China estaba por fin unida bajo un régimen estable y modernizador dispuesto a introducir al país en el siglo XX tras años de humillación a manos de países más poderosos. Pero se enfrentaba a un serio desafío: un Japón cada vez más beligerante e imperialista que deseaba expandir su base de recursos a expensas de China. Tras haber cedido el control de Manchuria a los japoneses en 1931, China parece destinada a más enfrentamientos con la nación-isla pero, a principios de 1936, Chiang no da ninguna muestra de ceder en su guerra civil contra los comunistas. La pregunta a la que China debe enfrentarse ahora es dolorosa: cuando Japón prosiga (si prosigue) con su expansión, ¿lucharán los nacionalistas o China se verá de nuevo humillada?
German: Die frühen dreißiger Jahre brachten für Nationalchina sowohl Gutes als auch Schlechtes: Auf der einen Seite war das Guomindang-Regime unter Chiang Kai-shek auf der Höhe seiner Macht – es hatte Mao Tse-tungs Kommunisten auf ihren mörderischen 6.000-Meilen-Marsch nach Shaanxi getrieben und sich als stärkste Kraft in der chinesischen Politik behauptet. Es schien, dass China endlich unter einem stabilen, auf Modernisierung besonnenen Regime vereinigt war, welches das Land nach Jahren der Demütigung durch stärkere Nationen endlich ins zwanzigste Jahrhundert bringen wollte. Auf der anderen Seite sah es sich einer ernsthaften Bedrohung gegenüber, dem immer kriegerischer und imperialistischer werdenden Japan mit dem Plan, seine Ressourcen zu Lasten Chinas aufzustocken. Nachdem China 1931 schon die Mandschurei an die Japaner abtreten musste, scheinen weitere Zusammenstöße mit der Inselnation auf dem Programm zu stehen. Trotzdem lässt Chiang Anfang 1936 keineswegs von seinem Bürgerkrieg gegen die Kommunisten ab. Den Nationalisten stellt sich nun die harte Frage, ob sie bei neuerlichen Expansionsbestrebungen Japans nach China kämpfen oder die erneute Demütigung Chinas zulassen sollen...

English: The Shangqing Tianguo (English: The Pure Kingdom Upon the Heavens) is a theocratic revolutionary state founded by Zhang Tianran and his I-Kuan Tao (English: The Path of Consistence), it is also considered the "spiritual successor" of the Taiping Tianguo, the failed rebellion attempt against the Qing Empire in the 1850s-60s. The State is controlled by the Great Teacher, position held the founder of the I-Kuan Tao, and his second-in-command woman and wife, Sun Sunzhen. The I-Kuan Tao combines Taoist, Confucianist and Buddhist concepts and philosophy with western religion's, specially Christianism and Islam, and like the latter two, is monotheistic. This state was founded following the German intervention in China, in the mid-20s when the people saw the, already hated, restored Qing dynasty as even more corrupt and foreign-controlled, not worthy of holding the mandate of heaven. Moved by Zhang Tianran and his charismatic speeches about an united China ruled only by Chinese people, a powerful middle kingdom, a Kingdom over the heavens, these people rallied to his cause, and over a couple of years, his little cult grown to a powerful faction to be considered, with special strength in the mountains of central China, in the Shaanxi province. In 1924, they successfully revolted against the Qing government, seizing the Shaanxi province, implemented a theocratic, but benevolent, government and compared to the Qing government, liberal and with a modern bureaucracy. Zhang then proceed to to industrialize the province and founded an army which he named "Millenarian Movement Army" and entitled Fang Zhimin, a known military commander and faithful follower of the I-Kuan Tao , as "Commander of the great armies of heaven", who proceed to heavily fortify the province, successfully. Now, 1936, after gathering a great army and followers and industrializing and modernising his state, Zhang Tianran has declared a "Heavenly Crusade", to expel the foreign, the corrupt and the impure from the Middle Kingdom. Will this campaign success, will China be really be the Empire on top of the heaven that he proclaims? Or will he fade on the shadows of history, as another failed revolutionary?

After the Saltpeter War 1879 - 1883 in which Chile received the Peruvian saltpeter provinces Tarapacá and Arica in addition to the Bolivian coastal region of Antofagasta the country had command over vast copper deposits and monopolized the world trade in saltpeter. A phase of economic prosperity was initiated, supported by the high demand for saltpeter at the beginning of Weltkrieg. However, the chemical processes devised during that war to artificially produce saltpeter rendered Chile's deposits worthless. Worsening economic circumstances, together with the growth of the population increased social crisis. Workers and unions gained political influence. President Arturo Alessandri y Palma (1920 -1925, 1932 - 1938) tried to overcome the social tensions. A new constitution expanded the president's powers at the cost of the congress' authority.
French: A l’issue de la guerre du Pacifique (1879-1883), le Chili obtient les provinces salpêtreuses de Tarapacá et d’Arica ainsi que la région côtière Antofagasta, jusque-là bolivienne. Suite à ces acquisitions, le pays contrôle de grandes mines de cuivre et monopolise le commerce mondial du salpêtre. Le Chili entre alors dans une période de prospérité économique stimulée par la forte demande au début de la Première Guerre mondiale. Pourtant les procédés chimiques de fabrication du salpêtre découverts au cours de la guerre font des mines de salpêtre chiliennes une ressource parfaitement inutile. La situation économique est encore aggravée par la croissance de la population qui génère une véritable crise sociale. Les partis travaillistes et les syndicats prennent de plus en plus d’importance. Le président Arturo Alessandri y Palma (1920-1925, 1932-1938) tente d’apaiser les tensions sociales. Une nouvelle constitution accroît le pouvoir présidentiel aux dépends de l’autorité du congrès. La dictature militaire de Carlos Ibanez del Campo (1927-1931) s’écroule sous la Grande Dépression et permet au pays de se relever progressivement de la récession.
Italian: Dopo la guerra del salnitro (dal 1879 fino al 1883), nella quale il Cile ottenne le province peruviane di Tarapacá e Arica, oltre alla regione costiera boliviana di Antofagasta, il paese ottenne il controllo su vasti giacimenti di rame e monopolizzò il commercio mondiale del salnitro. Era cominciata una fase di prosperità economica, sostenuta dall'alta richiesta di salnitro all'inizio della Prima Guerra Mondiale. Tuttavia, i processi chimici sviluppati durante il conflitto per produrre artificialmente il salnitro, resero inutili i giacimenti cileni. A peggiorare la situazione economica, insieme alla crescita della popolazione, aumentò anche la crisi. Gli operai e i sindacati ottennero una maggiore influenza politica. Il presidente Arturo Alessandri y Palma (1920-1925, 1932-1938), cercò di superare le tensioni sociali. Una nuova costituzione estese i poteri del presidente sacrificando l'autorità del congresso. Dopo la caduta della dittatura militare di Carlos Ibanez del Campo (1927-1931) in seguito alla grande depressione, il paese si avviò verso un lento recupero post-recessione.
Spanish: Tras la Guerra del Nitrato de 1879-83, en la que Chile recibió las provincias productoras de nitrato peruanas de Tarapacá y Arica, además de la región costera boliviana de Antofagasta, el país controlaba inmensos yacimientos de cobre y monopolizó el comercio mundial de nitrato. Así dio comienzo una fase de prosperidad económica, apoyada en la gran demanda de nitrato al principio de la Primera Guerra Mundial. Sin embargo, el proceso químico concebido durante esa guerra para producir el nitrato de manera artificial dejó sin ningún valor los yacimientos chilenos. Un empeoramiento de las circunstancias económicas, unido al crecimiento de la población, trajo consigo un aumento de la crisis social. Los trabajadores y sindicatos ganaron influencia en la política. EL presidente Arturo Alessandri y Palma (1920-1925 y 1932-1938) intentó superar las tensiones sociales. Una nueva constitución amplió los poderes del presidente a costa de la autoridad del congreso. Después de que la dictadura militar de Carlos Ibáñez del Campo (1927-1931) cayese víctima de la Gran Depresión, el país se recuperó lentamente de la recesión.
German: Nach dem Salpeterkrieg 1879 - 1883, in dem sich Chile die peruanischen Salpeterprovinzen Tarapacá und Arica sowie die bolivianische Küstenregion Antofagasta einverleibt hatte, verfügte das Land nun über riesige Kupfervorkommen und monopolisierte den Welthandel mit Salpeter. Der Beginn des Ersten Weltkriegs sah eine Phase wirtschaftlichen Wachstums, unterstützt von einer starken Salpeter-Nachfrage. Leider machten die während dieses Krieges entwickelten chemischen Prozesse zur künstlichen Salpetererzeugung Chiles Vorkommen vollkommen wertlos. Sich verschlechternde wirtschaftliche Umstände in Kombination mit Bevölkerungszuwachs verschärften soziale Krisen. Der politische Einfluss von Arbeitern und Gewerkschaften nahm zu. Präsident Arturo Alessandri y Palma (1920 -1925, 1932 - 1938) versuchte, die sozialen Spannungen zu entschärfen. Eine neue Verfassung vergrößerte die Macht des Präsidenten auf Kosten der Autorität des Kongresses. Nachdem die Militärdiktatur unter Carlos Ibanez del Campo (1927 -1931) dem Druck der großen Depression ausgesetzt war, erholte sich das Land langsam von der Rezession.

Kraj uzyska³ ogromne z³o¿a rudy miedzi i zmonopolizowa³ œwiatowy handel saletr¹. English: Weakened by civil wars (especially 1899 - 1903), Colombia had to acknowledge U.S. rights of control of the Panama Canal in the Hay-Bunan-Varilla Treaty of 1903, ending the conflict between the two countries about the building of the Canal. When the Colombian Congress denied to ratify the treaty the United States forced the secession of Panama from Colombia, compensating them between 1921 and 1930 with a payment of a total 25 million Dollars. Colombia formally recognized Panama in 1921. The conservatives pursued the modernization of the country, expanding the railrod network. Since 1850 Colombia had been exporting tobacco, after 1900 coffee and bananas were added (with the aid of U.S. capital), after 1905 petroleum. The liberals formed a government in 1930 which enacted a land reform, dispossessing big landowners, and social reforms, with economic benefits for the middle class, the workers' class and the peasants.
French: La Colombie, affaiblie par plusieurs guerres civiles (surtout entre 1899 et 1903), est obligée d’accepter les clauses du traité de Hay-Bunan-Varilla de 1903, octroyant aux Américains le droit de contrôler le canal de Panama. Cette décision met fin aux querelles opposant les deux pays pour la construction du canal. Le congrès colombien refuse dans un premier temps de ratifier le traité, mais les Etats-Unis contraignent la Colombie à se séparer du canal de Panama, offrant en échange un dédommagement de 25 millions de dollars entre 1921 et 1930. La Colombie reconnaît officiellement le Panama en 1921. Les conservateurs poursuivent leurs efforts de modernisation du pays en développant le réseau ferroviaire. La Colombie exporte du tabac depuis 1850. En 1900, elle étend son domaine d’action au café et aux bananes (avec l’aide d’investissements américains) et à partir de 1905, elle se lance dans le pétrole. La Grande Dépression permet aux libéraux de prendre le pouvoir en 1930. Ils entament d’emblée une réforme terrienne visant à déposséder les grands propriétaires terriens, des réformes sociales dans le but de compenser les effets de la crise économique sur les classes moyennes, ouvrières et paysannes.
Italian: Indebolita dalla guerra civile (specialmente fra il 1899 e il 1903), la Colombia dovette riconoscere agli Stati Uniti il controllo del Canale di Panama col trattato di Hay-Bunan-Varilla (1903), ponendo fine al conflitto fra le due nazioni riguardo la costruzione del canale. Il congresso colombiano aveva negato la ratificazione del trattato, quindi gli Stati Uniti forzarono la secessione di Panama dalla Colombia ricompensando quest'ultima con 25 milioni di dollari, erogati fra il 1921 e il 1930. La Colombia riconobbe formalmente Panama nel 1921. I conservatori perseguirono la modernizzazione del paese, espandendo la rete ferroviaria. Dal 1850, la Colombia cominciò ad esportare tabacco, dopo il 1900 vennero aggiunti caffè e banane (con l'aiuto dei capitali americani) e dopo il 1905 il petrolio. La grande depressione portò nel 1930 al governo i liberali, i quali misero in atto una riforma della terra espropriando i grossi proprietari terrieri, e le riforme sociali, mitigando le conseguenze della crisi economica sulle classi media e operaia e sui contadini.
Spanish: Debilitada por las guerras civiles (especialmente de 1899-1903), Colombia tuvo que reconocer los derechos estadounidenses sobre el control del Canal de Panamá en el Tratado de Hay-Bunan-Varilla de 1903, que concluyó el conflicto entre los dos países sobre la construcción del canal.  Cuando el congreso de Colombia se negó a ratificar el tratado, los Estados Unidos forzaron la secesión de Panamá de Colombia, compensando a esta última con un pago de 25 millones de dólares entre 1921 y 1930. Colombia reconoció oficialmente a Panamá en 1921. Los conservadores emprendieron la modernización del país, ampliando la red de ferrocarriles. Colombia había estado exportando tabaco desde 1850, después de 1900 sumaron a ello café y bananas (con la ayuda de capital estadounidense) y petróleo desde 1905. En 1930, la Gran Depresión llevó al poder a los liberales, quienes promulgaron una reforma agraria, expropiando la tierra de los grandes terratenientes, y unas reformas sociales que atenuaron las consecuencias de la crisis económica para la clase media, la clase trabajadora y los campesinos.
German: Geschwächt durch Bürgerkriege (besonders in den Jahren 1899 - 1903) musste Kolumbien die auf dem Vertrag von Hay-Bunan-Varilla basierenden amerikanischen Kontrollrechte über den Panamakanal akzeptieren, wodurch der Konflikt der beiden Staaten bezüglich des Kanalsbaus beigelegt wurde. Als der kolumbianische Kongress die Ratifizierung des Vertrags verweigerte, erzwangen die USA die Trennung von Panama und Kolumbien, wofür Kolumbien zwischen 1921 und 1930 mit insgesamt 25 Millionen Dollar entschädigt wurde. Kolumbien erkannte Panama offiziell im Jahr 1921 an. Die Konservativen trieben die Modernisierung des Landes voran und erweiterten das Schienennetzwerk. Kolumbien hatte seit 1850 Tabak exportiert, nach 1900 kamen (mit Kapitalhilfe der USA) Kaffee und Bananen dazu, nach 1905 Petroleum. Die Große Depression brachte 1930 die Liberalen an die Macht, welche unter Enteignung der Großgrundbesitzer eine Landreform und Sozialreformen verordneten, wodurch die Auswirkungen der Wirtschaftskrise auf den Mittelstand, die Arbeiterklasse und die Bauern gemindert werden konnte.

English: The Freistaat Mittelafrika was created in 1921, after the German victory in the Weltkrieg, with the aim of centralizing the governance of Germany's newly acquired African colonies under one single administration, headed by former Secretary of the German Colonial Office Wilhelm Solf and Paul von Lettow-Vorbeck, the undefeated commander of German forces in East Africa during the Weltkrieg. A collection of military-ruled districts, Mittelafrika was organized as a semi-autonomous component of the Reich, with full control over its internal matters. Its territories were greatly expanded following 1925, when the political turbulence in Great Britain allowed German and Mittelafrikan troops to seize every British colony on the continent south of the Sahara except South Africa and South Rhodesia. Despite its gigantic size, however, Mittelafrika remained a drain for the German economy, consuming German money and manpower for little return, as minor native insurrection plagued the hinterlands from the 1920's well into the early 1930's. In 1932, Lettow-Vorbeck was replaced as Staathalter by Hermann Goering - a popular politician with much potential, but whose actions and right-wing extremist views were starting to embarrass the Kaiser's government. Goering's authoritarian ways have allowed a number of European consortiums, mainly devoted to mining and forestry, to set up camp deep within the Mittelafrikan territory, while caring little for the well-being of the native populations. However his grand plans for the "New Order in Africa", which include revoking the bans on forced labor and removing any kind of social security for the local population, were thwarted by Wilhelm Solf. Despite these setbacks, Goering's policies have at least improved the catastrophic fiscal situation of Mittelafrika. However, even with these minor successes, Mittelafrika still remains largely a burden for the German Empire, consuming precious manpower, money and supplies that are badly needed in Europe and Asia for too little in return. At the same time, Goering has seen the opportunity to create his own powerbase and has begun to enlarge the colonial army, under the excuse of preemptively quelling native uprisings - now, he looks greedily at his own neighbours, especially the Portuguese colonies of Angola and Mozambique. However, gaining approval for his expansionist plans from Berlin will be extremely hard, as Wilhelm Solf is looking for any relevant excuse to remove Goering from his post of Governor of Mittelafrika and is likely to lobby the Reich to block any further adventures. Will Goering achieve success despite the existing obstacles and create a powerhouse in Africa, or will he fall out of favour with Berlin due to his own megalomaniacal dreams?

Costa Rica differed in several ways from other countries in Middle America. Because of the largely white population there were no racial conflicts. Farming was dominated by family businesses owned by a broad middle class offering little fuel for a clash of social interests. Politically, however, influencial and rivaling families called the tune and even resorted to military action to achieve their goals. Sugar and coffee were important export goods, but bananas were the most important one for which a tight railroad was built, improving the economical growth of Costa Rica. The bananas production came slowly under complete control of U.S. businesses (among others United Fruit). Parallel to this, Costa Rica witnessed a calm democratic development with presidents elected in constitutional elections. This period was only interrupted by the short dictatorship of Frederico Tinoco Granodos (1917 - 1919).
French: Le Costa Rica diffère en de nombreux points avec ses voisins d’Amérique centrale. L’importance de la population blanche met le pays à l’abri des conflits raciaux. L’agriculture est une affaire familiale, aux mains d’une classe moyenne dominante, qui laisse peu de place aux rivalités d’ordre social. La politique reste pourtant le domaine de grandes familles rivales qui vont parfois jusqu’à mener des actions militaires pour parvenir à leurs fins. Le sucre et le café sont les principaux produits d’exportation mais ce sont les bananes qui ont conduit à la construction de la ligne ferroviaire qui favorisera la croissance économique du Costa Rica. La production de bananes passe progressivement aux mains des compagnies américaines (dont la United Fruits). Le Costa Rica développe également un système démocratique d’élections constitutionnelles. Cette période de stabilité intérieure est seulement troublée par la courte dictature de Frederico Tinoco Granodos (1917-1919).
Italian: Il Costa Rica si differenziava sotto molti aspetti dagli altri paesi del Centro America. Data la presenza, in larga parte, di popolazione bianca, non esistevano conflitti razziali. L'agricoltura era dominata da aziende a conduzione familiare nelle mani di una vasta classe media e non c'erano sufficienti motivi per alimentare scontri per gli interessi sociali. Politicamente, comunque, le famiglie rivali e influenti dettavano legge, ricorrendo persino alle azioni militari per raggiungere i propri scopi. Lo zucchero e il caffè costituirono importanti merci da esportazione, ma le banane si rivelarono le più importanti di tutte, tanto da sollecitare la costruzione di un'apposita ferrovia che contribuì a migliorare la crescita economica del paese. La produzione delle banane finì lentamente sotto il completo controllo degli affari americani (fra le altre la United Fruit). Contemporaneamente, il Costa Rica assistette a un tranquillo sviluppo democratico, con i presidenti eletti attraverso elezioni costituzionali. Questo periodo venne interrotto solamente dalla breve dittatura di Frederico Tinoco Granodos (1917-1919).
Spanish: Costa Rica se diferenciaba en mucho de otros países de Centroamérica. Debido a que la mayoría de su población era blanca, no había conflictos étnicos. La agricultura estaba dominada por negocios familiares que pertenecían a una gran clase media, lo que restaba potencial a la existencia de tensiones sociales. Sin embargo, en el plano político, la voz cantante estaba en manos de familias influyentes rivales que incluso llegaban a emprender acciones militares para conseguir sus objetivos. El azúcar y el café eran exportaciones importantes, pero las bananas lo eran todavía más, y para ello se construyó un estrecho ferrocarril que mejoró el crecimiento económico de Costa Rica. El control de la producción de bananas fue pasando paulatinamente a manos de empresas estadounidenses (United Fruit, entre otras). Paralelamente, Costa Rica conoció un tranquilo desarrollo democrático, con presidentes elegidos en elecciones constitucionales. Este periodo sólo se vio interrumpido por la efímera dictadura de Federico Tinoco Granados (1917-1919).
German: Costa Rica unterschied sich in mehrerer Hinsicht von anderen mittelamerikanischen Ländern: Aufgrund seiner hauptsächlich weißen Bevölkerung gab es keine Rassenkonflikte. Die Landwirtschaft wurde von Familienbetrieben dominiert, die wiederum einer breiten Mittelklasse angehörten, was wenig Zündstoff für einen Zusammenstoß sozialer Interessen bot. Politisch jedoch gaben einflussreiche und rivalisierende Familien den Ton an und griffen zur Erreichung ihrer Ziele sogar auf Militärgewalt zurück. Zucker und Kaffee waren bedeutende Exportgüter, Bananen waren aber noch wichtiger. Für ihren Transport wurde eine Eisenbahn gebaut, wodurch das Wirtschaftswachstum Costa Ricas anstieg. Die Bananenproduktion kam langsam, aber sicher unter völlige Kontrolle US-amerikanischer Firmen (unter anderem United Fruit). Parallel hierzu entwickelte sich in Costa Rica eine ruhige demokratische Bewegung mit in verfassungsgemäßen Wahlen eingesetzten Präsidenten. Diese Periode wurde nur von der kurzen Diktatur von Frederico Tinoco Granodos (1917 - 1919) unterbrochen.

English: The Kingdom of Croatia was an administrative division (kingdom) of Royal Hungary in the Habsburg Monarchy from 1527 to 1867. The loss of Croatian domestic autonomy was rectified a year after the Austro-Hungarian Compromise of 1867, when in 1868 the Hungarian-Croatian Settlement was negotiated. Under the terms of the Settlement, the governor (ban) of Croatia was appointed by Hungary, 55 percent of all tax money went to Budapest and Hungary had authority over the sea port of Rijeka (something that was reportedly not part of the Settlement actually agreed upon). In exchange, the Kingdom of Croatia received autonomy in administrative, educational, and judicial affairs. In 1883 the country was threatened by Magyarization under ban Khuen-Héderváry whose two decades of rule were marked by political and public demonstrations, and ended in 1903 with violent rioting. During his time as ban, the Hungarian language came into official use and Hungarian symbols were brought alongside the national symbols of the Croats. Khuen was forced to deal with many protests, including one during the 1895 visit of King Franz Joseph: at the opening of the Croatian National Theatre which the King was attending, a group of students burned the Hungarian flag. After a series of riots broke out against him in 1903, Khuen was relieved of his duty and appointed prime minister of Hungary. During the Weltkrieg, Croatian territory was not the site of any major battles, but the Croatian soldiers did participate in the gruesome winter battles of the Eastern Front with losses numbered in tens of thousands. Struggle towards more independence within the Dual Monarchy was interrupted by the Weltkrieg and the renegotiations of the Ausgleich in 1927 didn't bring any change to the status of Croatia. However, the growing power and nationalism of Hungary is perceived as a threat by the Croats who are afraid that in the Ausgleich of 1937 they will be forced to make some concessions or even face an open Magyarization of their lands.

In 1920s, former journalist Jack Reed, who turned into a savvy political operator during his time in Russia during its revolution and civil war, advocated the creation of a coalition of all the separated trade unions, as they would be stronger if united in one entity. The Industrial Workers of the World accepted the challenge and became the bulk around which the Combined Syndicates of America were born. Uniting various shades of socialist, syndicalist and communist opinion, the CSA have mobilised the surging throngs of workers in America's industrial heartlands. Following the events of the Presidential Election of 1936, the CSA decided to rise against the oppressive capitalism. Their goal is to bring a radical transformation of society through revolutionary syndicalism.

After the proclamation of the Chinese Republic by Sun Yat-Sen in 1911 and the separation of numerous provinces throughout China, the Qing dynasty, installed in 1644 by the Manchu clan Aisin-Goro was removed a year later by the Imperial Edict of Empress Dowager Longyu bringing the abdication of the Child Emperor, Pu Yi, then six years old he stayed as the former Emperor of China, installed in the Forbidden City at the expense of the Chinese Republic, before being expelled by one of the numerous warlords who shattered China during this era. The Chinese Republic stood despite anarchy and some anecdotal events as short-lived Empire of general Yuan Shikai (1916) and a twelve days-long recrowning of Pu Yi by warlord Zhang Xun (1917). In the 20’s, German Chancellor von Tirpitz, fearing that a Chinese Civil War would bring instability in Asia, decided of an intervention in China. In a few months, German colonial armies controlled Eastern China and divided the country in two zones : the south under administration of German companies, the north under a restored Qing Empire ruled by collaborationist native politicians. Former emperor Pu Yi was reinstalled as Gongde Emperor. The Qing Empire is now a shadow of its former self: it lost its dignity as an independent country, its economy is in the hands of the German trusts, and even its legitimacy is disputed, challenged by Shangqing and their puritan revolters…
French: he stayed as the former Emperor of China, installed in the Forbidden City at the expense of the Chinese Republic, before being expelled by one of the numerous warlords who shattered China during this era. The Chinese Republic stood despite anarchy and some anecdotal events as short-lived Empire of general Yuan Shikai (1916) and a twelve days-long recrowning of Pu Yi by warlord Zhang Xun (1917). In the 20’s, German Chancellor von Tirpitz, fearing that a Chinese Civil War would bring instability in Asia, decided of an intervention in China. In a few months, German colonial armies controlled Eastern China and divided the country in two zones : the south under administration of German companies, the north under a restored Qing Empire ruled by collaborationist native politicians. As former emperor Pu Yi, since his exile in Tientsin, was dealing with the Japaneses, Germans prefered his father, Zaifeng, the Prince Chun, who was installed as Gongde Emperor. The Qing Empire is now a shadow of its former self: it lost its dignity as an independent country, its economy is in the hands of the German trusts, and even its legitimacy is disputed, challenged by Zhang Guotao and his puritan revolters…

English: The three Chinese northwestern provinces of Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia were all ruled by the Ma family clan, who commanded well-trained cavalry armies. The three most prominent warlords were Ma Bufang, Ma Hongkui, and Ma Hongbin, collectively known as the Xibei San Ma (lit. Three Mas of the Northwest). The Three Mas took control of the region during the Warlord Era. The Ma's were all ethnic Hui from Northwestern China, distinguished by their adherence to Islam. When the Muslims in Xinjiang rebelled in 1931, the Ma clique invaded in support of the rebellion, successfully annexing that region to the territories under their rule. However, lately there is an increasing unrest among the mongol minority and many fear the expansionist policies of Sternberg, the Mad Baron of Mongolia.

The Yunnan Clique was established in the Yunnan province of south-west China during the Warlord Era. Cai E is regarded as the founder of the clique when at the request of Liang Qichao in 1915, he declared Yunnan's opposition to Yuan Shikai's monarchy, the so-called Empire of China. Cai died in November 1916 from natural causes, shortly after defeating Yuan Shikai in the successful National Protection War. After his death his chief lieutenant, Tang Jiyao, took over Yunnan, unifying it under it rule. The 1926 German intervention didn't change the autonomy status of Yunnan. In 1927 Long Yun replaced Tang Jiyao as governor and warlord of Yunnan. In the past ten years Long strengthened his rule over the other warlords and recently he started looking with eagerly eyes towards the AlgOstAsien in the east.

The explosion of the U.S. warship Maine in the port of Havana in 1898 gave the U.S.A. the opportunity to declare war on Spain, colonial masters of the Carribean island. In the Peace of Paris 1898 Spain had to cede Cuba, along with the Philippines and Puerto Rico to the United States who in turn put the island under military administration. Formally, independence was declared in 1900, but the Platt-Amendment of 1901 restricted the autonomy again, giving the U.S. the naval bases of Bahia Honda and Guantanamo in addition to the right to intervene in the case of internal unrest. In 1902 the United States withdrew from the island, leaving the government of the first Cuban president, Tomás Estrada Palma in charge. However, already in 1906 - 1909 the U.S. intervened on the grounds of the Platt-Amendment when the liberals campaigned against President Estrada Palma. Further interventions took place in 1912 and between 1917 and 1919. In 1922 the last American soldiers left the island. U.S. investment, especially in sugarcane plantations, brought Cuba a quick economic rise. Nevertheless, the country came into economic dependency of the U.S. and her imports of tobacco and sugar. The agricultural mono-culture was prone to crisis which led to economic disaster during the 1920s, impoverishing large parts of the population. Dictatorial measures taken by President Gerardo Machaldo y Porales (1925 - 1933) were uneffective. With civil unrest and economic hardship rising in the United States, the future of Cuba looks bleak.
French: En 1898,l’explosion du navire de guerre américain Maine dans le port de la Havane permet aux Etats-Unis de déclarer impunément la guerre à l’Espagne, le plus grand colonisateur des Caraïbes. Le traité de Paris, signé en 1898, condamne l’Espagne à céder aux Etats-Unis Cuba, les Philippines et Puerto Rico. Les Américains mettent alors l’île de Cuba sous surveillance militaire. Elle est officiellement déclarée indépendante en 1900, mais l’amendement Platt de 1901 revient encore sur son autonomie en permettant aux bases navales de Bahia Honda et Guantanamo d’intervenir en cas de troubles intérieurs. En 1902, les Etats-Unis se retirent de Cuba et laissent le pouvoir au premier président cubain, Tomás Estrada Palma. Mais une première intervention américaine, fondée sur l’amendement Platt, a lieu entre 1906 et 1909 lorsque le parti libéral mène campagne contre le président Estrada Palma. Les Américains interviennent de nouveau en 1912, puis entre 1917 et 1919. Le dernier soldat américain quitte finalement l’île en 1922. L’investissement américain, particulièrement dans les plantations de sucre, participe à la croissance économique de Cuba. Mais le pays devient rapidement dépendant des échanges commerciaux avec les Etats-Unis notamment en ce qui concerne le sucre et le tabac. La monoculture agricole conduit à une crise puis à un véritable désastre économique pendant la Grande Dépression de 1929-1930. Une grande partie de la population s’appauvrit alors de manière considérable. Le régime dictatorial instauré par le président Gerardo Machado y Porales (1925-1933) est renversé par un coup d’Etat. L’ancien sergent et secrétaire personnel de Machado, Fulgencio Batista y Zaldivar est l’instigateur de cette révolution facilitée par son rang de chef suprême de l’armée. Il nomme Carlos Mendieta Montefur au poste de président et se débarrasse définitivement de l’amendement Platt en 1934. Batista contrôle les actions du gouvernement grâce à l’armée, et devient finalement président d’un régime dictatorial en 1940.
Italian: L'esplosione della corazzata americana Maine, nel porto dell'Avana nel 1898, diede agli Stati Uniti la possibilità di dichiarare guerra alla Spagna, la potenza coloniale dell'isola caraibica. Nella pace di Parigi del 1898, la Spagna dovette cedere Cuba, insieme alle Filippine e Portorico agli Stati Uniti, i quali in cambio misero l'isola sotto un'amministrazione militare. Formalmente, l'indipendenza fu proclamata nel 1900, ma l'emendamento Platt del 1901, limitava nuovamente l'autonomia di Cuba, dando agli Stati Uniti le basi navali di Bahia Honda e Guantanamo, oltre al diritto di intervenire in caso di agitazioni interne. Nel 1902 gli Stati Uniti si ritirarono dall'isola, lasciando in carica il governo del primo presidente cubano, Tomás Estrada Palma. Tuttavia, già nel 1906-1909, gli Stati Uniti intervennero in base all'emendamento Platt, contro la ribellione dei liberali verso il presidente Estrada Palma. Ulteriori interventi ebbero luogo nel 1912 e fra il 1917 e il 1919. Nel 1922, gli ultimi soldati americani lasciarono l'isola. Gli investimenti statunitensi, specialmente nelle piantagioni di canna da zucchero, portarono Cuba a una veloce crescita economica. Ciononostante, il paese divenne economicamente indipendente dagli Stati Uniti e dalle sue importazioni di tabacco e zucchero. L'agricoltura a singola coltura fece da preludio alla crisi che portò al disastro economico durante la grande depressione del 1929/30, impoverendo gran parte della popolazione. Le misure dittatoriali prese dal presidente Gerardo Machaldo y Porales (1925-1933), ebbero come risposta un colpo militare. L'ex sergente e segretario privato di Machado, Fulgencio Batista y Zaldivar, conservò l'autorità in qualità di leader di quella rivoluzione e supremo comandante dell'esercito. Egli spinse per l'elezione a presidente di Carlos Mendieta Montefur e raggiunse l'abolizione dell'emendamento Platt nel 1934. Attraverso l'esercito, Batista controllava il governo e nel 1940 fu eletto presidente, instaurando in seguito un regime dittatoriale.
Spanish: La explosión del navío de guerra estadounidense Maine en el puerto de La Habana en 1898 proporcionó a los Estados Unidos la oportunidad de declarar la guerra a España, señores coloniales de la isla caribeña. En la Paz de París de 1898, España tuvo que ceder Cuba, las Filipinas y Puerto Rico a los Estados Unidos, que pusieron la isla bajo administración militar. La independencia formal fue declarada en 1900, pero la Enmienda Platt de 1901 volvía a restringir la autonomía, entregando a los Estados Unidos las bases navales de Bahía Honda y Guantánamo, además del derecho de intervención en caso de disturbios internos. En 1902, los Estados Unidos se retiraron de la isla, dejando el gobierno en manos del primer presidente cubano, Tomás Estrada Palma. Sin embargo, ya en 1906-1909, los EE.UU.. intervinieron en razón de la Enmienda Platt cuando los liberales hicieron campaña contra el presidente Estrada Palma. Otras intervenciones tuvieron lugar en 1912 y entre 1917 y 1919. En 1922, los últimos soldados americanos abandonaron la isla. Las inversiones estadounidenses, especialmente en caña de azúcar, llevaron a una mejora de la economía cubana. Sin embargo, el país pasó a depender económicamente de los EE.UU.. y sus importaciones de tabaco y azúcar. El monocultivo era susceptible a las crisis, que condujeron al desastre económico durante la Gran Depresión de 1929-30, llevando a la pobreza a la mayor parte de la población. Las medidas dictatoriales adoptadas por el presidente Gerardo Machaldo y Porales (1925-1933) fueron respondidas con un golpe militar. Fulgencio Batista y Zaldívar, antiguo sargento y secretario privado de Machado, cogió las riendas en su posición de líder de esa revolución y comandante supremo del ejército. Forzó el nombramiento de Carlos Mendieta Montefur como presidente y en 1934 consiguió el levantamiento de la Enmienda Platt. Gracias al ejército, Batista controlaba el gobierno, convirtiéndose en presidente en 1940 e instaurando un régimen dictatorial.
German: Die Explosion des amerikanischen Kriegsschiffes 'Maine' 1898 im Hafen von Havanna gab den USA die Gelegenheit, Spanien, dem Kolonialherren der Karibikinsel, den Krieg zu erklären. Ebenfalls 1898 musste Spanien im Frieden von Paris Kuba zusammen mit den Philippinen und Puerto Rico an die USA abtreten, welche wiederum die Insel unter Militärverwaltung stellten. Die Unabhängigkeit wurde formell 1900 erklärt, jedoch wurde die Autonomie durch das Platt-Amendment von 1901 erneut eingeschränkt, da es USA das Recht gab, Marinestützpunkte in Bahia Honda und Guantanamo zu unterhalten und im Falle interner Unruhen zu intervenieren. 1902 zogen sich die USA von der Insel zurück und überließen sie der Regierung des ersten kubanischen Präsidenten, Tomás Estrada Palma. Aber schon 1906 - 1909 intervenierten die USA gemäß dem Platt-Amendment, als die Liberalen gegen Präsident Estrada Palma Wahlkampf führten. Weitere Interventionen ereigneten sich 1912 und zwischen 1917 und 1919. Im Jahr 1922 verließen die letzten amerikanischen Soldaten die Insel. Amerikanische Investitionen, besonders in Zuckerrohrplantagen, brachten Kuba schnellen wirtschaftlichen Aufschwung. Trotzdem geriet das Land in wirtschaftliche Abhängigkeit von den USA und ihren Tabak- und Zuckerimporten. Die landwirtschaftliche Monokultur war krisengefährdet, was während der Großen Depression 1929/30 zu wirtschaftlichen Katastrophen führte, die große Teile der Bevölkerung in die Armut stürzte. Diktatorische Maßnahmen von Präsident Gerardo Machaldo y Porales (1925 - 1933) wurden mit einem Militärputsch beantwortet. Der frühere Sergeant und Privatsekretär Machados, Fulgencio Batista y Zaldivar, hielt in seiner Position als Anführer dieser Revolution und als Oberkommandeur der Armee die Zügel in der Hand. Er erzwang die Einsetzung von Carlos Mendieta Montefur als Präsident und erreichte 1934 die Aufhebung des Platt-Amendments. Über die Armee kontrollierte Batista die Regierung, wurde 1940 Präsident und richtete ein diktatorisches Regime ein.

English: Bohemia became part of Austrian Empire in 1526. At the end of the eighteenth century, the Czech national revivalist movement, in cooperation with part of the Bohemian aristocracy, started a campaign for restoration of the kingdom's historic rights, whereby the Czech language was to replace German as the language of administration. During the Revolution of 1848, many Czech nationalists called for autonomy for Bohemia from Habsburg Austria, but the revolutionaries were defeated. In 1861, a new elected Bohemian Diet was established. The renewal of the old Bohemian Crown became the official political program of both Czech liberal politicians and the majority of Bohemian aristocracy, while parties representing the German minority and small part of the aristocracy proclaimed their loyalty to the centralistic Constitution. After the creation of the Dual Monarchy in the Ausgleich of 1867, an attempt of the Czechs to create a tripartite monarchy (Austria-Hungary-Bohemia) failed in 1871. After the Weltkrieg Czech nationalism was on the rise and the tension between the ethnic Germans and the Czechs led to violent riots, almost bringing the Empire on the verge of a civil war. The German mediation in the renegotiations of the Ausgleich in 1927 lead to the concession of autonomy to Bohemia as a constituent part of Austria-Hungary, even if under the control of the Austrian Crown and not on the same level as Hungary. The future of Bohemia is uncertain as the Ausgleich of 1937 is approaching and Austria will probably try to assert its authority. However, nothing is certain and in case of a struggle of power between Austria and Hungary, Bohemia might be even able to extend its control over the lands of the Slovaks.
French: Pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, le philosophe tchèque Thomás Garrigue Masaryk (1850-1937) et son proche confident Edvard Beneš (1884-1948) travaillent à l’élaboration d’un Etat indépendant. Ils signent au mois de mai 1918 le traité de Pittsburgh avec les représentants des immigrants slovaques aux Etats-Unis, convenant ainsi de la création d’un Etat tchécoslovaque. La République indépendante de Tchécoslovaquie est proclamée à Prague en 1918, après la défaite militaire de l’Autriche-Hongrie et de l’Allemagne. Masaryk est élu président (1918-1935) du tout jeune Etat. La Tchécoslovaquie présente néanmoins deux grands défauts. D’une part, la cohabitation entre Tchèques et Slovaques se révèle difficile bien que les deux populations aient déjà vécu ensemble sous le gouvernement hongrois. La région slovaque se focalise de manière quasi exclusive sur l’agriculture et ses citoyens se sentent délaissés par rapport à leurs compatriotes tchèques. D’autre part, plus de trois millions d’Allemands (Sudetendeutsche) vivent dans le pays et acceptent difficilement de se soumettre au pouvoir tchèque. En outre, le gouvernement de Prague manque cruellement de tact et de volonté politique en ce qui concerne la prise en charge des minorités. Malgré ces difficultés, un système parlementaire intégrant un large éventail de partis politiques se forme à partir de 1920. Dès 1926, les minorités les plus importantes (Allemands et Hongrois) sont représentées au gouvernement. Cependant, les régions exportatrices allemandes des Sudètes sont touchées de plein fouet par la Grande Dépression en 1929-1930, ce qui va encore augmenter les tensions au sein du pays. Après l’élection de Hitler en 1933, le parti sudète allemand (SdP) devient un instrument aux mains des Nazis, et ce n’est qu’une question de temps avant que Hitler ne réclame le droit d’occuper la Tchécoslovaquie.
Italian: Dopo lo scoppio della Prima Guerra Mondiale, il filosofo ceco Thomás Garrigue Masaryk (1850-1937) e il suo caro amico Eduard Benes (1884-1948), si misero al lavoro per costituire uno stato indipendente. Con i rappresentanti degli immigrati slovacchi negli Stati Uniti, firmarono il trattato di Pittsburgh (maggio 1918), aderendo all'unione fra cechi e slovacchi in un nuovo stato da fondare. Nel 1918, appena prima della sconfitta militare austro-ungarica e della Germania, a Praga fu proclamata l'indipendenza della Cecoslovacchia, con Masaryk eletto primo presidente (1918-1935). Tuttavia, il giovane paese, soffriva di due problemi. Il primo era costituito dai difficili rapporti fra cechi e slovacchi che hanno vissuto per secoli sotto il governo ungherese. La parte slovacca del paese rimase orientata principalmente verso l'agricoltura e i suoi cittadini si sentivano svantaggiati rispetto a quelli cechi. L'altro problema era la presenza di oltre tre milioni di tedeschi (Sudetendeutsche) nella nuova repubblica, i quali riconobbero a fatica il ruolo dominante della parte ceca. Anche il governo di Praga da parte sua, nonostante proclamasse altri intenti, mancò di tatto e volontà di integrare la minoranza del paese nelle sue politiche. Malgrado queste difficoltà, dopo il 1920 venne formato un sistema parlamentare funzionante con un'ampia gamma di schieramenti politici. Dal 1926, i membri delle minoranze principali (tedeschi, ungheresi), avevano i loro rappresentanti nel governo. La grande depressione del 1929/30 colpì duramente le aree con le minoranze (specie quella con i tedeschi sudeti), da sempre orientate principalmente verso il commercio estero, e le conseguenze furono ulteriori tensioni nazionali. Dopo l'ascesa al potere di Hitler in Germania (1933), il partito sudeto tedesco (SdP), divenne sempre più uno strumento dell'espansionismo nazista e non passò molto tempo prima che Hitler rivolgesse la propria attenzione contro la giovane repubblica cecoslovacca per reclamarne i territori.
Spanish: Tras el comienzo de la Primera Guerra Mundial, el filósofo checo Tomás Garrigue Masaryk (1850-1937) y su íntimo confidente Edvard Benes (1885-1948) trabajaron en pro de un estado independiente. En mayo de 1919, firmaron el Tratado de Pittsburgh con representantes de los emigrantes eslovacos en los Estados Unidos, acordando la unión de checos y eslovacos en un estado a fundar. La independencia de Checoslovaquia fue proclamada en Praga en 1918, poco antes de la derrota militar de Austria-Hungría y Alemania. Masaryk fue elegido primer presidente (1918-1935). Sin embargo, el joven estado tenía dos puntos flacos: uno era que la relación entre checos y eslovacos, que habían vivido durante siglos bajo el yugo austríaco, resultó complicada. La parte eslovaca del país era de naturaleza principalmente agraria y sus ciudadanos se sentían en desventaja frente a sus compatriotas checos. Otra era que había tres millones de alemanes (en los Sudetes), viviendo en la nueva república, y que aceptaban con gran reticencia el poder estatal dominado por los checos. Sin embargo, al gobierno de Praga, pese a declarar otras intenciones, le faltaba tacto y voluntad de integración en su política hacia la minoría. Pese a todas esas dificultades, después de 1920 se formó un sistema parlamentario efectivo con una gran variedad de partidos políticos. Desde 1926, los miembros de las minorías más importantes (alemanes, húngaros) tenían representantes en el gobierno. Sin embargo, orientadas como estaban hacia la exportación las zonas en las que habitaban los alemanes de los Sudetes, éstas fueron las zonas más afectadas por la Gran Depresión de 1929-30, lo que trajo como consecuencia más tensiones nacionales. Tras la llegada al poder de Hitler en Alemania en 1933, el partido de los Sudetes alemanes SdP se convirtió más y más en un instrumento del expansionismo nazi y no sería más que una cuestión de tiempo que Adolf Hitler se enfrentase a la joven República de Checoslovaquia con reivindicaciones territoriales.
German: Nach dem Ausbruch des Ersten Weltkriegs arbeiteten der tschechische Philosoph Thomás Garrigue Masaryk (1850 - 1937) und sein enger Vertrauter Eduard Benes (1884 - 1948) für einen unabhängigen Staat. Mit Repräsentanten slowakischer Einwanderer in den USA unterzeichneten sie im Mai 1918 den Vertrag von Pittsburgh, worin sie der Vereinigung von Tschechen und Slowaken in einem neu zu gründenden Staat zustimmten. 1918, kurz bevor der militärischen Niederlage Österreich-Ungarns und Deutschlands, wurde die unabhängige Tschechoslowakei in Prag ausgerufen. Masaryk wurde zum ersten Präsidenten gewählt (1918 - 1935). Aber das junge Land wies zwei Mängel auf: Einerseits erwies sich die Beziehung zwischen Tschechen und Slowaken, die jahrhundertelang unter ungarischer Herrschaft gelebt hatten, als schwierig. Der slowakische Teil des Landes war hauptsächlich agrarorientiert und seine Bürger fühlten sich im Nachteil gegenüber ihren tschechischen Landsleuten. Andererseits lebten in der neuen Republik über drei Millionen Sudetendeutsche, welche die von den Tschechen kontrollierte Staatsmacht nur widerwillig anerkannten. Die Regierung in Prag aber bewies trotz anderweitiger Beteuerungen in ihrer Minderheitenpolitik mangelnden Takt und Integrationswillen. Trotz dieser Schwierigkeiten formte sich nach 1920 ein funktionierendes Parlamentssystem mit einer breiten Palette politischer Parteien. Seit 1926 saßen Mitglieder der wichtigsten Minderheiten (Deutsche, Ungarn) als Repräsentanten in der Regierung. Exportorientierte Gebiete wie die der Sudetendeutschen litten unter der großen Depression von 1929/30 jedoch am härtesten, wodurch es zu weiteren nationalen Spannungen kam. Nach Hillers Aufstieg zur Macht in Deutschland im Jahre 1933 wurde die Sudetendeutsche Partei (SdP) zunehmend zu einem Instrument der expansionistischen Nazis - und es war nur eine Frage der Zeit, bis Adolf Hiller der jungen tschechoslowakischen Republik Gebietsforderungen stellen würde.

English: The Danish defeat in the 2nd German-Danish War of 1864 after which Denmark had to cede Schleswig-Holstein and Oldenburg to Prussia and Austria led to the country's withdrawal into neutrality and to a pressure for reforms within. Already since 1849 Denmark had been a constitutional monarchy. Liberals and Social Democrats begun strengthening the parliament starting 1901. Economically, Denmark focused on expanding its agriculture which became the most important part of their exports. During the Weltkrieg the country remained neutral and continued the democratization process, introducing a democratic constitution in 1915.The primarily Social Democratic governments after the Weltkrieg layed the foundations for a welfare state that was patterned after the example of Sweden and up till today secures the population one of the highest standards of living in the world. However, with the revolutions in France and Britain and growing German dominance on the world markets, Denmark's economy was bound more and more to it's larger neighbour to the south. With Germany' economy nearing a crisis, and social unrest within it's borders growing, which path will Denmark choose to follow?
French: La défaite danoise à l’issue de la seconde guerre germano-danoise en 1864 contraint le pays à céder le Schleswig-Holstein et l’Oldenbourg à la Prusse et à l’Autriche. Le Danemark choisit donc de rester neutre face aux conflits européens et entreprend une série de réformes internes. Le Danemark est une monarchie constitutionnelle depuis 1849. Les sociaux-démocrates et les libéraux commencent à renforcer le pouvoir parlementaire dès 1901. Sur un plan économique, le Danemark décide de développer davantage son agriculture qui constitue rapidement sa plus grande source d’exportation. Pendant la Première Guerre mondiale (1914-1918), le pays reste neutre et poursuit le processus de démocratisation qui se solde par l’adoption d’une constitution démocratique en 1915. La période de la Grande Guerre pose les premières pierres d’un Etat-providence inspiré du modèle suédois. Aujourd’hui encore, la population danoise peut se satisfaire de l’un des meilleurs niveaux de vie du monde. La politique étrangère du Danemark remporte de nombreux succès. En 1920, le Schleswig septentrional est réintégré au pays à l’issue d’un référendum sur le modèle du traité de Versailles. En 1933, le tribunal international de La Haye met fin au conflit dano-norvégien en attribuant le Groenland aux Danois. Mais les Allemands n’abandonnent toujours pas l’idée d’envahir le Danemark, territoire stratégique pour contrôler l’accès à la mer Baltique et le commerce de minerais scandinaves.
Italian: La sconfitta danese nel secondo conflitto con i tedeschi (1864), che portò alla cessione dei territori Schleswig-Holstein e Oldenburg alla Prussia e all'Austria, fece assumere al paese un atteggiamento neutrale e provocò forti pressioni per le riforme interne. Già dal 1849, la Danimarca era una monarchia costituzionale. I liberali e i socialdemocratici iniziarono a rafforzare il parlamento a partire dal 1901. Economicamente, la Danimarca pensò a espandere la propria agricoltura che divenne il settore più importante alla voce esportazioni. Durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale (1914-1918), il paese rimase neutrale e continuò il processo di democratizzazione, introducendo una costituzione democratica nel 1915. Dopo la Grande Guerra, sono soprattutto i governi socialdemocratici a gettare le basi per uno stato di benessere sul modello di quello svedese che fino a oggi ha garantito alla propria popolazione uno dei più alti standard di vita al mondo. La politica estera danese fece registrare diversi successi. Nel 1920, lo Slesvig settentrionale venne riannesso al paese in seguito a un referendum sancito dal trattato di pace di Versailles. Nel 1933, la corte internazionale di Den Haag, si pronunciò a favore dei danesi circa la disputa con la Norvegia per il possesso della Groenlandia. Tuttavia, i tedeschi tenevano attentamente d'occhio il paese data la sua importanza strategica, per controllare l'accesso al mar Baltico e il trasporto di minerali dalla Scandinavia.
Spanish: La derrota danesa en la Segunda Guerra Germano-danesa de 1864, tras la cual Dinamarca se vio obligada a ceder Schleswig-Holstein y Oldenburgo a Prusia y Austria, llevó al país a refugiarse en la neutralidad y a una presión para llevar a cabo reformas internas. Ya desde 1849, Dinamarca ha sido una monarquía constitucional. Desde 1901, los liberales y los socialdemócratas comenzaron a consolidar el Parlamento. En el plano económico, Dinamarca se concentró en la expansión de su agricultura, que se convirtió en la parte más importante de sus exportaciones. Durante la Primera Guerra Mundial (1914-1918), el país se mantuvo neutral y continuó con el proceso de democratización, introduciendo una constitución democrática en 1915. Los gobiernos desde la Gran Guerra, en su mayoría socialdemócratas, establecieron los cimientos de un estado de bienestar siguiendo el ejemplo de Suecia y que, aún hoy, proporciona a la población uno de los niveles de vida más elevados del mundo. La política exterior danesa se apuntó varios éxitos. En 1920, Schleswig septentrional se reintegró al país tras un referéndum ordenado por el Tratado de Paz de Versalles. En 1933, el Tribunal Internacional de La Haya decidió a favor de los daneses un litigio entre Noruega y Dinamarca por la propiedad de Groenlandia. Sin embargo, los alemanes tenían la vista puesta en el país a causa de su importancia estratégica, tanto a la hora de controlar la entrada al Mar Báltico como para el transporte de minerales desde Escandinavia.
German: Die dänische Niederlage im zweiten Deutsch-Dänischen Krieg von 1864, nach dem Dänemark Schleswig-Holstein und Oldenburg an Preußen und Österreich abtreten musste, führte zu einem Rückzug des Landes in die Neutralität und verstärkte den Druck nach inneren Reformen. Dänemark war bereits seit 1849 eine institutionelle Monarchie gewesen, Liberale und Sozialdemokraten kamen ab 1901 zur Stärkung des Parlaments hinzu. Wirtschaftlich konzentrierte sich Dänemark auf die Ausweitung seiner Landwirtschaft, welche zum wichtigsten Bestandteil seiner Exportwirtschaft wurde. Während des ersten Weltkriegs (1914 - 1918) blieb das Land neutral. Der Demokratisierungsprozess wurde vorangetrieben und führte 1915 zur Verabschiedung einer demokratischen Verfassung. Die überwiegend sozialdemokratische Regierung legte nach dem Ersten Weltkrieg den Grundstein für einen Sozialstaat, der nach dem Beispiel Schwedens geschaffen wurde und der dänischen Bevölkerung bis heute einen der höchsten Lebensstandards weltweit sichert. Die Außenpolitik Dänemarks konnte mehrere Erfolge verbuchen: 1920 wurde das nördliche Schleswig wieder Dänemark angeschlossen, nachdem gemäß dem Friedensvertrag von Versailles ein Volksbegehren durchgeführt worden war. 1933 entschied der internationale Gerichtshof in Den Haag in einem Streitfall zwischen Norwegen und Dänemark über die Eigentumsrechte für Grönland zugunsten der Dänen. Dänemark wurde von den Deutschen jedoch mit Argusaugen beobachtet, da es für die Kontrolle der Ostsee und die Erzverschiffung von Skandinavien von strategischer Bedeutung war.

English: In 1844 the Eastern part of the island of Hispaniola, since 1822 a part of the young country Haiti, declared its independence as Dominican Republic. Instability and foreign threats marked the early years of the new state. Restorative tendencies found the support of the oligarchy who, in the face of a border dispute with Haiti, put the country back under Spanish colonial rule in 1861 until revolts forced independence again in 1865. Economically and politcally the Dominican Republic became more and more dependant on the U.S.A. who first openly intervened in 1905 to collect debts. Between 1916 and 1924 they occupied the country in order to get control over the financial and military institutions, beginning a democratization of the state. The miltary coup of General Rafael Léonidas Trujillo y Molina in 1930 abolished the 1924 constitution again. He went a forceful way to modernize and centralize the country, not looking at the social havoc this caused.
French: La partie Est de l’île d’Hispaniola, attachée au jeune Etat haïtien depuis 1822, déclare en 1844 son indépendance et prend le nom de République Dominicaine. Ses premières années d’existence sont marquées par l’instabilité et les menaces extérieures. Les conflits frontaliers avec Haïti ouvrent la voie aux mouvements de réunification soutenus par l’oligarchie qui décide de soumettre de nouveau le pays au gouvernement colonial espagnol en 1861. En 1865, de nombreuses révoltes permettent finalement au pays de retrouver son indépendance. Les systèmes politiques et économiques de la République Dominicaine deviennent progressivement dépendants de la puissance américaine qui intervient ouvertement, en 1905, pour obtenir le remboursement des dettes contractées par la jeune République. Entre 1916 et 1924, les Etats-Unis occupent le pays pour prendre le contrôle des institutions financières et militaires du pays. Ils entreprennent également la démocratisation de la République. En 1930, le coup d’Etat militaire du général Rafael Léonidas Trujillo y Molina abolit encore la constitution de 1924. Il se lance dans un projet musclé de modernisation et de centralisation du pays sans se soucier des ravages sociaux qu’une telle politique peut causer.
Italian: Nel 1844, la parte orientale dell'isola di Hispaniola, facente parte dal 1822 del giovane paese di Haiti, dichiarò la propria indipendenza come Repubblica Dominicana. L'instabilità e le minacce provenienti dall'estero, caratterizzarono i primi anni di questo nuovo stato. Le tendenze restauratrici trovarono il supporto dell'oligarchia che, di fronte alla disputa sui confini con Haiti, mise il paese nuovamente sotto il ruolo di colonia spagnola (1861), fino a quando le rivolte non forzarono nuovamente l'indipendenza (1865). Dal punto di vista economico e politico, la Repubblica Dominicana divenne sempre più dipendente dagli Stati Uniti, i quali intervennero apertamente per primi nel 1905 per raccogliere i debiti. Fra il 1916 e il 1924, gli americani occuparono il paese per prendere il controllo delle istituzioni militari e finanziarie, dando inizio a una democratizzazione dello stato. Il colpo di stato militare del generale Rafael Léonidas Trujillo y Molina (1930), abolì nuovamente la costituzione del 1924. Egli perseguì la strada della forza per modernizzare e centralizzare il paese, senza curarsi del disastro sociale che tutto ciò avrebbe causato.
Spanish: En 1844, la parte oriental de la Isla de la Española, que desde 1822 formaba parte del joven país de Haití, declaró su independencia con el nombre de República Dominicana. Los primeros años del nuevo estado se vieron marcados por la inestabilidad y la amenaza extranjera. Las tendencias restauradoras obtuvieron el apoyo de la oligarquía, que, enfrentada a la posibilidad de una disputa fronteriza con Haití, devolvió el país al poder colonial español, hasta que unas revueltas forzaron de nuevo su independencia en 1865. La República Dominicana pasó a depender de manera creciente de los Estados Unidos, que intervinieron abiertamente por primera vez en 1905 para cobrar unas deudas. Éstos ocuparon el país entre 1916 y 1924 para controlar las instituciones financieras y militares, dando inicio a una democratización del estado. El golpe militar del general Rafael Leónidas Trujillo y Molina en 1930 abolió de nuevo la Constitución de 1924. Procedió a modernizar y centralizar el país sin miramientos y sin preocuparse del caos social que esto causaba.
German: 1844 erklärte der Ostteil der Insel Hispaniola, der seit 1822 ein Teil des jungen Landes Haiti war, seine Unabhängigkeit als Dominikanische Republik. Instabile Zeiten und ausländische Bedrohung überschatteten die frühen Jahre des neuen Staats. Restaurative Tendenzen fanden die Unterstützung der Oligarchie, die, bedroht von einem Grenzdisput mit Haiti, 1861 das Land wieder unter spanische Kolonialherrschaft brachte, bis Revolten 1865 wieder die Unabhängigkeit erzwangen. Wirtschaftlich und politisch wurde die Dominikanische Republik zusehends abhängiger von den USA, die 1905 zum ersten Mal zur Eintreibung von Schulden offen intervenierte. Zwischen 1916 und 1924 besetzten sie das Land um die Kontrolle über die finanziellen und militärischen Institutionen an sich zu reissen, was die Demokratisierung des Landes ins Rollen brachte. Der Militärputsch General Rafael Léonidas Trujillo y Molinas im Jahre 1930 löste die Verfassung von 1924 wieder auf. Er erzwang die Modernisierung und Zentralisierung des Landes, allerdings ungeachtet der dadurch entstehenden sozialen Missstände.
