English: The 1921 peace treaty between Britain and Germany left Britain still in control of its colonies, but the general strike and resulting revolution in Britain four years later meant that the colonies of the British Empire were effectively cut adrift. Some, particularly in the Pacific, were occupied by Germany, but others managed to survive as independent entities. In the interests of security and restoring the Empire the British Caribbean and South American colonies continued to recognise the sovereignty of the British Monarch in Canada, but chose to form a Confederation (incorporating former French Guiana, which Britain had occupied after the French government collapsed) in order to maintain independence.Throughout the 20’s and early 30’s the Caribbean Federation struggled to carve out a niche for itself. Trade links were set up with the USA, Brazil, Canada and Nationalist France, but a lack of any real industrial base in the region has limited their growth. Now in 1936 they remain a minor ally of Canada and look certain to side with them in any coming clashes with the western European Syndicalist states.

The nation of Haiti takes its name from the word used by the local Arawak Indians for the island of Hispanola, which they called 'Hayti', or mountainous land. Owned by the French since the 17th century, Haiti became a particularly rich colony noted for its particularly large proportion of slaves to free Frenchmen. In 1791 Haitians launched a successful slave revolt, and by 1804 were the first independent black nation in the New World. Though there quickly arose a class system with a minority of light-skinned, Catholic, French-speaking Haitians ruling over a dark-skinned, voodoo worshipping, Creole-speaking majority, Haiti soon devolved into chaos after its independence. Haiti's first ruler, the 'Emperor' General Dessalines, was assassinated following his rampant abuse of power. In 1844 Haiti split in two, with the Dominican Republic declaring independence from Haiti. Continuing unrest led to the United States sending in the Marines in 1915, who would occupy the country (and give still more power to the lighter skinned Haitians) until their departure in 1934. Upon the Marine's departure there were many more hospitals and schools but the country still dangerously disunited. A vicious power struggle would soon ensue between Catholic Haitians and those Haitians who follow voodoo. Currently the Catholic mulattos have the upper hand, with a mulatto President, Stenio Vincent, who has ruled since the United States' occupation.
French: Le mot Haïti vient du nom qu’utilisaient les indiens Arawak pour désigner l’île d’Hispanola soit “Hayti” ou l’île montagneuse. Le territoire occupé par les Français depuis le 17e siècle devient une colonie très riche et particulièrement renommée pour le nombre d’esclaves qu’elle mettait à disposition des hommes libres (français). En 1791, les esclaves haïtiens organisent une révolte qui fera d’eux la première nation noire du Nouveau Monde. Cette réussite n’empêche pas l’apparition d’un système de classes au sein duquel une minorité blanche, catholique et francophone règne sur la majorité noire, vaudoue et créolophone. Après son indépendance, le pays ne tarde pas à sombrer dans le chaos. Le premier dirigeant haïtien, le général “empereur” Dessalines est assassiné suite à son incroyable abus de pouvoir. En 1844, la République Dominicaine se déclare indépendante d’Haïti. Le pays est alors divisé en deux. L’agitation qui afflige l’île pousse les Etats-Unis à intervenir en envoyant dès 1915 des troupes navales qui occuperont le pays jusqu’en 1934.Cette invasion contribue en outre à renforcer le pouvoir des Haïtiens blancs. La présence des militaires américains aura au moins servi à augmenter le nombre d’hôpitaux et d’écoles dans ce pays toujours terriblement désuni. Une lutte pour le pouvoir éclate rapidement entre Haïtiens catholiques et Haïtiens qui pratiquent le vaudou. A l’heure actuelle, les mulâtres catholiques ont l’avantage puisque le président Stenio Vincent en place depuis le départ des Américains est l'un des leurs.
Italian: La nazione di Haiti prese il nome dalla parola usata dagli indiani Arawak locali per definire l'isola di Hispanola, da loro chiamata Haiti o terra montuosa. Appartenuta ai francesi sin dal diciassettesimo secolo, Haiti divenne una colonia particolarmente ricca, famosa per le sua ampia proporzione di schiavi per ogni uomo libero francese. Nel 1791, gli haitiani lanciarono con successo una rivolta degli schiavi, e nel 1804 l'isola divenne la prima nazione nera indipendente del Nuovo Mondo. Tuttavia, la classe politica che salì in fretta al potere era composta da una minoranza di bianchi, cattolici e haitiani di lingua francese che iniziò a governare sui neri, gli adoratori voodoo e la maggioranza di lingua creola. Dopo aver ottenuto l'indipendenza, Haiti precipitò nel caos. Il primo governatore dell'isola, l'Imperatore generale Dessalines, fu assassinato in seguito al suo sfrenato abuso di potere. Nel 1844, con la proclamazione d'indipendenza da parte della Repubblica Dominicana, Haiti si divise in due parti. I continui tumulti portarono all'invio sull'isola dei marine da parte degli Stati Uniti (1915), i quali avrebbero occupato il paese (e dato ancora più potere ai bianchi haitiani) fino alla loro partenza (1934). Anche se il controllo da parte degli americani aveva portato alla costruzione di molti più ospedali e scuole, il paese era ancora pericolosamente diviso. Una feroce lotta di potere avrebbe presto coinvolto gli haitiani cattolici e i seguaci del voodoo. Attualmente, i mulatti cattolici hanno avuto la meglio, con un loro presidente, Stenio Vincent, che ha governato sin dai tempi dell'occupazione americana.
Spanish: La nación de Haití toma su nombre del que los nativos indios arawak daban a la isla de La Española, 'Hayti', o tierra montañosa. En poder de los franceses desde el siglo XVII, Haití se convirtió en una colonia particularmente próspera, notoria por su proporción de esclavos por cada francés libre, especialmente elevada. En 1791, los haitianos iniciaron una exitosa revuelta de esclavos y en 1804 se convirtieron en la primera nación negra independiente del nuevo mundo. Aunque pronto surgió un sistema de clases en el que una minoría de haitianos católicos francoparlantes de piel clara ostentaban el poder sobre una mayoría criolloparlante, de piel oscura y que rendía culto al vudú, Haití pronto degeneró en el caos tras su independencia. El primer gobernante de Haití, el 'Emperador' general Dessalines, fue asesinado después de que abusase incontroladamente de su poder. En 1844 se escindió en dos naciones, con la declaración de independencia de Haití por parte de la República Dominicana. Los disturbios continuados llevaron al envío de los marines en 1915 por parte de Estados Unidos, que ocuparían el país (y otorgarían aún más poderes a los haitianos de piel clara) hasta su salida en 1934. Cuando los marines se marcharon, había muchos más hospitales y escuelas, pero el país seguía peligrosamente desunido. Pronto tuvo lugar una violenta lucha por el poder entre los haitianos católicos y aquellos que seguían al vudú. Ahora mismo, los mulatos católicos ostentan la primacía, con un presidente mulato, Stenio Vincent, que ha gobernado desde la ocupación de los Estados Unidos.
German: Der Name “Haiti” leitet sich von der Bezeichnung “Hayti” (gebirgiges Land) der Arawak-Indianer für die Insel “Hispanola” ab. Nach der französischen Besetzung im 17. Jahrhundert entwickelte sich Haiti zu einer besonders reichen Kolonie und war vor allem wegen seiner großen Sklavenbevölkerung bekannt. 1791 erhoben sich die Haitianer zu einer erfolgreichen Sklavenrevolte und machten Haiti 1804 zu ersten unanhängigen schwarzen Nation. Obwohl sich rasch ein Klassensystem entwickelte, in dem ein Minderheit hellhäutiger, katholischer und französischsprachiger Haitianer über eine dunkelhäutige, dem Voodoo-Kult anhängige und kreolisch sprechende Mehrheit herrschte, versank Haiti schon bald nach seiner Unabhängigkeit im Chaos: Der erste Herrscher Haitis, “Kaiser” General Dessalines wurde aufgrund seines ruchlosen Machtmissbrauchs ermordet. 1844 wurde Haiti in zwei Teile gespalten, als die Dominikanische Republik ihre Unabhängigkeit von Haiti erklärte. Anhaltende Unruhen führten 1915 zum Einschreiten amerikanischer Marine-Infanteristen, die das Land bis zu ihrem Abzug 1934 besetzt hielten (und den hellhäutigen Haitianern zu noch mehr Macht verhalfen). Nach dem Weggang der Marines verfügte Haiti über viel mehr Krankenhäuser und Schulen als zuvor, war jedoch innenpolitisch weiterhin in gefährlichem Ausmaße zerrüttet. Kurze Zeit später brach ein fürchterlicher Machtkampf zwischen den haitianischen Katholiken und Voodoo-Anhängern aus. Momentan haben die katholischen Mulatten unter Präsident Stenio Vincent, der seit der Besetzung durch die USA Regierungschef ist, die Oberhand.

English: While preserving European neutrality (the struggle against Belgium was declared an internal conflict) the Netherlands faced all the fiercer challenges in their colonies. In 1830 an uprising in Java had to be subdued by force. A war against the Sultanate Ateh, joined by various local princes, erupted on Sumatra in 1873 and could only be ended in 1904. The Cape Province, Ceylon, and the Gold Coast had been lost to Great Britain. In domestic policies an agreement was reached between the crown and the growing liberal movement in 1848. Wilhelm II, under influence by Liberal leader Jan Rudolf Thorbecke, installed a liberl constitution which transformed the country into a parliamentary monarchy. Thorbecke became the first prime minister and fortified the - by the time's standards - modern system of government. Internally, the Netherlands stabilized herself permanently, with only the census based suffrage being a major point of conflict till universal and equal suffrage was introduced in 1917. Only in 1894 a Social Democratic Party formed which, unlike her European cousins of the time, aimed at reforms and not revolutions. Their strict neutrality qualified the Netherlands as host for the great congresses of 1899 and 1905, during which, among other things, the Den Haag Convention with Respect to the Laws and Customs of War on Land was agreed upon. After the country had preserved its neutrality during the Weltkrieg, Netherlands had special relationships with Germany, in particular in economy...The rising economic problems in Germany, if they extends to the Low Countries, would break an emotional barrier in the heart of the Dutch people, hesitating over French syndicalism or the dreams of Greater Netherlands...

English: Though once a border territory of the Mayan Empire, Honduras became a colony of Spain by the 1700's, with Britain controlling the Eastern coast (which was seized in order to combat Caribbean piracy). With independence from Spain in 1821 Honduras, like the other nations of Central America, slid into a period of continued unrest. Since the early 1900's, however, foreign fruit companies, particularly the rivals United Fruit and Standard Fruit, have dominated Honduran politics. Their grip over the banana trade, which made up for over two-thirds of Honduran exports, led to the phrase 'Banana Republic' being coined in reference to Honduras. The fall of banana prices during the Great Depression would lead to a period of instability culminating in an insurrection by liberals in protest of the (surprisingly fair) election of the pro-military Tiburcio Carías Andino. The resulting crackdown would soon put an end not only to those who had risen against Carías, but also to any form of political dissent. Honduras, like so many other Latin American countries of the period, was now in the hands of a rabidly anti-communist, pseudo-fascist dictator.
French: L’ancien territoire frontalier de l’empire Maya, le Honduras, devient, au 17e siècle, une colonie espagnole dont les Britanniques contrôlent la côte est (pour parer aux attaques pirates des Caraïbes). En 1821, le Honduras se libère de l’emprise espagnole pour entrer, au même titre que les autres nations d’Amérique centrale, dans une période de trouble et de révoltes. Depuis le début du 19e siècle, la politique hondurienne est passée aux mains de compagnies fruitières étrangères dont les deux rivaux particulièrement influents : United Fruit et Standard Fruit. La mainmise de ces entreprises sur le commerce des bananes (représentant les deux tiers du commerce national) donne naissance à l’expression de “république bananière” faisant directement référence à la situation du Honduras. La chute du prix de la banane pendant la Grande Dépression plonge le pays dans une longue période d’instabilité. Le point culminant de cette révolte est l’insurrection des libéraux en guise de protestation contre l’élection (étonnamment juste) du dirigeant pro-militariste Tiburcio Carías Andino. Les mesures répressives qui s’ensuivent mettent fin à toute forme de dissidence politique. Comme nombre de pays latino-américains, le Honduras est désormais gouverné par un dictateur pseudo-fasciste farouchement anti-communiste.
Italian: Nonostante un tempo confinasse con l'Impero Maya, l'Honduras divenne una colonia spagnola dal 1700, con gli inglesi che controllavano la costa orientale (che venne presa per combattere la pirateria nei Carabi). Ottenuta l'indipendenza dalla Spagna nel 1821, l'Honduras, come nessun'altra nazione del Centro America, scivolò in un periodo di continui tumulti. Sin dai primi del 1900, tuttavia, le compagnie frutticole straniere, in particolare le rivali United Fruit e Standard Fruit, iniziarono a dominare la politica honduregna. Il loro controllo sul commercio delle banane, che costituiva i due terzi delle esportazioni dell'Honduras, portò alla coniazione del nome 'Repubblica delle banane'. Il crollo dei prezzi delle banane durante la grande depressione portò a un periodo di instabilità, culminata con l'insurrezione dei liberali contro l'elezione di Tiburcio Carías Andino. Il conseguente inasprimento avrebbe presto portato all'eliminazione degli oppositori di Carías e di ogni forma di dissenso politico. L'Honduras, come molti altri paesi dell'America Latina, si trovava ora nelle mani di un dittatore anti-comunista e pseudo-fascista.
Spanish: Aunque antaño era un territorio fronterizo del imperio maya, Honduras se convirtió en una colonia española en el siglo XVIII, con la costa oriental en manos de Gran Bretaña (que la ocupó para combatir la piratería en el Caribe). Al independizarse de España en 1821, Honduras, al igual que las demás naciones centroamericanas, cayó en un periodo de permanentes disturbios. Sin embargo, desde principios del siglo XX, las compañías fruteras extranjeras, especialmente las rivales United Fruit y Standard Fruit, han dominado la política hondureña. Su control sobre el comercio bananero, que supone más de dos tercios de las exportaciones del país, llevó al nacimiento de la expresión 'república bananera' en referencia a Honduras. La caída de los precios de la banana durante la Gran Depresión llevó a un periodo de inestabilidad que culminó en la insurrección de los liberales en protesta por la elección del promilitar Tiburcio Carías Andino, sorprendentemente justa. Las resultantes medidas enérgicas pronto pusieron fin no sólo a aquellos que se habían levantado contra Carías, sino a cualquier forma de disensión política. Honduras, como tantos otros países latinoamericanos de ese tiempo, estaba ahora en manos de un dictador pseudofascista y rabiosamente anticomunista.
German: Obwohl es einst ein Grenzgebiet des Mayareichs gewesen war, wurde Honduras um 1700 zu einer spanischen Kolonie, deren Ostküste (annektiert zur Bekämpfung der karibischen Piraterie) unter britischer Kontrolle stand. Als Honduras 1821 seine Unabhängigkeit von Spanien erreichte, fiel es wie so viele zentralamerikanische Länder in eine Phase fortwährender Unruhen. Seit dem frühen 20. Jahrhundert wurde die honduranische Politik von ausländischen Fruchtimporteuren, besonders den konkurrierenden Unternehmen United Fruit und Standard Fruit, bestimmt. Deren Kontrolle des Bananenhandels, der mehr als zwei Drittel der honduranischen Exporte ausmachte, führte zur Prägung des Begriffs 'Bananenrepublik' in Bezug auf Honduras. Der Fall der Bananenpreise während der Großen Depression führte zu einer Instabilitätsphase, die als Protest gegen die (überraschend faire) Wahl des militärfreundlichen Tiburcio Carías Andino in einem Aufruhr der Liberalen gipfelte. Die darauffolgende Razzia erledigte nicht nur jene, die sich gegen Carías erhoben hatten, sondern alle politisch Andersdenkende. Honduras befand sich nun wie so viele lateinamerikanische Länder dieser Zeit in den Händen eines anti-kommunistischen, pseudo-faschistischen Diktators.

English: Before 1914 the Kingdom of Hungary regarded itself as a Great Power in its own right, as it constituted one half of the powerful Habsburg Dual-Monarchy. Victory in the Weltkrieg bought the Kingdom territorial gains at the expense of Serbia and Romania, but not the dominant position in the East that the Hungarians expected. While its agrarian economy has not fared well in the face of cheap grain from the new Eastern Kingdoms (particularly Ukraine), the political troubles in Austria and the weak Imperial authority under the adolescent Emperor Otto has allowed the Magyars to follow a more independent line.A Hungarian national army has been formed, and a new strain of aggressive and expansionist nationalism, determined to ‘Magyarise’ the divided peoples of the Balkans, has come to the fore of Hungarian politics. While German meddling in 1927 prevented the Hungarians from cementing their dominant position in the Dual Monarchy, the next Ausgleich renegotiation should be the time when the whole of the Crown Lands of St. Stephen will finally be restored to the Magyar nation.
French: Peu de temps après l’armistice de novembre 1918, la Hongrie est déclarée indépendante par le conseil national démocratique dirigé par le premier ministre Mihály Károlyi de Nagykároly. Les pays voisins dont la Roumanie et le jeune Royaume des Serbes, des Slovènes et des Croates saisissent alors leur chance de conquérir de nouveaux territoires. Des conflits internes relatifs à la constitution de la nouvelle République contraignent le gouvernement de Károlyi à démissionner pour céder la place à la coalition communiste et sociale-démocrate. La République des conseils hongroise est instaurée par le gouvernement de Béla Kun mais les tentatives de réforme sociale plongent rapidement le pays dans un climat de violents conflits. Les forces de la Restauration, soutenues par des troupes tchèques et roumaines, renversent en quelques mois la République, laissant le pays en proie à la “terreur blanche” qui coûtera la vie à de nombreux sympathisants de gauche. La situation demeure trouble. Après les élections de 1920, la Hongrie adopte une constitution intégrant à la fois des clauses autocratiques et parlementaires. On contourne le problème de l’accession au trône du dernier des Habsbourg, Charles IV, en recourant à un compromis. La place du monarque est occupée par un administrateur nommé par l’ancien amiral de la marine, Miklós Horthy. Dans le traité de paix de Trianon, signé en 1920, la Hongrie reconnaît officiellement les revendications territoriales d’un certain nombre de pays. Elle finit donc par céder la Slovaquie aux Tchécoslovaques, la Transylvanie aux Roumains et la Croatie ainsi que la Slovénie aux Yougoslaves. Après l’application du traité, la Hongrie perd 70 pour cent de son territoire et 65 pour cent de sa population. Tandis que Horthy profite de sa situation politique pour ôter tout pouvoir au parlement et persécuter les forces démocratiques, les défenseurs de Charles IV tentent, sans succès, deux coups d’Etat pour remettre le roi sur le trône. La politique de Horthy conduit droit à la Grande Dépression, doublée d’un certain nombre de tensions sociales. La réponse du chef de l’Etat consiste alors à nommer au poste de premier ministre, le conservateur Gyula Hömbös (1932-1936) qui procède immédiatement à un rapprochement avec l’Allemagne nazie et l’Italie fasciste.
Italian: Subito dopo l'armistizio del novembre 1918, un consiglio nazionale democratico guidato dal primo ministro Mihály Count Károlyi, proclamò l'Ungheria una repubblica indipendente. Gli stati confinanti, specialmente la Romania e il nuovo regno di Serbia, Slovenia e Croazia, approfittarono dell'occasione per mettere a segno delle conquiste territoriali. Le dispute interne sul progetto futuro della repubblica, costrinsero il governo di Károlyi a dimettersi in favore del partito socialista ungherese, una coalizione formata da comunisti e socialdemocratici. Sotto la guida di Béla Kun, venne instaurato un consiglio repubblicano. I tentativi di forzare le riforme sociali, portarono presto a violenti conflitti. Con l'aiuto delle truppe cecoslovacche e rumene, le forze della restaurazione riuscirono ad abbattere la repubblica in un paio di mesi, portando al 'terrore bianco' che costò la vita a molti sostenitori dell'ala di sinistra. La situazione rimase confusa. Dopo le elezioni del 1920, venne ratificata una costituzione contenente sia elementi autocratici che parlamentari. Il problema se nominare o meno re d'Ungheria l'ultimo discendente degli Asburgo, Carlo IV, fu risolto con un compromesso, nominando al posto di un monarca un amministratore, nella persona dell'ex ammiraglio della marina Miklós Horthy. Nel trattato di pace di Trianon (1920), l'Ungheria riconosceva formalmente molti diritti territoriali: la Slovacchia ai cecoslovacchi, il Siebenbürgen ai rumeni e la Croazia e la Slovenia agli jugoslavi. L'Ungheria perse il 70 percento del proprio territorio e il 65 percento della popolazione. Due colpi di stato nel 1921, tentarono invano di portare sul trono Carlo IV, mentre Horthy sfruttava la sua posizione per prendere il potere dal parlamento e perseguitare le forze democratiche. Alla grande depressione e alle tensioni sociali che l'accompagnarono, Horthy rispose nominando primo ministro l'ultra conservatore Gyula Hömbös (1932-1936) che avrebbe condotto il riavvicinamento dell'Ungheria alla Germania nazista e all'Italia fascista.
Spanish: Poco después del armisticio de noviembre de 1918, un consejo nacional democrático liderado por el Primer Ministro Mihály Károlyi declaró a Hungría república independiente. Los países vecinos, sobre todo Rumania y el nuevo reino de los serbios, eslovenos y croatas, se aprovecharon de la oportunidad para obtener beneficios territoriales. Disputas internas sobre el futuro diseño de la república forzaron la dimisión del gobierno de Károlyi y llegó al poder el Partido Socialista de Hungría, una coalición de comunistas y socialdemócratas. Bajo el liderazgo de Béla Kun se estableció una República de Consejos. Sin embargo, sus intentos de llevar a cabo reformas sociales pronto condujeron a violentos conflictos. Con la ayuda de tropas checoslovacas y rumanas, las fuerzas de restauración consiguieron aplastar a la República en cuestión de meses, lo que al principio llevó al 'terror blanco', que costó la vida a muchos partidarios de la izquierda política. La situación siguió siendo poco clara. Tras las elecciones de 1920 se ratificó una constitución que contenía elementos tanto autocráticos como parlamentarios. La cuestión de si el último de los Habsburgo, Carlos IV, iba a convertirse en rey de Hungría se resolvió con un compromiso. En lugar de un monarca, se nombró a un administrador: el antiguo almirante de marina Miklós Horthy. En el tratado de paz de Trianón de 1920, Hungría reconocía oficialmente muchas exigencias territoriales: la de Eslovaquia por parte de los checoslovacos, la de Transilvania por parte de Rumania y la de Croacia y Eslovenia por parte de Yugoslavia. Hungría había perdido el 70 por ciento de su territorio y el 65 por ciento de su población. Dos intentos de golpe de estado en 1921 con la intención de subir a Carlos IV al trono acabaron en fracaso, mientras que Horthy se aprovechó de su posición para arrebatarle poderes al parlamento y perseguir a las fuerzas democráticas. La reacción de Horthy a la Gran Depresión y a las tensiones sociales que la acompañaban fue nombrar primer ministro (1932-1936) al conservador Gyula Hömbös, que dirigió el acercamiento de Hungría a la Alemania nazi y la Italia fascista.
German: Kurz nach dem Waffenstillstand vom November 1918 deklarierte der demokratische Nationalrat unter Premierminister Mihály Count Károlyi die unabhängige Republik Ungarn. Die Nachbarländer, dabei besonders Rumänen und das neue Königreich der Serben, Slowenen und Kroaten nutzten diese Gelegenheit für Gebietseroberungen. Innenpolitische Streitigkeiten bezüglich der Zukunftspläne der Republik zwang die Regierung Károlyi zum Rücktritt, worauf die sozialistische Partei Ungarns – eine Koalition aus Kommunisten und Sozialdemokraten – an die Macht kam und unter der Führung von Béla Kun einen Volksrat schuf. Ihre Versuche, Sozialreformen zu erzwingen, führten jedoch schnell zu gewalttätigen Auseinandersetzungen: Mit Hilfe von tschechischen und rumänischen Truppen schafften es die restaurativen Kräfte, die Republik innerhalb von Monaten zu zerschmettern, wobei im Zuge des 'Weißen Terrors' viele Anhänger der politischen Linken ihr Leben ließen. Die Lage blieb unübersichtlich: Nach den Wahlen von 1920 wurde eine Verfassung ratifiziert, die sowohl autokratische als auch parlamentarische Elemente enthielt. Die Frage, ob der letzte Habsburger, Karl IV., als König von Ungarn gekrönt werden sollte, wurde mittels Kompromiss gelöst: Anstatt eines Monarchen wurde der ehemalige Marinegeneral Miklós Horthy als Verwalter ernannt. Im Friedensvertrag von Trianon von 1920 erkannte Ungarn viele ehemals eigene Gebietsansprüche an, nämlich die der Tschechoslowaken auf die Slowakei, die der Rumänen auf Siebenbürgern und die der Jugoslawen auf Kroatien und Slowenien. Ungarn hatte 70 Prozent seiner Fläche und 65 Prozent seiner Bevölkerung verloren. Zwei Putschversuche zur Entmachtung Karls IV. scheiterten 1921. Horthy nutzte seine Position dazu aus, um dem Parlament seine Macht zu rauben und demokratische Kräfte zu verfolgen. Horthy reagierte auf die Große Depression und die damit verbundenen gesellschaftlichen Spannungen mit der Ernennung des ultrakonservativen Gyula Hömbös zum Premierminister (1932 - 1936). Dieser sollte die Wiederannäherung Ungarns an Nazideutschland und an das faschistische Italien fortführen.

English: While the 'Peace with Honor' guaranteed Japan's rule of her overseas territories, most importantly Korea, the situation in Japan was already critical well before the end of Weltkrieg. Japan's once booming economy had turned to ashes immediately after the collapse of France and the gap between social classes continued to widen. Starting with the Rice Riot of 1918, the later period of the Taisho Era (1912-1926) witnessed severe economic crises and social conflict. Also one of the greatest natural disasters in human history happened, the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923, which was then followed by an anarchist rebellion influenced by France's syndicalist revolution. After a failed attempt on Regent Hirohito's life by a lone anarchist, martial law was declared for the first time in Japanese history. General Tanaka Giichi (1864-1936) formed a cabinet with support from the Genro and Seiyuhonto (splinter groups of the Seiyukai), and then introduced the Peace Preservation Law which symbolized the Draconian rule of Tanaka. However, with collapse of the British Empire and with the economic depression in America, Japan's export-led economy continued free fall with no end in sight. 1926 saw a series of massive bank closures at home and German military intervention in China. As Tanaka was incapable to protect Japan's interest in China or stabilise financial system, the weakness of his rule was exposed. By April of that year, the two main opposition parties, Seiyukai and Kenseikai, formed a coalition and and started so-called 'the 2nd Movement to Protect the Constitution'. With popular support for the opposition and Prince Regent's indirect intervention, Tanaka was forced to resign. The coalition cabinet was formed, marking the beginning of democratic governance, universal suffrage and party-based cabinet. The coalition however, collapsed over the issue of intervention in Manchuria. Prime minister Inukai Tsuyoshi, and his Seiyukai cabinet, was determined to support Zhang Zuelin, the Warlord of Manchuria in an attempt to alleviate or resolve a number of economic difficulties, and prevent a complete German domination of China. On June 4 Japanese troops crossed the Manchurian border and quickly occupied all of Manchuria. Further advances were halted however due to diplomatic pressure emanating from Berlin. Nevertheless the success of the campaign helped to solidify the strong position of the military, most of whom felt the way forwards was to seek further conquests elsewhere. The chaotic year of 1926 ended with the death of Emperor Taisho and his son Hirohito assumed the throne. The next nine years saw mild economic recovery and peaceful political developments. Japan in 1936 is poised to extend her empire, with Germany's dominance of the world appearing to be in decline the Japanese look greedily at both the remaining Qing Chinese territories and the German pacific possessions.

General Tanaka Giichi (1864-1936) formed a cabinet with support from the Genro and Seiyuhonto (splinter groups of the Seiyukai), and then introduced the Peace Preservation Law which symbolized the Draconian rule of Tanaka. However, with collapse of the British Empire and with the economic depression in America, Japan's export-led economy continued free fall with no end in sight. 1926 saw a series of massive bank closures at home and German military intervention in China. As Tanaka was incapable to protect Japan's interest in China or stabilise financial system, the weakness of his rule was exposed. By April of that year, the two main opposition parties, Seiyukai and Kenseikai, formed a coalition and and started so-called 'the 2nd Movement to Protect the Constitution'. With popular support for the opposition and Prince Regent's indirect intervention, Tanaka was forced to resign. The coalition cabinet was formed, marking the beginning of democratic governance, universal suffrage and party-based cabinet. The coalition however, collapsed over the issue of intervention in Manchuria. Prime minister Inukai Tsuyoshi, and his Seiyukai cabinet, was determined to support Zhang Zuelin, the Warlord of Manchuria in an attempt to alleviate or resolve a number of economic difficulties, and prevent a complete German domination of China. On June 4 Japanese troops crossed the Manchurian border and quickly occupied all of Manchuria. Further advances were halted however due to diplomatic pressure emanating from Berlin. Nevertheless the success of the campaign helped to solidify the strong position of the military, most of whom felt the way forwards was to seek further conquests elsewhere. The chaotic year of 1926 ended with the death of Emperor Taisho and his son Hirohito assumed the throne. The next nine years saw mild economic recovery and peaceful political developments. Japan in 1936 is poised to extend her empire, with Germany's dominance of the world appearing to be in decline the Japanese look greedily at both the remaining Qing Chinese territories and the German pacific possessions.

English: Alash Autonomy occupies the lands of the former Steppe General Governorship of the Tsarist Empire. During the chaos of the civil war, a party of Kazakh nationalists unsuccessfully pushed for national independence or at least for limited autonomy but with their inablity to form their own armed forces and seize control over the the lands of the Steppe General Governorship, Alash Autonomy of 1917 was in name only. Territory of the future Alash Autonomy was controlled by the anti-bolshevik White Army and the appointed administrator. The Minsk treaty signed on the 5th of September, 1920 between German Empire and Russian Republic forced Russia to grant sizable autonomy to territories of the Steppe General Governorship, thus creating first national state of kazakh people. Economic crisis of 1925 allowed government of Alash Autonomy to further extend existing autonomy to become semi-independent. Turkestan, sensing weakness of Russian republic decided to launch attack with aim to seize territory of Alash Autonomy and create Central Asian caliphate. Russian army eventually manage to repel the invaders, but because they didn't react fast enough during the initial phases of the war and due to the Kolchak coup, local government managed to gather enough authority and support from the people to push for almost independent state. During the second half 1920s and early 1930s the country managed to improve it’s industrial base and to start creating it’s own army. Despite this, the position of the Alash Autonomy is precarious. The Union of Turkestan to the South seeks to create a single Islamic Caliphate across the whole of Central Asia, and therefore poses an immediate threat. Additionally, while Russia has remained in a state of perpetual crisis for almost two decades, any Russian resurgence could be fatal for Alash Autonomy - particularly if a new Russian government plays on the divided loyalties inherent within existing ethnic groups of Alash Autonomy.

Korea was a vassal of Qing Dynasty for centuries under the rule of the Joseon Dynasty. After the Treaty of Shimonoseki in 1895 which ended the Sino-Japanese War, Korea became nominally independent but in truth it was a puppet state of Japan. In 1897 Korea was proclaimed to be an Empire to show it’s freedom from Chinese rule although the state became more and more Japanese dominated. In 1910 Emperor Sunjong was forced to sign the Japan-Korea Annexation Treaty and resign. After that Korea became a part of the Japanese Empire and started to support oppressing the local culture. Due to that aggressive policy strong partisan forces were formed against the Japanese rule. Now, finally after many years, Korea is a free nation again. The question is: what it will start with its newly given freedom?

English: The General Governorship of Turkestan of the Russian Empire was a region marked by strong divisions, inhabited by ethnic Uzbeks, Kazakhs, Turkmen, Tajiks, Kyrgyz and Russians, and the site of the three historic Khanates of Khiva, Bukhara and Samarkand. The Civil War saw a brutal and intense conflict in the region, as a variety of local resistance groups fought both the remnants of the old Tsarist colonial administration and the new Tashkent Soviet. After several years of war, the increasingly radicalized native population coalesced around the Sufi-influenced 'Army of Islam' in the Fergana Valley. This movement had established rule through Sharia law in Samarkand, Bukhara and Tashkent by 1925, and by 1933 the whole of former Tsarist Turkestan was under its control. After three years of consolidation and internal reconstruction, the rulers of the new Federation of Turkestan are becoming restless. Many are wondering why the expansion of the state has now stopped and an increasingly influential Clerical faction are calling for the establishment of a new Islamic Caliphate over all of the former lands of Tamerlane...

From 1262 until 1380, Iceland acknowledged the sovereignty of the Norwegian Kingship.  When Denmark and Norway were separated in 1814, Iceland became a purely Danish dominion.  In the century that followed, Iceland gained increasing national autonomy, obtaining limited home rule in 1874 and almost complete home rule in 1903.  With the end of Iceland's personal union with the Danish crown, the island has become an independent nation for the first time in almost eight centuries.

The cradle of civilization, home to several ancient Empires, Mesopotamia was ruled by the Ottoman Turks since 1534 as the pashalik of Baghdad. By the 17th century, the frequent conflicts with the Safavid dinasty of Persia had sapped the strength of the Ottoman Empire and weakened its grip over those provinces, to the point it actually lost control over the area between 1508–1533 and 1622–1638. During the years 1747–1831, the region was ruled by Mamluk officers until 1831, when the Ottomans managed to overthrow their autonomy and imposed direct control again. Mesopotamia once again attracted world attention following the increase in Ottoman-German relations in the late 19th century, culminating in the beginning of the construction of the Berlin-Baghdad Railway, which wold give Germany access to the Red Sea port of Basrah. During the Weitkrieg, Mesopotamia was part of the Middle East Theatre, being a battleground between the Central Powers and the Entente until the final German-Ottoman offensive of 1920 - not before, however, the British-sponsored Arab Revolts awakened nationalist sentiments in the entire Arabian peninsula. Following the end of the war, the Berlin-Baghdad Railway was completed and the oil industry started to develop. Dissent against the Sultan in Constantinople would exist, however, until the final demise of the Ottoman Empire. With the help of foreign powers and inspired by the Arab Revolts of the Weitkried, and independent Iraq was declared.

India finally achieved its de-facto independence in the aftermath of the British Revolution of 1925 as the Raj finally collapsed on itself. Rising to the mantle of governance was the Rajput maharaja of Bikaner, Ganga Singh whose authoritarian style of governing the newly freed Indian Dominion soon put him at odds with the leftist civilian opposition centred around the Indian National Congress and its militant underground supporters. Within months the INC’s denouncement of Singh’s negotiated Anglo-Indian Treaty brought the sub-continent to civil war. It was in this chaotic time that the southern princely states, citing the Anglo-Indian Treaty and numerous legal transgression of Ganga Singh as motivation, united behind Osman Ali Khan, the Nizam of Hyderabad, and declared him the true vice-roy of the Indian Dominion. As the civil war escalated into a confusing quagmire of violence Ali Khan failed to invade Singh’s northern power base, but succeeded in rooting out Socialist enclaves in Bombay and also prevented both the Delhi and Calcutta government from invading the Deccan Plateau. When peace finally came, the Princely Federation soon went about organizing a true nationalist successor government to the Raj, with Osman Ali Khan serving as Nizam-al-Mulk (Administrator of the Realm) and his fellow princes serving in an advisory as well as legislatively role in the so-called Council of Princes. By 1936, the Princely Federation is a brittle state, but never the less the closest India has to a conservative native government.

Throughout its history, the Indonesian archipelago had always been a home for diverse variety of cultures and backgrounds that vie to control the resourceful land and benefit from the islands geostrategically important location as a global trade lane. Few local powers have successfully managed to unite the diverse region under one banner, such as the Srivijayan Empire and the Majapahit Empire that ruled the archipelago for several centuries. Though even then, the control of the outlying regions remains relatively decentralized and neither empire was able to exert its influence much outside the archipelago. The arrival of Islam and then the Dutch ended the last major Indonesian local power and the archipelago returns to its initial squabbling regional rulers with varying self-interest, marking the death of any so-called united Indonesian identity. Centuries later, the long and perilous colonial rule of the Dutch paved way to the birth of a new united Indonesian identity that encompasses beyond the boundaries of cultural, ethnic, and religious differences under the notion of a common struggle against the Dutch. Organizations spearheading the more basic rights and welfare for native Indonesians popped up throughout the early years of the 20th century, followed by numerous pro-independence and self-determination newspapers and media outlets. Following the Weltkrieg and the syndicalist revolutions that spews afterwards, these organizations became more evolved and more politically oriented, dividing the opinions of the populace even further and forming new powerful factions from a coalition of leftist and syndicalist forces led by Munawar Muso, a league of nationalists with differing views of a hypothetical Indonesia, and even a pan-islamist political movement that involves both moderates and fundamentalists. Despite their core differences, these factions are currently in a fragile alliance against their common enemy, the Dutch. With syndicalism gaining strength throughout the globe and old empires getting increasingly shaky back home, native Indonesians are keen on paving their own path of self-determination while the similar echoes of giving the Indonesians more rights also persists in Netherlands itself. Whatever happens, the next decades will involve a massive conflict of interests within Indonesia that will form the core identity of the nation for years to come.

In the mid-19th century the Emerald Isle was economically weak and in perpetual crisis. Between 1845 and 1852 the potato harvest was completely destroyed and a famine known as The Great Hunger (an Gorta Mór) ravaged the land, leading to mass starvation and mass immigration of Irish to the United States. Gradually, voices for independence from the British Crown grew louder and louder. In 1914 Home Rule was supposed to be granted, but it was delayed with the outbreak of the Weltkrieg. Disappointment and simmering tensions culminated in the German-supported Easter Rising in 1916, though it was soon suppressed by the British Army. Continued unrest eventually ruptured into revolution, and in 1921 a peace treaty was finally signed between the Irish rebels and the British government. According to this treaty, all of Ireland was to be ruled from Dublin, the British-settled north was to receive special autonomous privileges, the new country was to be named the "Irish Free State", it would remain part of the British Empire, and the King would be the figurehead Head of State. The Free State was officially established on January 1st, 1922, and Michael Collins became its Taoiseach (Prime Minister). When the British Revolution occurred, Collins declared independence from Britain and dissolved the autonomy of the north. On October 24th, 1925, the Republic of Ireland was born. After a decade as President, in 1936 Collins still leads the nation without any serious opposition, riding on a wave of unbeatable public support. Officially its President, Michael Collins has become a de-facto dictator of the Irish Republic.

The unified Italy created in 1861 lasted little more than half a century. Her decision to side with the Entente powers rather than her traditional Central European allies during the Great War proved to be a mistake to the highest order. In 1919 Italy collapsed under a Central Powers' offensive, and the combination of anger at Italy's betrayal and the Austrian desire for a divided Italian peninsula led to the break-up of Italy as a nation. After three years of Austrian occupation a number of separate duchies were established in the north, grouped into a federation nominally headed by the Papacy, but with great regional autonomy. However in the early 1930's this began to change when a group of radical cardinals gained political control of the Vatican. Aided by Pope Pius XI this group pushed for the centralisation and expansion of Papal power and control over the federation. During this period Austria was distracted by internal affairs, and was reluctant to intervene in favour of the status quo. Playing on the massive popular support the Pope had and setting this in the context of needing a great leader to guard Italian Federation from the dangers of Syndicalism the Pope emerged as the formal leader of northern Italy in 1935. However, the Holy See must now face up to several challenges to its new power- ranging from the now demonised Syndicalist regimes to the south and west of the Federation, and also, having upset the balance of power, the Austrians. But opportunities beckon too - Carlists in Spain, Integralists in Brazil, even the mighty Zentrumspartei of Germany, are on the rise, and have always acknowledged the Spiritual Authority of the Heir of St. Peter…
French: L’Italie entre dans la Première Guerre mondiale avec l’espoir de conquérir des territoires austro-hongrois dans les Alpes et le long de l’Adriatique. Idéalement, elle souhaiterait même bénéficier du morcellement de l’Empire ottoman jugé alors comme un territoire moribond. Ses performances militaires se révèlent toutefois très décevantes et les puissances victorieuses se réunissant à Versailles lui cèdent moins de territoires qu’elle ne l’avait espéré. L’issue de cette guerre contribue donc à affaiblir davantage une démocratie en péril, ouvrant la voie, en 1922, à la tristement célèbre “Marche sur Rome” de Mussolini, qui instaure par la suite le premier régime fasciste dictatorial d’Europe. Afin de faire grimper la cote de popularité de son régime autocratique, Mussolini promet à son peuple de refaire de l’Italie une superpuissance. En 1936, il est prêt à conduire sa première attaque contre l’Abyssinie en espérant que la victoire permettra d’effacer la honte de la défaite italienne à Adoua, en 1898. Mussolini sait pourtant que cette attaque risque d’engendrer des conflits diplomatiques et il n’est pas certain que les modestes ressources industrielles italiennes supportent une guerre prolongée. Le sort de l’Italie fasciste demeure incertain...
Italian: L'Italia entrò nella Prima Guerra Mondiale con la speranza di ottenere territori sulle Alpi e lungo la costa adriatica dagli austro-ungarici, e forse di prendere parte all'invasione dell'impero ottomano ormai in declino. Le sue reali prestazioni in quella guerra, furono tuttavia sconcertanti, e la risoluzione di Versailles seguita all'armistizio, assegnò all'Italia molto meno di quanto si aspettava. Ciò contribuì a indebolire ulteriormente la già instabile democrazia parlamentare del paese, e a preparare la strada alla celebre marcia su Roma di Benito Mussolini (1922), che fece da preludio all'insediamento della prima dittatura fascista in Europa. Per accrescere il consenso del suo regime tirannico, Mussolini promise di fare nuovamente dell'Italia una grande potenza, di costruire un paese formidabile, forze aeree e navali, e di espandere l'impero coloniale italiano. Nel 1936, Mussolini ordinò un'offensiva contro l'Abissinia per cancellare la disonorevole sconfitta dell'Italia ad Adua nel 1898, ma quell'attacco ebbe sviluppi diplomatici controversi, e non era affatto chiaro se le modeste risorse industriali italiane fossero in grado di sostenere una guerra su vasta scala. Il destino dell'esperimento fascista italiano era quanto mai incerto.
Spanish: Italia entró en la Primera Guerra Mundial con grandes esperanzas de arrebatarle territorios en los Alpes y en la costa adriática al Imperio Austro-Húngaro y tal vez participar en la división del moribundo Imperio Otomano. Sin embargo, su actuación en esa guerra fue decepcionante y recibió menos de lo esperado en los acuerdos de Versalles que siguieron al Armisticio. Esto debilitó aún más su ya inestable democracia parlamentaria y abonó el terreno para la famosa 'Marcha sobre Roma' de Benito Mussolini en 1922, que ayudó a establecer la primera dictadura fascista de Europa. Para ayudar a reforzar la popularidad de su régimen autocrático, Mussolini prometió devolverle al país la condición de gran potencia, desarrollar un formidable ejército de tierra, mar y aire, y ampliar el imperio colonial italiano. En 1936 está preparado para dar su primer paso importante en esta campaña: una ofensiva contra los abisinios que eliminará (o eso espera) el ignominioso borrón de la derrota italiana de 1898 en Aduwa. Pero es seguro que este ataque será diplomáticamente controvertido, y no está nada claro que los modestos recursos industriales de Italia estén capacitados para mantener una guerra prolongada. La suerte del experimento fascista italiano es incierta.
German: Italien griff in den Ersten Weltkrieg mit hohen Erwartungen bezüglich Gebietsübernahmen in den Alpen und entlang der Adria von Österreich-Ungarn ein. Außerdem hoffte es, vielleicht sogar ein Stück vom Kuchen des morschen osmanischen Reiches abzubekommen. Seine tatsächliche Leistung in diesem Krieg war allerdings eher enttäuschend und es bekam im Vertrag von Versailles nach dem Waffenstillstand weit weniger zugesprochen, als es erhofft hatte. Dies schwächte die ohnehin schon belastete parlamentarische Demokratie des Landes noch weiter und bereitete den Weg für Benito Mussolinis berühmten 'Marsch auf Rom' von 1922 vor, der zur Einrichtung Europas erster faschistischer Diktatur führte. Um die Popularität seines autokratischen Regimes zu stärken versprach Mussolini, Italien wieder zu einer Großmacht zu machen, eindrucksvolle Streitkräfte zu Land, See und in der Luft aufzustellen und das italienische Kolonialreich zu erweitern. 1936 machte seine erfolgreiche Offensive gegen die Abessinier die unwürdige Niederlage bei Adowa von 1898 wieder gut, aber der Angriff riss eine gewaltige Kluft zwischen Italien und dem Westen auf. Soll Italien jetzt seinen Hut in den Ring werfen, da sich nun die Kriegswolken über Europa zusammenziehen? Kriegsbeute lockt, aber es ist noch lange nicht klar, ob Italiens bescheidene industrielle Ressourcen einen größeren Krieg tragen können. Das Schicksal des faschistischen Experiments in Italien ist ungewiss.

English: On March 3rd, 1918, Soviet Russia renounced its Baltic provinces in the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk. On March 8th and April 12th, the local Baltic German-dominated Kurlandische Landesrat and the Vereinigter Landesrat of Livland, Estland, Riga, and Ösel declared themselves independent states- the Duchy of Courland and the Baltic State. The two formed the United Baltic Duchy (Vereinigtes Baltisches Herzogtum), a client state of the German Empire with Adolf Friendrich zu Mecklenburg as Duke. The Baltische Landeswehr, formed hastily by the Duchy's government, scored a number of victories against an invading British force, local dissenting militias, as well as the Bolshevik forces that tried to retake the Baltic in their campaign for a communist state. The United Baltic Duchy profited from the German economic boom due to its great integration with Berlin, but did not escape the decline of the past few years. In the year 1936, the 'Eastern Rampart of the Empire' sees itself in an ever more tense geopolitical climate. Interior ethnic tensions caused by the radical government policy of bringing in German colonists, Finnish pretensions over Estland, Nordlivland and Ösel, vacillating loyalties in the other eastern states of the Reich, and finally the vast Russian Republic with its increasing political instability all pose a threat to the Baltic state. Will the Eastern Rampart hold fast?

First established in 1821 by the American Colonization Society as a homeland for freed African-American slaves (who either wanted to return to Africa to start a new life there or were forced to leave the United States), Liberia declared its independence in July 1847 - albeit the American government continues to exercise a great deal of influence in its internal affairs. Since its foundation, the country's political life has been dominated by the minority Americo-Liberians, descendants of the freed American slaves, which has brought the government in conflict with the several African native peoples of the area. These conflicts reached a peak in 1929, when a commission from the American government started investigating charges of slavery and forced labour involving the Liberian elite and several US mining and forestry interests. While trade of key raw materials with the US continues to be the main source of revenue for the Liberian government, the weak state of the American economy over the past decade has put the tiny country in jeopardy. The current political turmoil in North America, combined with the expansionist tendencies of National France and Mittelafrika, plus the possibility of a new round of turmoil by the largely disenfranchised native population, can either challenge the current political arrangement in Liberia, or cause the end of this republic altogether.

While trade of key raw materials with the US continues to be the main source of revenue for the Liberian government, the weak state of the American economy over the past decade has put the tiny country in jeopardy. The current political turmoil in North America, combined with the expansionist tendencies of National France and Mittelafrika, plus the possibility of a new round of turmoil by the largely disenfranchised native population, can either challenge the current political arrangement in Liberia, or cause the end of this republic altogether.

English: Following the Third Partition of Poland in 1795, Lithuania was split between the Russian Empire and Prussia, Russia getting most of the territory. After Napoleon's campaign in Russia ended in disaster, Tsar Nicholas I began an intensive program of Russification. The Lithuanians and Poles revolted twice, in 1831 and 1863, but both attempts failed. In 1864, the Lithuanian language and the Latin alphabet were banned in junior schools. Lithuanians resisted the Russification by arranging printings abroad and smuggling the books in. A national revival started among the poor in the late years of Russian occupation, then continued with the wealthy, then with the release of Lithuanian newspapers, Ausra and Varpas, and finally with the writing of poems and books in Lithuanian. These writings glorified the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, depicting the nation as powerful and full of heroes. This revival spearheaded an independence movement, with various organizations opposing Russian influence. Russian policy became harsher in response, leading to strikes on Catholic churches, while the ban on the Lithuanian press continued. During the Russia-wide revolutionary upsurge of 1905, a congress of Lithuanian representatives gathered in Vilnius on December 5th and demanded provincial autonomy. During the Weltkrieg, Lithuania's occupation by Germany and the subsequent collapse of the Russian imperial government led to the proclamation of an independent republic on February 16, 1918 under German control, but on the 11th of July 1918, Prince Wilhelm of Urach, Count of Württemberg was crowned as King Mindaugas II of Lithuania. Lithuania Minor, including the majority German city of Memel, was kept under Berlin's control. Mindaugas II died on the 24th of March 1928 and was succeeded by his son, crowned Mindaugas III. Now in 1936 the population is worried about continuing German influence in the Baltic and a "Speak Lithuanian!" movement has sprung up in response to the events that have happened in the Baltic Duchy vassal state to the north. Soon the king must decide between his allegiance to the Lithuanian people and the Kaiser.
French: La Lituanie profite de la fragilisation de la Russie tsariste pour faire quelques pas vers l’indépendance. De 1905 à 1907, les Lituaniens deviennent de plus en plus autonomes et appellent à la création d’une assemblée constitutionnelle. Pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, le pays est occupé par les Allemands mais il déclare son indépendance en 1918, après la révolution russe. L’Armée Rouge marche sur Vilnius pour forcer la Lituanie à réintégrer la Russie mais l’intervention des troupes allemandes et polonaises permet au pays de conserver son intégrité politique. La Pologne annexe toutefois Vilnius pendant la guerre russo-polonaise de 1920. La domination polonaise est officialisée par un référendum en 1922. En 1923, la Lituanie annexe la région de Memel qui avait subi la domination prussienne jusqu’en 1919, suivie du gouvernement des Alliés. La conférence des ambassadeurs de l’Alliance officialise l’annexion mais garantit à la région une autonomie interne. La période qui suit la Grande Guerre est marquée par une crise nationale. Le gouvernement décide de procéder à une réforme terrienne en 1922. Celle-ci consiste à confisquer les terres des grands propriétaires afin de leur retirer leur pouvoir économique et politique. Des tensions sociales croissantes permettent à l’armée et au parti nationaliste dirigé par Tautinenkae de renverser le gouvernement existant en 1926. La constitution républicaine est révoquée, laissant place à un régime autoritaire dirigé par Antanas Smetona. En 1934, la Lituanie forme l’Entente Balte avec la Lettonie et l’Estonie.
Italian: Col diminuire del potere della Russia zarista, la Lituania si avviò lentamente verso l'indipendenza. Nel 1905/07, il paese ricevette un'autonomia parziale e organizzò un'assemblea costituzionale. Durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale, la Lituania fu occupata dai tedeschi, e dopo il successo della rivoluzione russa, proclamò la propria indipendenza nel 1918 come repubblica democratica. Ciò provocò la marcia dell'Armata Rossa su Vilnius nel tentativo di riportare il giovane stato nella Russia, ma l'intervento delle truppe tedesche e polacche consentì di conservare l'integrità della Lituania. Ciononostante, la Polonia finì con l'annettere Vilnius durante la guerra russo-polacca del 1920, annessione che venne poi sancita da un referendum nel 1922. Nel 1923, la Lituania ha annesso l'area del Memel, che fino al 1919 era rimasta sotto il governo prussiano, e da allora era stata amministrata dagli alleati. La conferenza degli ambasciatori alleati, riconobbe l'annessione ma insisteva per concedere l'autonomia interna alla regione. Il periodo seguente la Grande Guerra fu caratterizzato da una crisi interna lituana. Nel 1922, il governo avviò una riforma della terra, sottraendola ai grossi proprietari terrieri anche per assecondare la propria leadership economica e politica. La tensione sociale continuava ad aumentare portando, nel 1926, alla caduta del governo da parte dell'esercito e del partito di destra Tautinenkae. La costituzione repubblicana venne sostituita da un regime autoritario sotto Antanas Smetona. Nel 1934, è stata costituita l'intesa baltica con Lettonia ed Estonia.
Spanish: A medida que menguaba el poder de la Rusia zarista, Lituania fue avanzando con lentitud hacia la independencia. En 1905-07, recibió una autonomía parcial y se convocó una asamblea constitucional. Durante la Primera Guerra Mundial, el país fue ocupado por los alemanes y, tras el éxito de la Revolución Rusa, en 1918 declararon su independencia como república democrática. Esto hizo que el Ejército Rojo marchase sobre Vilna para devolver al joven estado al seno de Rusia, pero la intervención de las tropas alemanas y polacas preservó la integridad lituana. A pesar de todo, Polonia se anexionó Vilna durante la Guerra Ruso-polaca de 1920. Esta anexión fue reconocida en 1922 por medio de un referéndum. En 1923, Lituania se anexionó la zona de Memel, que hasta 1919 había estado en manos de Prusia y desde entonces había sido administrada por los Aliados. La conferencia de los embajadores de los Aliados reconoció la anexión, pero insistió en que la región debía tener una autonomía en asuntos internos. Los tiempos posteriores a la Gran Guerra en Lituania se vieron marcados por una crisis interna. El gobierno decidió una reforma agraria en 1922, expropiando tierras a los grandes terratenientes y arrebatándoles a la vez su liderato político y económico. Las tensiones sociales siguieron en aumento, hasta que el ejército y el derechista partido Tautinenkae derrocaron al gobierno en 1926. La constitución republicana fue derogada y se instauró un régimen autoritario bajo el liderazgo de Antanas Smetona. En 1934 se formó la Entente Báltica junto con Letonia y Estonia.
German: Mit schwindender Macht des zaristischen Russlands machte Litauen die ersten zögerlichen Schritte in die Unabhängigkeit. 1905/07 erhielt es teilweise Autonomie und forderte eine Verfassungsversammlung. Während des Ersten Weltkriegs wurde das Land von den Deutschen besetzt und rief nach dem Erfolg der Russischen Revolution 1918 eine demokratische Republik aus. Dies veranlasste die Russen, in Vilnius einzumarschieren, um den jungen Staat Russland wieder einzuverleiben, aber die Intervention deutscher und polnischer Truppen verhinderte Litauens Integrierung. Nichtsdestotrotz annektierte Polen Vilnius im Russisch-Polnischen Krieg 1920. Diese Annexion wurde 1922 von einem Referendum anerkannt. 1923 annektierte Litauen das Memelgebiet, welches bis 1919 unter preußischer Herrschaft und danach unter alliierter Verwaltung gestanden hatte. Die Konferenz der alliierten Botschafter erkannte die Annektierung an, bestand aber auf interner Autonomie für die Region. Die Zeit nach dem Großen Krieg war von internen Krisen in Litauen geprägt. 1922 entschied die Regierung über eine Landreform, während deren Verlauf sie den Großgrundbesitzern Land abnahm und sie ihrer politischen und wirtschaftlichen Führung beraubte. Soziale Spannungen wuchsen und führten 1926 zum Sturz der Regierung durch die Armee und die rechtsgerichtete Tautinenkae-Partei. Die republikanische Verfassung wurde gekippt und ein autoritäres Regime unter Antanas Smetona eingesetzt. 1934 wurde mit Lettland und Estland die Baltische Entente geformt.

English: A strategic fortress since the Roman era and an independent nation since the Middle Ages, the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg sat in the middle of the battleground between Germany and France in the Weitkrieg. The country was annexed into the Reich as a constituent nation following the Peace with Honour in 1921, with the Grand Duchy enlarged to include former Belgian Luxemburg. Following the dismantling of the German Empire in the aftermath of the Second Weltkrieg, Luxembourg regained its independence.
French: Le congrès de Vienne de 1814-1815 proclame l’intégration du Grand Duché du Luxembourg au royaume néerlandais. En tant que Grand Duc du Luxembourg, le roi hollandais fait également partie de la ligue germanique. Après l’indépendance de la Belgique, proclamée en 1831, le protocole de Londres de 1839 contraint le Luxembourg à céder ses territoires wallons à la Belgique. Les Hollandais tentent de vendre le Grand Duché à la France après la dissolution de la ligue germanique en 1866. Le Luxembourg entre dès lors dans une période de crise qui prend fin lorsque le pays devient définitivement neutre et indépendant. L’union avec les Pays-Bas se termine en 1890 à la mort de Guillaume III, le dernier héritier masculin de la dynastie Orange-Nassau. La loi salique du Luxembourg ne permet pas aux femmes de monter sur le trône. Pendant la Première Guerre mondiale, l’Allemagne ne se soucie pas de la neutralité du pays et décide d’occuper le Grand Duché.
Italian: Il congresso di Vienna del 1814/15, aveva proclamato il Lussemburgo un Gran Ducato e lo aveva reso parte del Regno d'Olanda. Il re olandese era, in quanto allo stesso tempo Gran Duca di Lussemburgo, membro della lega tedesca. Dopo l'indipendenza del Belgio nel 1831, il Lussemburgo fu costretto dal protocollo di Londra (1939), a restituire i suoi territori valloni al Belgio. I tentativi degli olandesi di vendere il Gran Ducato alla Francia dopo la fine della lega tedesca nel 1866, causarono la crisi del Lussemburgo che terminò con la dichiarazione formale di indipendenza e neutralità per il piccolo paese. Con la morte dell'ultimo erede maschio della casa Orange-Nassau, Wilhelm III (1890), fu sancita la fine dell'unione con l'Olanda. La legge Salian del Lussemburgo non permetteva infatti agli eredi femmine di succedere alla corona. Durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale, la Germania non rispettò la neutralità del paese, occupando il Gran Ducato.
Spanish: El Congreso de Viena de 1814-15 proclamó Gran Ducado a Luxemburgo y lo convirtió en parte del reino de Holanda. El rey holandés, como gran duque de Luxemburgo, era al mismo tiempo parte de la Confederación Alemana. Tras la independencia de Bélgica en 1831, se le obligó a entregarle a ésta sus territorios valones por orden del Protocolo de Londres de 1839. Los intentos holandeses de vender el gran ducado a los franceses tras la extinción de la Confederación Alemana en 1866 causaron la Crisis de Luxemburgo, que acabó con la concesión oficial de independencia y neutralidad al pequeño país. La unión personal con Holanda llegó a su fin en 1890, con la muerte de Guillermo III, último heredero varón de la casa de Orange-Nassau. La Ley Sálica que regía en Luxemburgo no permitía el acceso de mujeres al trono. Durante la Primera Guerra Mundial, Alemania no respetó la neutralidad del país y ocupó el gran ducado.
German: Der Wiener Kongress von 1814/15 erklärte Luxemburg zu einem Großherzogtum und gliederte es in das Niederländischen Königreich ein. Der holländische König war als Großherzog von Luxemburg zur gleichen Zeit ein Mitglied des Deutschen Bundes. Nach der Ausrufung der belgischen Unabhängigkeit 1831 musste Holland gemäß dem Londoner Protokoll von 1839 sein wallonisches Gebiet an Belgien abtreten. Die holländischen Versuche, das Großherzogtum nach Auflösung des Deutschen Bundes 1866 an die Franzosen zu verkaufen, erzeugte die Luxemburger Krise, die damit endete, dass dem kleinen Land formal die Unabhängigkeit und Neutralität zugesprochen wurde. Die Personalunion mit den Niederlanden endete 1890 mit dem Tod Wilhelms III., des letzten männlichen Thronfolgers des Hauses Oranien-Nassau, und das Salische Recht Luxemburgs erlaubte keine weiblichen Thronfolger. Während des ersten Weltkrieges missachtete Deutschland die Neutralität des Landes und besetzte das Großherzogtum.

English: Libya’s position in the world has always been that of a servant. Long servants of the Porte, this changed in 1911 when Italy defeated the Ottomans and took control of what was the province of Tripolitania. During the Weltkrieg, The Sennusi revolted, but were defeated. During this time Idris I would rise to prominence in keeping The Sennusi order alive and fighting, hoping to win independence. When Italy later surrendered to the Central Powers in 1919, the Ottomans regained Libya as part of their Empire. Idris was exiled into Egypt, and a more loyal Ottoman administration was installed. However, despite their victory in the Weltkrieg, The Sublime Porte proved weak. Through the 1920’s, Tripolitania remained loyal and mostly stable. But events elsewhere in the Islamic world might change that. In 1925 Egypt became independent from the British, and now are itching to rally the Arabs to the cause of throwing off Turkish hegemony in the region. The Ottomans may well struggle to retain control of the region, and Idris is still very much at large…
